translation:
adj. 每日的，日常的; 一日的; 每日一次的; 每个工作日的
n. 日报; （不寄宿的）仆人，白天做家务的女佣
adv. 每日; 逐日; 每周日; 日复一日地

分布：每日(51%)，日报(23%)，日常的(10%)，天天(9%)，每日的(7%)


→来自day的形容词。
a.每日的ad.每日,天天n.日报Details about the tailor's tail are available from the prevailing dailies.有关我缝在尾巴的细节可从流行的日报上得到.



adverb adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■happening on or relating to every day 每天（的），天天（的）
•Take the tablets twice daily.药片日服两次。

•Exercise has become part of my daily routine.锻炼已经成为我日常生活的一部分。

•We back up our computer files at work on a daily basis.我们每天工作时都要把电脑文件进行备份。

•She's looking forward to retiring and ending the daily grind (= hard, boring work or duty) of working in an office.她正盼着早日退休，不用再天天在办公室里受煎熬。

['deɪ.li] noun countable UK old-fashioned informal ■a person who is employed to clean someone else's home （受雇为别人打扫家居的）清洁工，佣人




everyday, daily

这组词都有“每天的，日常的”的意思，其区别是：
everyday: 一般日常用词，指日常发生的、无须特别关心的。
daily: 普通用词，特指每天发生一次的，也可指按日计的。


adj. 日常的；每日的
 - everyday, household, routine
n. 日报；朝来夜去的女佣
 - journal
adv. 日常地；每日；天天
 - habitually, diurnally
examples: 英 ['deɪli] 美 ['deɪli]
adj.每日的；日常的adv.每日；天天n.日报(复)dailies：工作样片.

(1) He writes for the daily newspaper.(2) As a result, daily output has doubled.(3) Daily practice is the trick in learning a foreign language.(4) I need a holiday as a relief from the daily grind.(5) The bakery serves us with fresh bread daily.(6) The stores are open daily except on Sundays.(7) I like to read China Daily on my way home.
(1) 他为那家日报撰稿。(2) 结果日产量翻了一番。(3) 每天练习是学会一门外语的诀窍。(4) 我需要休假以摆脱单调的日常工作。(5) 面包店每天都给我们提供新鲜面包。(6) 除了星期天以外,那些商店天天都营业。(7) 我喜欢在回家的途中阅读《中国日报》。

translation:
n. 牛奶场; 乳品店; 牛奶及乳品业
adj. 牛奶的; 奶制的; 乳品的; 乳品业的

分布：乳制品(69%)，牛奶场(11%)，乳制品的(9%)，乳品店(7%)，牛奶的(3%)，地方小店(1%)


→来自dheigh, 挤，捏，形成，词源同dough, fiction.-iry, 地名后缀。即挤奶的地方。
n.牛奶场,奶店On the impaired dairy the chairman lay in a pair of repaired chairs for haircut.在遭到损害的牛奶场,主席躺在一对修理过的椅子上理发.



US ['der.i] adjective  ADVANCED  ■used to refer to cows that are used for producing milk, rather than meat, or to foods which are made from milk, such as cream, butter and cheese 奶牛的；奶制品的，乳品的
•dairy cattle奶牛

•dairy farmers乳品场工人

•dairy products奶制品

UK ['deə.ri] US ['der.i] noun countable ■a place on a farm where milk and cream are kept and cheese and butter are made, or a company which supplies milk and products made from milk 牛奶场，乳品场，制酪场；牛奶公司，奶制品公司



n. 奶制品；乳牛；制酪场； [食品] 乳品店；牛奶及乳品业
 - milker, milking cow
adj. [食品] 乳品的；牛奶的；牛奶制的；产乳的
 - milky
examples: 英 ['deəri] 美 ['deri]
n.牛奶场；乳品店；乳制品；地方小店adj.牛奶的；乳制品的

(1) Milk, butter and cheese are brought in here from dairy farms .(2) The yogurt sold by this dairy is delicious.(3) Go and buy me some cleese at the dairy.(4) My hometown produces many dairy products.(5) Low-fat dairy foods may lower women's diabetes risk(6) The dairy cattle are going to come in.(7) More vegetables, more milk and more dairy produce were consumed, and diet became more varied;(8) Dairy products may provoke allergic reactions in some people.(9) The company is committed to the domestic large dairy farm milking workshop equipment building.
(1) 牛奶、奶油、奶酪从牛奶场运到这里。(2) 这家乳品店出售的酸奶非常好喝。(3) 去乳品店帮我买些奶酷。(4) 我的家乡富产乳制品。(5) 低脂乳制品也许能降低女性患糖尿病风险(6) 奶牛要产仔了。(7) 人们消费的蔬菜,牛奶及奶制品越来越多,饮食种类愈加丰富;(8) 奶制品可能会引起某些人的过敏反应。(9) 本公司主要致力于国内各大型奶牛场挤奶车间设备建设。
[sound:youdao-867bd7f0-c3140bef-07a0c199-30cfea34-337eaa89.mp3]

translation:
n. 水坝，堰; 水库; （牙科用的）橡皮障; 〈比喻〉障碍
vt. 用水坝阻止; 阻塞，抑制

时态：dammed, damming, dams
分布：水坝(62%)，堤(25%)，筑坝(11%)，障碍物(2%)


→词源不详，可能来自Proto-Germanic*dammaz, 缝纫，修补。
n.水坝,水闸He stamped on the stamps and slammed the lamp on the damp dam.他用脚踩邮票并将灯砰地摔在潮湿的坝上.



noun countable ■a wall built across a river which stops the river's flow and collects the water, especially to make a reservoir (= an artificial lake) which provides water for an area （尤指旨在蓄水的）水坝，水堤
•The Aswan High Dam is on the River Nile in Egypt.阿斯旺水坝位于埃及境内的尼罗河上。
 Compare dyke
[dæm] verb transitive (-mm-)■to build a dam across a river in order to store the water 在（河上）筑坝蓄水
[dæm] verb transitive (-mm-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] dam sth up ■to build a dam across a river in order to store water 在（河上）筑坝蓄水■If you dam up your feelings, especially anger or sadness, you do not allow yourself to express or show your feelings in a healthy way. 不健康地压抑，郁积（情绪，尤其是愤怒、悲伤等）



v. 控制；筑坝
 - control over, take control of
n. [水利] 水坝；障碍
 - bar, obstacle, let, stop
examples: 英 [dæm] 美 [dæm]
n.水坝；堤；障碍物v.筑坝；抑制(情感等）

(1) The dam was not strong enough to hold back the flood waters.(2) The village was swept away when the dam burst.(3) The water deepened after the dam was built.(4) The river keeps rising and the dam is threatened.(5) A dam is a barrier holding water back.(6) They are going to dam up the river to set up a hydropower station.(7) It's hard to dam up one's feelings.
(1) 水坝不太坚固，挡不住洪水。(2) 村庄在水坝决堤时被冲走了。(3) 堤坝建成后水已加深。(4) 河水不断上涨，大堤出现险情。(5) 水坝是防堵水的障碍物。(6) 他们准备拦江筑坝建水电站。(7) 一个人要抑制自己的感情是不容易的。
[sound:youdao-763a62b1-44da17ea-bc78ff3b-4740bb62-dc729512.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 损害，毁坏
n. 损害，损毁; 赔偿金

时态：damaged, damaging, damages
分布：损害(59%)，损失(30%)，毁坏(11%)


→来自拉丁语damnum, 损失，伤害，词源同damn.
v./n.损害,毁坏n.(pl.)损害赔偿费It is imaginable that breaking the engagement will damage his image.可以想象,违反婚约将损害他的形象.



verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to harm or spoil something 损害，损坏，破坏
•Many buildings were badly damaged during the war.许多建筑物在战争中严重受损。

•It was a scandal which damaged a lot of reputations.这是一宗使人名誉扫地的丑闻。

['dæm.ɪdʒ] noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■harm or injury 损害，危害；损坏；伤害
•Strong winds had caused serious damage to the roof.强风使屋顶严重受损。

•Recent discoveries about corruption have done serious damage to the company's reputation.近来曝光的一些腐败行为使那间公司的声誉受到严重损害。

•The doctors were worried that he might have suffered brain damage.医生们担心他可能受到了脑损伤。
damages [plural] legal ■money which is paid to someone by a person or organization who has been responsible for causing them some injury or loss 赔偿（金），赔款
•The politician was awarded £50,000 damages over false allegations made by the newspaper.那位政治家获得了报馆因报道失实而向他支付的五万英镑赔偿金。

•The police have been ordered to pay substantial damages to the families of the two dead boys.警方被责令向两名死亡儿童的家人支付巨额赔偿金。

['dæm.ɪdʒ] noun the damage is done ■said to mean that it is too late to improve a bad situation 为时已晚，覆水难收
•I didn't even know I'd offended her till Colin told me and then it was too late - the damage was done.经科林提醒，我才发觉自己冒犯了她，可是为时已晚。

['dæm.ɪdʒ] noun What's the damage? informal humorous ■used to ask how much something has cost you 花了多少钱？
['dæm.ɪdʒ] noun   Common Learner Errors   damageIn its first meaning, damage   does not have a plural form and cannot be used with a  or an.To talk about an amount of damage , do not say 'damages', say damage , some damage or a lot of damage :✗ Tourism causes damages to the environment.Tourism causes a lot of damage to the environment.




damages, damage

damages: 复数形式, 赔偿金 $900 damages
damage: 不可数名词, 损害,损失;



destroy, break, wreck, ruin, spoil, damage

这组词都有“破坏，损坏”的意思，其区别是：
destroy: 多指彻底地、毁灭性地破坏，含导致无用，不能或很难再修复的意味。
break: 普通用词，指某物因被打破或撕破而受到破坏，可指有形或无形的破坏。
wreck: 侧重指船只、车辆、房屋等受到严重破坏或完全毁坏，也可指计划、健康受到损害。
ruin: 多指因外部原因而受到严重破坏或毁灭，侧重破坏的彻底性，也可用于引申意义。
spoil: 强调不仅会削弱力量、精力或价值，而且会导致不可避免的毁灭。
damage: 多指对无生命物体的损害，造成降低价值、破坏功能等后果。



destroy, harm, ruin, damage

这组词都有“破坏”的意思，其区别是：
destroy: 指十分彻底的毁坏，破坏。如：The whole city was destroyed in the earthquake.( 地震中整个城市被毁了。)
harm: 多指带来悲痛，产生恶果的伤害，可以是肉体的也可是精神的。如：Doctors say smoking harms our health.(医生说吸烟对身体有害。)
ruin: 为正式用词，强调由于自然力或时间的作用而逐渐损坏，用于比喻时也指彻底毁坏名声，期望等。如：She poured water all over my painting and ruined it. (她把水倒在画上，把它毁了。)另外，ruin的复数形式ruins表“废墟”。
damage: 一般指部分性的破坏，含可修复使用。



harm, hurt, damage, disable, injure, wound

这组词都有“损害，伤害”的意思，其区别是：
harm: 主要用于有生命的东西，语气略强于injure，指引起严重的痛苦和损伤；有时也用于抽象事物，指造成任何不良后果。
hurt: 普通用词，较口语化，侧重指给有生命的东西造成机体上或精神、感情上的或轻或重的伤害。
damage: 通常指对无生命物体的损害，并有降低其价值，破坏其功能等的后果。
disable: 强调使伤残。
injure: 较hurt正式，多用于有生命的事物。既可指伤害别人的事物。即可指伤害别人的健康、外貌、自尊心、名誉等，又可指使别人受伤或东西受损，同时含有受伤害部分至少暂时丧失功能的意味。
wound: 专指对身体的重伤，尤指在战斗中受的伤，强调外部创伤；也可指精神方面的伤害。


vi. 损害；损毁；赔偿金
 - do harm to, let in for
n. 损害；损毁
 - injury, harm, lesion
vt. 损害，毁坏
 - destroy, hurt, blast
examples: 英 ['dæmɪdʒ] 美 ['dæmɪdʒ]
n.损害；损失；毁坏vt.损害；毁坏

(1) The damage to the painting is the work of vandals.(2) Knowing all this, they made me pay for the damage.(3) The flood did a lot of damage to the crops.(4) Drinking and smoking can damage your health.(5) Be careful not to damage the priceless vase.
(1) 毁坏这幅画的事是恣意破坏公物的人干的。(2) 他们尽管了解这一切,还是让我赔偿损失。(3) 洪水毁坏了大量农作物。(4) 饮酒和吸烟会损害你的健康。(5) 当心别把那个贵重的花瓶打碎了。
[sound:youdao-bd0d8522-f19c53d5-3e2acd43-46c859a7-1737729a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 微湿的，潮湿的; 消沉的，沮丧的; 沉闷的; 情绪低落的
n. 潮湿; 消沉，失望; 矿井瓦斯; 有毒气体
vt. 使潮湿; 使泄气，使沮丧; 抑制，阻抑; 使减弱
vi. [物]阻尼; 减幅

时态：damped, damping, damps
分布：潮湿(56%)，潮湿的(32%)，湿气(4%)，有湿气的(2%)，沮丧的(2%)，使潮湿(2%)，变潮湿(1%)，使扫兴(1%)


→词源不详。
n.潮湿a.潮湿的vt.使潮湿;使衰减He stamped on the stamps and slammed the lamp on the damp dam.他用脚踩邮票并将灯砰地摔在潮湿的坝上.
【参】dampness（n 潮湿；湿气）【反】damped（被压低声音的）－amplified（被放大的）；sere（adj 干枯的）



adjective  ADVANCED  ■slightly wet, especially in a way that is not pleasant or comfortable 潮湿的，湿淋淋的
•The grass is still damp.草还有些潮湿。

•This shirt still feels a bit damp.这件衬衫摸上去还有点湿的。

•It was a damp, misty morning.那是一个潮湿而又雾气蒙蒙的早晨。

[dæmp] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] damp sth down FIRE  ■to make a fire burn more slowly 阻止（火势蔓延）；减少，控制（火势）
•Water was pumped from a nearby lake in an attempt to damp down the flames.人们从附近的湖里抽水，试图控制住熊熊烈火。
FEELING  ■to make a strong feeling be felt less strongly 压制（感情）；控制（情感）
•He had tried to damp down speculation about the state of his marriage.他试图让人们减少对他婚姻状况的种种猜疑。





damp, moist, wet, humid

这组词都有“潮湿的”的意思，其区别是：
damp: 指吸进或覆盖着一点水份，常表示潮湿得使人不舒服。
moist: 指微湿，侧重不干，但并非湿得使人不快。
wet: 普通用词，指各种潮湿的状态。
humid: 正式用词，特指空气与天气的潮湿，相对湿度大。



damp, soak, wet

这组词都有“使潮湿”的意思，其区别是：
damp: 指全部弄湿，侧重状态。
soak: 多指浸没，侧重最后结果。
wet: 普通用词，一般指水所发挥的作用。


vt. [气象]  [物] 使潮湿；使阻尼；使沮丧，抑制
 - control, stay, restrain
vi. 减幅，阻尼； [气象]  [物] 变潮湿
 - moisturize
n. [气象]  [物] 潮湿，湿气
 - moisture, humidity, wet
adj. [气象]  [物] 潮湿的
 - wet, humid, moisty
examples: 英 [dæmp] 美 [dæmp]
adj.潮湿的；有湿气的；沮丧的n.湿气；潮湿vt.使潮湿；使扫兴vi.变潮湿

(1) Damp wood doesn't burn well.(2) The building was cold and damp.(3) The cheese molded in the damp cellar.(4) The party was a bit of a damp squib.(5) The air of this room is impregnated with damp.(6) The damp has started the timbers.(7) Damp the cloth before you clean the windows.(8) The setback did not damp his zest.
(1) 潮湿的木头不好烧。(2) 这房子又冷又湿。(3) 乳酪在潮湿的地下室中长了霉。(4) 这次聚会有些扫兴。(5) 这房间充满着湿气。(6) 潮湿已使梁木弯翘了。(7) 在擦玻璃窗之前,把揩布弄湿。(8) 挫折没有使他降低热情。

translation:
n. 跳舞; 舞会; 舞蹈艺术; 舞曲
vi. 跳舞; 手舞足蹈; 摇晃; 跳跃
vt. 使跳舞

时态：danced, dancing, dances
分布：跳舞(51%)，舞蹈(27%)，舞会(16%)，舞步(3%)，手舞足蹈(2%)，使跳跃(1%)


→来自tens, 展开，伸展，词源同tend, thin. 用来指舞蹈。
n.舞(蹈);舞曲,舞会v.跳舞;跳动I glimpsed the dancer balancing herself on the ambulance by chance.我碰巧瞥见舞蹈者在救护车上使自己保持平衡.



US [dænts] verb  ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to move the body and feet to music 跳（舞），舞蹈
•We danced all night.我们跳了一夜的舞。

•We went dancing at a nightclub.我们去夜总会跳舞。

•What sort of music do you like dancing to ?你喜欢伴着哪种歌曲跳舞？

•Who was she dancing with at the party last night?昨晚她在派对上跟谁跳舞？

•Can you dance the tango?你会跳探戈吗？
intransitive literary ■to move quickly and lightly （轻快地）舞动；摇曳；跳动
•The daffodils were dancing in the breeze.黄色水仙在微风中轻轻舞动。

•She watched the sunlight dancing on the water.她注视着水面上的粼粼波光。

UK [dɑ:nts] US [dænts] verb be dancing in the streets informal ■to be extremely happy about something that has happened 欣喜若狂，大喜；高兴得手舞足蹈
•Few people will be dancing in the streets about a two per cent pay rise.很少有人会因薪水增了2%而欣喜若狂。

UK [dɑ:nts] US [dænts] verb dance attendance on sb UK ■to do everything that someone asks you to and treat them as if they are special 讨好，迎合（某人）
•I can't stand the way she has to have someone dancing attendance on her the whole time.我受不了她那种老要有人跑前跑后逢迎着她的作风。

UK [dɑ:nts] US [dænts] verb dance to sb's tune ■to do what someone wants 顺从，服从（某人）；对（某人）唯命是从
UK [dɑ:nts] US [dænts] noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■when you move your feet and body to music 舞，跳舞
•We had a dance.我们跳了一支舞。

•a dance class舞蹈课
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■a particular series of movements which you perform to music or the type of music which is connected with it 舞蹈，舞步；舞曲
•The band played a slow dance.乐队演奏了一首舒缓的舞曲。
 ADVANCED  countable ■a social occasion at which people dance, especially a formal occasion in a large room （尤指正式的）舞会
•They're having an end-of-term dinner-dance.他们要举办一场期末餐舞会。
 ADVANCED  uncountable ■the art of performing dances, especially as a form of entertainment 舞蹈表演；舞蹈艺术
•The performers tell the story through song and dance.演员们载歌载舞演绎了那个故事。





ball, dance

这组词都有“舞会”的意思，其区别是：
ball: 多指社交性的舞会，场面较为隆重和正式。
dance: 指一般性的非正式舞会。


n. 舞蹈；舞会；舞曲
 - ball, nautch
vi. 跳舞；跳跃；飘扬
 - flow, foot, jump, stream
vt. 跳舞；使跳跃
 - jump, bound
adj. 舞蹈的；用于跳舞的
 - orchestic, terpsichorean
examples: 英 [dɑːns] 美 [dæns]
n.舞会；跳舞；舞蹈；舞步vi.跳舞；手舞足蹈vt.跳舞；使跳跃

(1) The girls are making up for the dance.(2) We have fixed up a date for the dance.(3) May I ask you for a dance, Lily?(4) Her whole life has been given to the study of dance.(5) She made a sequence of dance movements.(6) They performed a dance for the children.(7) This dance step is quite complicated.(8) The waves danced in the sunlight.(9) She loves to dance to music.(10) The song makes us dance for joy.(11) He danced a waltz tonight.
(1) 女孩子们为了参加舞会正在化装。(2) 我们己经定好了舞会的日期。(3) 莉莉,我可以请你跳舞吗?(4) 她一生献身于研究舞蹈。(5) 她做了一个连续的舞蹈动作。(6) 他们为儿童表演了一个舞蹈。(7) 这个舞步挺复杂的。(8) 波浪在阳光下跳舞。(9) 她喜欢随着音乐跳舞。(10) 那支歌曲令我们手舞足蹈。(11) 他今晚跳了华尔兹舞。

translation:
adj. 危险的

分布：危险的(96%)，不安全的(4%)


危险的(danger危险)[-ous表形容词,通常放在一个完整的单词后,表示"…的"]
a.危险的,不安全的Deviation in aviation is dangerous. Writing is alleviated via bias on abbreviation.在航空过程中的不符合是危险的.写被关于缩写通过偏见减轻.



US [-dʒɚ-] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■describes a person, animal, thing or activity that could harm you 危险的，有威胁的；不安全的
•dangerous chemicals危险化学品

•The men are armed and dangerous.那些人携带武器，太危险了。

•I've never played ice hockey - it's far too dangerous.我从不打冰上曲棍球——太危险了。

•[+ to infinitive] It 's dangerous  to take more than the recommended dose of tablets.服药过量是很危险的。




adj. 危险的
 - critical, risky, threatening, precarious, perilous
examples: 英 ['deɪndʒərəs] 美 ['deɪndʒərəs]
adj.危险的；不安全的
(1) It is dangerous to walk on thin ice in a lake.(2) Dangerous driving should be severely punished.(3) It is dangerous for you to stay here.
(1) 在湖中薄冰上行走是很危险的。(2) 危险驾驶应受严惩。(3) 你呆在这儿不安全。

translation:
vt. 敢; 敢做; 激（某人做某事）; 问（某人）有没有胆量（做某事）
vi. 敢; 敢于; 大胆; 无畏于
aux. 敢，竟敢
n. 激将，挑战

时态：dared, daring, dares
分布：敢(87%)，挑战(7%)，胆敢(3%)，勇于(1%)，胆量(1%)，冒...的风险(1%)


→来自dhers, 勇敢的，有勇气的，词源同endure, firm.
v.敢,胆敢How dare you ask me such a question?你怎敢问我这样的问题?



US [der] verb BE BRAVE/RUDE  勇敢／鲁莽   IMPROVER  intransitive not continuous ■to be brave enough to do something difficult or dangerous, or to be rude or silly enough to do something that you have no right to do 敢于；胆敢，竟敢
•I was going to ask if his dog was any better, but I didn't dare in case it had died.我本想问问他的狗好些没有，可是又怕那狗已经死掉了，所以不敢问。

•[+ (to) infinitive] Everyone in the office complains that he smells awful, but nobody dares (to) mention it to him.办公室里人人都在抱怨，说他身上有股难闻的气味，可是又没有人敢跟他说。

•Do you dare (to) tell him the news?你敢告诉他这个消息吗？

•[+ infinitive without to] I wouldn't dare have a party in my flat in case the neighbours complained.我可不敢在公寓里举行派对，以免邻居们不满。

•Dare you tell him the news?你敢告诉他这个消息吗？

•I daren't/don't dare think how much it's going to cost.我不敢想像那要花多少钱。

•I'd never dare (to) talk to my mother the way Ben talks to his.我永远也不敢像宾对他母亲讲话那样跟我母亲说话。

•[+ to infinitive] He was under attack for daring to criticize the Prime Minister.他因为敢于批评首相而受到攻击。
⇒ See also daresay
UK [deər] US [der] verb ASK  请求  transitive ■to ask someone to do something which involves risk 向…挑战；问…有没有胆量（做）；（用激将法）激
•Wear the low-cut blouse with your pink shorts - go on, I dare you!穿上那件低胸衬衫，再配上粉红色短裤——就照这样打扮，你有胆量就穿上试试！

•[+ to infinitive] I dare you to ask him to dance.我谅你也不敢请他跳舞。

UK [deər] US [der] verb don't you dare mainly humorous ■used to tell someone angrily not to do something （表示生气）你试试看，看我怎么收拾你
•"I think I'll just walk my dirty shoes over your nice clean floor." "Don't you dare!"“我要穿着脏鞋子从你那洁净的地板上走过去。”“你试试看！”

•Don't you dare go without me!你试试留下我自己去，看我怎么收拾你！

UK [deər] US [der] verb  How dare she / you , etc.! ■used to express anger about something someone has done （表示气愤）她／你竟敢这样（做）！
•How dare you use my car without asking!你竟敢问也不问，就用我的车！

•How dare he tell me what to do!他竟敢对我指手画脚！

UK [deər] US [der] noun countable ■something you do because someone dares you to 在激将法做出的事，应他人挑战而做出的事
•He jumped in the river at twelve o'clock last night UK as/for / US on a dare.昨晚12点他应别人的挑战，跳进河里去。





risk, hazard, venture, chance, dare

这组词都有“敢于冒险”的意思，其区别是：
risk: 指不顾个人安危去干某事，侧重主动承担风险。
hazard: 主要指冒险作出某个选择，隐含碰运气意味。
venture: 指冒风险试一试，或指有礼貌的反抗或反对。
chance: 指碰运气、冒风险试试。
dare: 可与venture换用，但语气较强，着重挑战或违抗。


n. 挑战；挑动
 - challenge, defi
vi. 敢；胆敢
 - make bold to
examples: 英 [deə(r)] 美 [der]
vt.敢；挑战；冒...的风险vi.勇于；胆敢aux.胆敢n.胆量；挑战

(1) The gymnast dared a breathtakingly difficult move.(2) He dared me to jump over the river.(3) He dared his grandfather's displeasure when he left the family business.(4) I would do it if I dared.(5) I dare say you are right.(6) I dare not touch the flower for its tenderness.(7) If he dare say such a thing again, I shall knock him down.(8) Don't worry! I am just trying my dare.(9) He only entered the competition for a dare.
(1) 这位体操选手敢于做惊险的高难度动作(2) 他激我跳过河。(3) 他不顾祖父的不悦，放下了家族的生意。(4) 如果我有勇气我就做。(5) 我认为你是对的。(6) 这花太娇嫩了，我不敢碰它。(7) 如果他胆敢再说这种话,我一定把他打倒在地。(8) 不用担心！我只不过在试试自己的胆量而已。(9) 他只是因为受人激将才参加竞赛。
[sound:youdao-04a445ce-658d25c2-2fcc34b4-2dcb2885-781e0c69.mp3]

translation:
n. 勇敢; 鲁莽
adj. 胆大的，勇敢的; 意气风发的
v. 敢(dare的现在分词)

分布：大胆的(41%)，勇敢(28%)，勇敢的(19%)，勇气(12%)


→来自dare, 勇于，敢于。



US ['der.ɪŋ] adjective ■brave and taking risks 有勇气的，大胆的；勇于冒险的
•a daring escape大胆的逃亡

•This is a daring new film (= one willing to risk criticism) by one of our most original modern directors.这是一部相当大胆的新片，执导者是现代一位富有创意的导演。

•She was wearing a rather daring (= sexually exciting) skirt that only just covered her bottom.她的穿着非常大胆，短短的裙子刚刚能够遮住臀部。





brave, bold, daring, heroic, fearless, courageous

这组词都有“勇敢的”的意思，其区别是：
brave: 含义广泛，指天生的勇敢，无所畏惧地面对困难与危险，侧重胆识与果断。
bold: 侧重指面对困难或危险时勇往直前，勇于进取的勇敢精神。
daring: 强调面临意外或危险时胆大心细，头脑冷静。褒义贬义均可用，贬义指胆大妄为。
heroic: 正式用词，多指在战争或重大危险时，为他人为事业忘我献身的英雄气概。
fearless: 语气肯定，侧重在危险时无所畏惧，毫无动摇。
courageous: 正式用词，侧重指在一切情况下都有胆量，无所畏惧，强调基于道德信念，经深思熟虑后所产生的勇敢。


adj. 大胆的，勇敢的
 - bold, game, brave
n. 胆量，勇气
 - courage, nerve, heart
examples: 英 ['deərɪŋ] 美 ['derɪŋ]
adj.勇敢的；大胆的n.勇敢；勇气
(1) He had proved himself a most daring airman.(2) The daring exploits of the parachutists were much admired.(3) She said some daring things.(4) He was a soldier famous for his daring.
(1) 他已证明自己是个极其勇敢的飞行员。(2) 跳伞者大胆的冒险动作令人赞叹不已。(3) 她说了一些大胆的话。(4) 他是个以勇敢出名的战士。
[sound:youdao-5bb7b320-1db6bdf4-92eaa213-b2afa1c5-55b72bea.mp3]

translation:
adj. 黑暗的; 乌黑的; 忧郁的; 神秘的
n. 黑暗; 暗色; 暗处

级别：darker, darkest
分布：黑暗(66%)，黑暗的(19%)，深色的(7%)，暗处(4%)，变黑(2%)，使变黑(1%)，深色调(1%)


→来自dher, 泥泞的，浑浊的，昏暗的，词源同dross. 词义由昏暗引申为黑暗的，黑色的。
a.黑暗的,深(色)的;隐秘的;n.无光,黑暗In the sparking park, the darling dark dog barked at the embarked larks.在闪着火花的公园里,可爱的深色狗对着装载于船云雀吠叫.



US [dɑ:rk] adjective WITHOUT LIGHT  无光   ESSENTIAL  ■with little or no light 昏暗的，黑暗的
•It was too dark to see properly.光线太暗，看不清楚。

•What time does it get dark in the summer?夏季时的天色甚么时候变暗？

•Our bedroom was very dark until we put a larger window in.我们的睡房原来很暗，后来装了一个大一点的窗户才好些。
 ESSENTIAL  ■nearer to black than white in colour （颜色）暗的，深色的
•dark blue/green深蓝／暗绿色

•dark clouds乌云

•She has dark hair.她长着一头黑发。

•He was tall, dark (= with black/brown hair) and handsome.他个子高高的，留有黑头发，长相很英俊。

UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] adjective SAD  伤心的  [before noun] ■sad and without hope 伤心绝望的；哀愁的
•Her husband's sudden death was the start of a dark chapter in her life.丈夫突然去世后，她就开始生活在伤心绝望之中。

•This environmental report contains more dark predictions about the future of the Earth.这份环境报告对地球未来的预测很不乐观。

UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] adjective EVIL  邪恶的  ■evil or threatening 邪恶的，阴险的；有威胁的
•There's a darker side to his character.他的性格中有更阴暗的一面。

UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] adjective SECRET  秘密的  ■secret or hidden 秘密的，隐秘的
•I've just been promoted, but keep  it  dark - I don't want everyone to know just yet.我刚刚升了职，别告诉任何人——我现在还不想让大家知道。

UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] adjective The darkest hour is just before the dawn. saying ■said to emphasize that things often seem at their worst just before they get better 黑暗即将过去，黎明就在眼前。
UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] noun the dark  IMPROVER  ■when there is no light somewhere 黑暗，暗处
•Cats can see in the dark.猫在暗处也看得见东西。

•I've always been afraid of the dark.我一直都怕黑。
before/after dark  IMPROVER  ■before/after the sun has gone down 天黑前／后
•It isn't safe to leave the house after dark.在天黑后出去是不安全的。

•I want to be home before dark.我想在天黑前赶到家里。

UK [dɑ:k] US [dɑ:rk] noun be in the dark ■to not know about something that other people know about 蒙在鼓里，浑然不知




dim, dark, vague, grey, obscure, black, gloomy

这组词都有“完全地或不完全地缺少光亮”的意思，其区别是：
dim: 指光线不足或视力较差，不能清晰地看见物体。
dark: 最普通用词，指缺乏自然光线或人工照明，使某物漆黑无光或光线十分微弱。
vague: 通常作借喻用，形容抽象事物。
grey: 与dark意思相近，但侧重阴暗单调的意味。
obscure: 指因光线不充足而使物体灰暗不清，失去光泽或若隐若现。作借喻时指因复杂、深奥或含糊而难于理解。
black: 侧重颜色是黑色的，有时也指无光的黑暗。
gloomy: 指光线不足或部分光线受阻而出现的阴暗。


adj. 黑暗的，深色的；模糊的；无知的；忧郁的
 - fuzzy, blue, empty, gloomy
n. 黑暗；夜；黄昏；模糊
 - night, gloominess
examples: 英 [dɑːk] 美 [dɑːrk]
adj.黑暗的；深色的n.黑暗；暗处；深色调v.使变黑；变黑
(1) It's a dark and moonless night.(2) The baby had dark eyes and dark curls.(3) He ran against a lamp post in the dark.(4) Reading in the dark is bad for the eyes.
(1) 这是一个黑暗无月的夜晚。(2) 那婴孩长着深色的眼睛和深色的鬈发。(3) 在黑暗中他撞上了一根电线杆。(4) 在暗处阅读封眼睛有害。
[sound:youdao-1333ffea-65c5741a-279e5b03-7e60ef22-a0ef262d.mp3]

translation:
n. （用作称呼）亲爱的; 心爱的人; 倍受宠爱的人; 亲切友好的的人
adj. 倍受喜爱的，可爱的，迷人的

分布：亲爱的(54%)，可爱的(27%)，可爱的人(14%)，可爱的物(5%)


→来自dear, 亲爱的。-ling, 小词后缀。
n.心爱的人,亲爱的In the sparking park, the darling dark dog barked at the embarked larks.在闪着火花的公园里,可爱的深色狗对着装载于船云雀吠叫.



US ['dɑ:r-] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a person who is very much loved or liked 亲爱的；宝贝；极受欢迎的人
•Oh darling, I do love you.哦，亲爱的，我真的爱你。

•Here's your change, darling.亲爱的，这是找给你的零钱。

•In spite of his unpopularity in the USSR, Gorbachev remained a/the  darling  of (= very popular with) the West right to the end.尽管戈巴契夫在苏联并不受欢迎，但他自始至终都受到西方的大力追捧。

UK ['dɑ:.lɪŋ] US ['dɑ:r-] adjective [before noun] old-fashioned■loved very much; used when talking someone you love, for example in a letter （在书信等对喜爱之人的称呼）亲爱的，心爱的
•Darling Martha, It was lovely to see you at the weekend.亲爱的玛莎，周末能见到你真是太好了。
■very attractive 吸引人的，可爱的，迷人的
•They've just bought a darling little cottage.他们刚买了一间可爱的小木屋。




n. 心爱的人；亲爱的
 - beloved, the light of one's eyes
examples: 英 ['dɑːlɪŋ] 美 ['dɑːrlɪŋ]
n.亲爱的；可爱的人；可爱的物adj.可爱的；亲爱的

(1) Darling, please select a good mount for me.(2) I learned that Ruben was a darling man who bought from everyone.(3) I learned that Ruben was a darling man who bought from everyone.(4) Darling, please select a good mount for me.
(1) 亲爱的，请帮我挑选一匹好马。(2) 我了解到鲁本是一个可爱的人，不管谁上门拉广告他都会来者不拒。(3) 我了解到鲁本是一个可爱的人，不管谁上门拉广告他都会来者不拒。(4) 亲爱的，请帮我挑选一匹好马。

translation:
vi. 猛冲; 赶紧离开
vt. 猛撞; 匆忙完成; 泼溅; 使…破灭
n. 少量，些许; 猛冲; 破折号; 短跑

时态：dashed, dashing, dashes
分布：冲(39%)，短跑(22%)，破折号(21%)，猛冲(13%)，猛掷(2%)，泼溅(2%)，匆忙完成(1%)


→拟声词，模仿向前冲的声音。
v./n.冲,猛冲,突进n.破折号He dashed to smash the fashionable ashtray with cash.他猛冲过去用现金砸那个时髦的烟灰盘.



verb MOVE QUICKLY  快速移动   IMPROVER  intransitive ■to go somewhere quickly 猛冲，急奔，跑
•I've been dashing around all day.我一整天都在东奔西跑。

•I must dash - I've got to be home by seven.我要赶紧走了——我必须在七点钟前到家。

[dæʃ] verb HIT  撞击  intransitive or transitive [usually + prep] ■to hit with great force, especially causing damage 猛击，猛撞；（尤指）撞碎，击碎
•The tidal wave dashed the ship against the rocks.潮汐把那艘船抛向岩石。

•Waves dashed against the cliffs.海浪拍击悬崖。

[dæʃ] verb dash sb's hopes ■to destroy someone's hopes 粉碎（某人）的希望，使（某人）的希望破灭
•Saturday's 2-0 defeat dashed their hopes of reaching the final.周六0比2的失利粉碎了他们晋身决赛的希望。

[dæʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] dash sth off ■to write something quickly, putting little effort into it 匆忙写下，随手写下
•She dashed the letter off in five minutes.她用五分钟时间匆忙写了那封信。

[dæʃ] noun QUICK MOVEMENT  快速动作   IMPROVER  only singular ■when you run somewhere very quickly 飞奔，迅跑，急驰
•I made a dash for the toilets.我冲向厕所。

•There was a mad dash for the exit.人们拼命冲向出口。

•As soon as the rain dies down I'm going to make a dash for it (= run somewhere very fast).雨一小下来，我就会马上去。
countable usually singular mainly US ■a race over a short distance 短跑比赛
•Who won the 100-yard dash?谁赢得了100码短跑冠军？

[dæʃ] noun PUNCTUATION  标点   ADVANCED  countable ■the - punctuation mark that can be used to separate parts of a sentence 破折号 Compare hyphen countable ■a long sound or flash of light which is used with dots to send messages in Morse (code) （摩斯电码中的）长音，长划
[dæʃ] noun SMALL AMOUNT  少量  a dash ■a small amount of something, especially liquid food, that is added to something else （尤指添加的流质食品）少量，少许
•"Cream with your coffee, Madam?" "Yes please - just a dash."“小姐，您的咖啡要加鲜奶油吗？”“好的，稍加一点。”

•figurative a youthful ambiance with a dash of (= small amount of) sophistication朝气勃勃又略显凝重的气氛

[dæʃ] noun STYLE  风格  uncountable old-fashioned ■style and confidence 气魄；帅气；锐气
[dæʃ] exclamation UK old-fashioned informal ■used to express anger 糟糕，讨厌
•Oh dash (it) ! I've left my umbrella in the office.真糟糕！我把雨伞留在办公室里。





rush, dash

这组词都有“冲，奔”的意思，其区别是：
rush: 指因急躁或事务紧急而采取快速行动。
dash: 指以最快的速度向前奔驰。


n. 破折号；冲撞
 - jerking motion
vt. 使…破灭；猛撞；泼溅
 - discomfit
vi. 猛冲；撞击
 - knock against, impinge on
examples: 英 [dæʃ] 美 [dæʃ]
v.猛冲；猛掷；泼溅；匆忙完成n.破折号；短跑；猛冲；冲

(1) He dashed across the street and ran towards me.(2) He dash the glass bowl to bit on a rock.(3) Don't dash the paint on the wall like that.(4) She dashed off a letter to her mother.(5) The dash is used in writing to show a pause.(6) Everything you need to convert your stock analog dash to a digital instrument panel is included.(7) They made a headlong dash for the door.(8) They made a headlong dash for the door.(9) I must just dash upstairs and run a comb through my hair.
(1) 他冲过马路，向我跑过来。(2) 他对著石块把玻璃碗砸得粉碎。(3) 别那样在墙上乱涂漆。(4) 她给母亲匆匆写了一封信。(5) 在写作上破折号用来表示停顿。(6) 你所需要的一切转换您的股票模拟破折号的数字仪表板包含。(7) 他们迅猛地向门口冲去。(8) 他们迅猛地向门口冲去。(9) 我得冲上楼赶紧把头发梳理一下。
[sound:youdao-0fa41d05-cda08189-4ca1e016-6dc9d928-0a083c15.mp3]

translation:
n. 资料，材料; datum的复数; [计算机]数据，资料; 从科学实验中提取的价值

分布：数据(83%)，资料(16%)，名词datum的复数形式.(1%)


→来自拉丁语datum, 给予。-a, 拉丁语复数后缀。
n.(datum的复数)资料,数据The fateful up-to-date data of the gate have a fatal error.大门的决定性最新数据有一个致命错误.



US [-tˌə] noun uncountable [+ sing/pl verb]  ESSENTIAL  ■information, especially facts or numbers, collected to be examined and considered and used to help decision-making, or information in an electronic form that can be stored and processed by a computer 信息，数据
•The data was/were collected by various researchers.这些资讯是由各类研究人员收集起来的。

•Now the data is/are being transferred from magnetic tape to hard disk.现在这些数据正从磁碟转存到硬碟。





message, information, data

这组词都有“资料、信息”的意思，其区别是：
message: 指通过书写、谈话和信号等方式所进行的通讯“信息”。
information: 和data作“资料”解时，前者仅指所获得、提供或描述的慨况，而不指具体的数据或资料，后者则指具体的资料。
data: 是datum的复数形式，本义指作为计算和测量基础的资料。
examples: 英 ['deɪtə] 美 ['deɪtə]
n.数据；资料名词datum的复数形式.
(1) The data should be updated once a week.(2) In Name, type a name for the data source.(3) Very little data is available.(4) The data is still being analyzed.
(1) 这些数据应该每星期更新一次。(2) 在“名称”中,为数据源键入名称。(3) 现有的资料十分不足。(4) 资料仍在分析中。
[sound:youdao-ebccef9a-68910a33-69eb2a40-a494378b-f90dbad5.mp3]

translation:
n. 女儿; 产物，后代; （某地的）妇女; [生]子代
adj. 女儿般的; [生]第一代的; 子代的

分布：女儿(91%)，女儿的(7%)，子代(1%)，女儿似的(1%)


→来自dhugheter, 女儿，可能来自拟声词，婴儿吸奶的声音。-ter, 词源同father, mother.
n.女儿In the beautiful bureau my daughter's laughter served for the sauce of the sausage.在漂亮的办公署,女儿的笑声充当了香肠的调料.



US ['dɑ:.tˌɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■your female child 女儿
•Liz and Phil have a daughter and three sons.莉兹和菲尔有一个女儿和三个儿子。
⇒ See also stepdaughter




girl, daughter, maid, maiden

这组词都有“姑娘，女孩子”的意思，其区别是：
girl: 指7岁到12岁左右的女孩，与boy相对，广义指未婚的女孩。
daughter: 指女子对父母而言的概称，不涉及年龄的大小。
maid: 指闺女，女佣人。
maiden: 指少女，处女或未婚女子。


n. 女儿； [遗]  [农学] 子代
 - girl, dau.
examples: 英 ['dɔːtə(r)] 美 ['dɔːtər]
n.女儿；子代adj.女儿的；女儿似的

(1) Jill is my eldest daughter.(2) The death of their daughter was a cruel blow.(3) She spoke as a true daughter of the city.(4) His unkindness to his daughter came home to roost.(5) She trembled for her daughter's safety.
(1) 吉尔是我的长女。(2) 女儿的死对他们是一个残酷的打击。(3) 她讲起话来真像来自这个城市的。(4) 他对女儿的刻薄得到了恶报。(5) 她为女儿的安全而焦虑不安。
[sound:youdao-81be34a4-c4273b03-04be67d5-9e17e991-40e7dfc5.mp3]

translation:
n. 黎明，拂晓; 开端; 醒悟
vi. 破晓，（天）刚亮; 开始出现; 变得明朗
vt. （开始）被理解，被领悟; 被看清，被想到

时态：dawned, dawning, dawns
分布：黎明(61%)，破晓(18%)，曙光(12%)，开端(6%)，开始出现(2%)，逐渐明白(1%)


→来自dhegwh, 燃烧，发光，词源同day, yesterday. 引申义曙光，黎明。
n.黎明,拂晓v.破晓;开始现出At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man began to frown.拂晓时在草坪上,打呵欠的溺水者开始皱眉头.



US [dɑ:n] noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky 拂晓，破晓，黎明
•We woke at dawn.天一亮我们就醒了。

•We left as dawn was breaking (= starting).我们离开时天将破晓。

•We left at the break of dawn.我们是在天刚破晓时离开的。

•Twenty-three people were arrested and large quantities of heroin were seized in a dawn raid (= when police officers suddenly enter a building, in an attempt to catch people involved in illegal activities).在一次清晨突袭行动中，警方逮捕了23人，并没收了大量的海洛因。
the dawn of sth literary ■the start of a period of time or the beginning of something new …的开始；…的曙光
•The fall of the Berlin Wall marked the dawn of a new era in European history.柏林墙的倒塌标志着欧洲历史上一个新纪元的开始。
from dawn to dusk ■from early morning until night 从早到晚
•We worked from dawn to dusk, seven days a week.我们从早到晚地工作，一周七天都是如此。

UK [dɔ:n] US [dɑ:n] verb intransitive BEGIN  开始  ■If a day or period of time dawns, it begins 破晓；开始
•He left the house just as the day was dawning.天将破晓时他离开了那座房子。

•As 1990 dawned, few people could have predicted the dramatic changes that were to take place in eastern Europe during that year.1990年到来之时，几乎没人能预见到在那一年里东欧将发生剧烈的变化。

UK [dɔ:n] US [dɑ:n] verb intransitive BECOME KNOWN  为人所知  ■to become known or obvious 见分晓，水落石出；变得明朗
•Gradually the truth about him dawned.他的真实面目渐渐暴露了出来。

•[+ that] It eventually dawned that he wouldn't be coming back.最终证明他不会回来了。

UK [dɔ:n] US [dɑ:n] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   dawn on sb ■If a fact dawns on you, you understand it after a period of not understanding it 使（某人）明白，使（某人）意识到
•[+ that] I was about to pay for the shopping when it suddenly dawned on me that I'd left my cheque book at home.我买完东西要付钱时，才突然发现我把支票簿留在家里了。





dawn, twilight, dusk

这组词都有“黎明，黄昏”的意思，其区别是：
dawn: 指天刚亮时的黎明，可作引申用。
twilight: 指日落后或日出前的微明，但通常侧重于前者。
dusk: 指接近夜晚的黄昏时刻。


n. [天] 黎明；开端
 - morning, origin
vt. 破晓；出现；被领悟
 - come out, break of day
examples: 英 [dɔːn] 美 [dɔːn]
n.黎明；曙光；开端；破晓vi.开始出现；破晓；逐渐明白

(1) We set sail at dawn and headed for New York.(2) Diana aroused them just before dawn.(3) I can see the dawn of the better day for humanity.(4) The sky was pink with the first glimmer of the dawn.(5) We look forward to the dawn of better days.(6) The marchers jumped off at the crack of dawn.(7) Dawn was breaking when we came back to the camp.(8) Break of dawn, there's no sun up in the sky.(9) A new era is dawning.(10) It began to dawn after the long night.(11) The truth began to dawn upon him.(12) It didn't dawn on me that I was getting the bum's rush.

(1) 我们在黎明起程，直驶纽约。(2) 戴安娜在黎明前唤醒了他们。(3) 我已经看到了人类美好日子的曙光。(4) 天空因第一丝曙光而呈淡红色。(5) 我们期待较好的日子的来临。(6) 行军队伍在破晓时出发了。(7) 当我们返回营地时，天刚破晓。(8) 破晓时分,天空还没有太阳。(9) 一个新的时代开始出现了。(10) 漫漫长夜之后天开始亮起来。(11) 他开始明白那道理。(12) 我不明白，我竟要被赶走。
[sound:youdao-988f7f0d-a9ef0216-86d6be85-67290385-bb3da421.mp3]

translation:
n. 一天; 白天; 时期; 节日
adj. 日间的; 逐日的
adv. 每天; 经常在白天地

分布：一天(81%)，白天(15%)，时代(4%)


→来自dhegwh, 燃烧，发光，词源同fever, yester.引申义天亮，白天。
n.天,一昼夜;白昼,白天;时期,时代Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.是的,昨天是我的发薪日,我今天付给你报酬.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a period of 24 hours, especially from 12 o'clock one night to 12 o'clock the next night 一天，一日
•January has 31 days.一月份有31天。

•the days of the week一周的七天

•He runs five miles every day.他每天跑5英里。

•It took us almost a day to get here.我们花了几乎一天的时间才到这里。

•I saw him the day before yesterday.我前天见到他了。

•We leave the day after tomorrow.我们后天离开。

•He was last seen alive five days ago.人们最后一次见到他时，是在五日前，那时他还活着。

•They haven't been seen for days (= for several days).他们有一段时间没露面了。

•I'll be seeing Pat in a few days] in a few  days'  time.过几天我会见到派特。

•How's your day been (= Have you enjoyed today) ?你今天过得好吗？

•Have a nice day!祝你有愉快的一天！

•I must get some sleep - I've got a big day (= an important day) tomorrow.我要睡一睡了——我明天有很重要的事。
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to refer to the period in 24 hours when it is naturally light 白天，白昼
•a bright, sunny day阳光明媚的一天

•It's rained all day today.今天下了一整天的雨。

•These animals sleep in the day and hunt at night.这些动物昼伏夜出。
 ESSENTIAL  ■the time that you usually spend at work or at school 工作天；上课天
•a normal working day正常的工作天

•I work a seven-hour day.我每天工作七小时。

•We're having to work a six-day week to cope with demand.为了满足需求，我们将不得不每周工作六天。

•She's at home today - she's having a day off.她今天在家——她要休息一天。
the other day  IMPROVER  ■a few days ago 前几天，几天前
•Didn't I see you in the post office the other day?前几天我不是在邮局见过你吗？
these days  ADVANCED  ■used to talk about the present time, in comparison with the past 现在，如今
•Vegetarianism is very popular these days.现在很流行素食。
in those days ■in the past 过去，从前
•In those days people used to write a lot more letters.过去人们多会写信。
any day now ■very soon, especially within the next few days 很快，过不了多久；（尤指）就这几天
•The baby's due any day now.就这几天婴儿就要出生了。
by day ■when it is naturally light 白天，白天的时候
•I prefer travelling by day.我喜欢在白天旅行。
day after day ■repeatedly, every day 日复一日，每天
•The same problems keep coming up day after day.每天都会出现同样的问题。
day and night ■all the time 日夜，一直
•You can hear the traffic from your room day and night.无论白天晚上你在房间里都会听到车辆的嘈杂声。
day by day ■every day, or more and more as each day passes 每天，天天；日益，越来越
•Day by day he became weaker.他的身体日渐虚弱。
(from) day to day ■If something changes (from) day to day, it changes often 每天；时常
•The symptoms of the disease change from day to day.这种疾病的症状每天都会发生变化。
the days ■a period in history 时期；时代
•How did people communicate in the days before email?没有电子邮件的时候人们是怎样交流的？
to this day ■until now 到现在，直到今天
•To this day nobody knows what happened to him.到现在也没人知道他到底出了甚么事。

[deɪ] noun countable  all in a day's work ■If something difficult, unpleasant or strange is all in a day's work for someone, it is a usual part of their job （棘手、不快或奇怪的事情）为分内工作
•When you're a nurse, cleaning up vomit is all in a day's work.对护士来说，清理呕吐物就是分内工作。

[deɪ] noun countable the best / happiest days of your life ■the most pleasant time you will ever have 最美好的时光
•Adults are fond of telling children that their years at school are the best days of their life.成年人喜欢对孩子说上学那些年是他们一生当中最美好的时光。

[deɪ] noun countable day in day out ■(especially of something boring) done or happening every day for a long period of time （尤指枯燥之事）一天接一天，日复一日
•I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.我每天都要做这些单调乏味的工作。

[deɪ] noun countable  sb's/sth's days are numbered ■If someone or something's days are numbered, they will not exist for much longer …的时日不多；（某人）将不久于人世
•The latest opinion polls suggest that his days as leader are numbered.最新的民意调查显示，他在领导者的位置上坐不了多久。

[deɪ] noun countable have had its/your day ■to be much less popular than before 风光不再，不比从前，不再走红
•She sold a lot of books in the 1960's, but she's had her day.20世纪60年代她的书很畅销，但如今已经风光不再了。

[deɪ] noun countable  have your day in court ■to get an opportunity to give your opinion on something or to explain your actions after they have been criticized 争取机会（公开地）发表意见或为自己的行为辩护
•She was determined to get her day in court and the TV interview would give it to her.她决心要公开发表意见。接受电视采访正是一个好机会。

[deɪ] noun countable in all my (born) days ■in all of my life 一生，一辈子
•I've never seen anything so strange in all my born days.我一辈子都没见过这么奇怪的事情。

[deɪ] noun countable in my day ■when I was young 我小的时候；当年
•Children take so much for granted nowadays - in my day a new bike was really special.现在的孩子把很多东西都太不当作一回事了——我小的时候一辆新脚踏车就是件稀罕之物。

[deɪ] noun countable in this day and age ■at the present time 如今，当前，当今
•You can't afford to run businesses inefficiently in this day and age.如今低效经营企业是行不通的。

[deɪ] noun countable make sb's day ■to make someone happy 使（某人）高兴，取悦（某人）
•Seeing Adrian again after such a long time really made my day.过了这么久能与阿德里安再次见面真让我感到高兴。

[deɪ] noun countable not be sb's day ■If it is not your day, you are having a difficult or unpleasant day （某人）身处逆境，不走运，倒楣
•This really isn't my day - my wallet was stolen and now I've lost my car keys.今天我可真够倒楣的——先是钱包被偷，现在车匙又丢了。

[deɪ] noun countable one of these days ■some time in the near future 将来有一天，过不了多久
•You're going to get into serious trouble one of these days.将来有一天你会惹上大麻烦。

[deɪ] noun countable one of those days ■a bad day, full of problems 倒楣的日子，不走运的日子
•It's just been one of those days.今天真倒楣。

[deɪ] noun countable one/some day  IMPROVER  ■at some time in the future 将来有一天，将来某一天
•I'd love to go to China some/one day.将来有一天我要去中国。

[deɪ] noun countable  take each day as it comes / take it one day at a time ■to deal with things as they happen, and not to make plans or to worry about the future 顺其自然，不为未来计划或忧虑
•I've lived through a lot of changes recently, but I've learnt to take each day at it comes.近来遇到诸多变故，但我已学会凡事要顺其自然。

[deɪ] noun countable that'll be the day ■something you say in order to show you think something is unlikely to happen （表示不太相信）胡说，哪有这样的事
•"Mike says he's going to give up smoking." "That'll be the day!"“麦克说他要戒烟了。”“别听他乱说！”

[deɪ] noun countable those were the days ■something you say which means life was better at the time in the past that you are talking about 那时候可真好，那才是好时光
•We were young and madly in love. Ah, those were the days!我们当时都很年轻，正处于热恋。唉，那时候多好啊！

[deɪ] noun countable to the day ■exactly 正好，刚好
•She died ten years ago to the day.她正好在十年前的今天去世。

[deɪ] noun countable   Common Learner Errors   dayWarning:  choose the correct preposition!To talk about when something happened or will happen, don't say 'in/at' this/that day, say on this/that day :✗ I will always remember where I was in that day.I will always remember where I was on that day.




day, date

这组词都有“日”的意思，其区别是：
day: 泛指任何一天，或指含有“一昼夜”意义的一天，也可指工作日。可用复数表时代、时期。
date: 指具体的年、月、日，或指年代、时代。


n. 一天；时期；白昼
 - period, season, page
adj. 日间的；逐日的
 - day-to-day
examples: 英 [deɪ] 美 [deɪ]
n.白天；一天；时代

(1) Owls sleep by day and work at night.(2) There will be occasional showers during the day.(3) He is seldom at home during the day.(4) You can see stars by night, but not by day.(5) He has been working all day.(6) The eggs began to decompose after a day in the sun.(7) The milkman comes every other day.(8) He was a great singer once but now he's had his day.
(1) 猫头鹰白天睡觉晚上工作。(2) 白天将偶有阵雨。(3) 他白天很少在家。(4) 你在夜晚可以看到星星，白天却看不到。(5) 他已工作了一整天。(6) 鸡蛋在太阳下放了一天后开始变坏。(7) 送牛奶的人每隔一天来一次。(8) 他曾是个红歌星，但现在风华已去。
[sound:youdao-84daf5f4-c29463f2-d709a3bb-413e0788-4fbabdb7.mp3]

translation:
n. 日光，白昼; 清早，黎明; 公开，发表; <俚>眼睛，视力

分布：日光(63%)，白昼(28%)，黎明(9%)


n.日光,白昼,黎明How many hours of daylight do we have in a day?一天中我们有多少小时有阳光?



noun uncountable ■(the period when there is) natural light from the sun 白天；日光
•The colours look much better in daylight.这些颜色在日光下看起来更漂亮。

['deɪ.laɪt] noun uncountable  beat / knock the (living) daylights out of sb informal ■to hit someone very hard, many times 猛揍，暴打，痛打（某人）
•I'll knock the living daylights out of him if he says that again!他再这样说，我就把他揍扁了！

['deɪ.laɪt] noun uncountable  frighten / scare , etc. the (living) daylights out of sb informal ■to frighten someone very much 吓得（某人）魂飞魄散
•Don't jump out on me like that! You scared the living daylights out of me!别这样跳出来吓我！你差点把我吓死！




n. 白天； [天] 日光；黎明；公开
 - morning, sunlight, publicity, open
examples: 英 ['deɪlaɪt] 美 ['deɪlaɪt]
n.日光；白昼；黎明

(1) One of their big weaknesses is daylight.(2) Daylight robberies were of frequent occurrence.(3) A diurnal animal hunts its food during daylight.(4) They saw gleams of daylight through the cracks.(5) During the holy month of Ramadan, devout Muslims abstain from food, drink and smoking during daylight hours as an act of sacrifice.
(1) 他们其中一个大弱点是日光！(2) 白昼行窃已司空见惯了。(3) 白天活动的动物在白昼时猎食。(4) 他们从缝隙中看到了黎明的曙光。(5) 在回教神圣的斋戒月间，虔诚的回教徒为求牺牲，黎明到日落间禁止吃喝和吸烟。
[sound:youdao-70db50ea-44d015b6-3cba77c9-57ffd691-404cbca9.mp3]

translation:
adj. 死去的; 完全的; 无感觉的; 呆板的
adv. 完全地; 非常; 绝对; 极度
n. 死者; （死一样的）寂静; 极寒时候

分布：死的(37%)，完全地(15%)，沉闷的(10%)，麻木的(10%)，完全的(7%)，无效的(5%)，突然地(5%)，直接地(5%)，筋疲力尽的(2%)，不起作用的(2%)，无趣的(2%)


→来自dheu, 死，词源同die.
a.死的;无生命的;死气沉沉的ad.完全地The bead is put on the forehead of the dead shepherd ahead of the herd.珠子被戴在牧群前面的死牧羊人的前额上.



adjective NOT LIVING  死的   ESSENTIAL  ■not now living 死的，死亡的，去世的
•She's been dead for twenty years now.到现在她已经去世20年了。

•The motorcyclist was dead on arrival at the hospital.那位摩托车骑士被送到医院时已经死亡。

•He was shot dead (= killed by shooting) outside his home.他在家门外被人开抢打死了。
■mainly UK ■If a part of your body is dead, you cannot feel it （身体局部）失去知觉的，麻木的
•I've been sitting with my legs crossed for so long, my right leg has gone dead.我两双腿盘坐了很久，结果右腿都麻木了。
■UK ■describes empty glasses and bottles that were previously full （杯子、瓶子等）空了的■In some sports, if a ball is dead, it is outside the area of play. （某些运动中球）出界的
[ded] adjective BORING  乏味的  ■If a place is dead, it is too quiet and nothing interesting happens there （地方）沉寂的，死气沉沉的
•The city centre's quite lively during the day, but it's totally dead at night.市中心白天相当热闹，晚上却死气沉沉。

[ded] adjective EQUIPMENT  设备  ■If a piece of equipment is dead, it is not working 坏了的，失灵的
•a dead battery没电的电池

•The phone suddenly went dead.电话突然不能用了。

[ded] adjective be (as) dead as a/the dodo informal ■to not be important or popular any longer 失势；过时；不再走红
•Who cares about Socialism any more? Socialism's as dead as the dodo.谁还会关心社会主义啊？它老早就过时了。

[ded] adjective be as dead as a doornail informal ■to be clearly and obviously dead 显然已经死了；死僵了
[ded] adjective be dead in the water ■If something is dead in the water, it has failed and it seems impossible that it will be successful in the future 沉沦，一蹶不振
•So how does a government revive an economy that is dead in the water?那么政府怎样才能使一蹶不振的经济起死回生呢？

[ded] adjective be dead on your feet ■to be very tired 疲惫不堪，累极了
[ded] adjective be dead to the world ■to be sleeping 睡觉
•"Is Georgie up yet?" "I doubt it - she was dead to the world ten minutes ago."“乔姬起床了吗？”“我看还没有--十分钟前她还在睡呢。”

[ded] adjective  Dead men tell no tales. saying ■People who are dead cannot tell secrets 只有死人才会保守秘密
•I think they killed him because he knew too much. Dead men tell no tales.我认为他们把他杀了是因为他知道的太多了。只有死人才不会乱说话。

[ded] adjective  over my dead body ■If you say something will happen over your dead body, you mean that you will do everything you can to prevent it 只要我还有一口气就不能那样做；除非我死了
•"Joe says he's going to buy a motorbike." "Over my dead body!"“祖说他想买辆摩托车。 ”“只要我还有一口气就不准他买！”

[ded] adjective [before noun] adverb ■complete(ly) 完全（的），全然（的）
•The conductor waited for dead silence before commencing the performance.乐队指挥等观众们完全安静下来后才开始表演。

•You won't be able to change his mind - he's dead against the plan.你不可能改变他的想法——他坚决不同意这项计划。

•informal I'm dead certain I left my purse on the desk.我绝对肯定我把钱包留在桌上。

•informal I'm dead (= very) hungry.我饿极了。

•informal The exam was dead (= very) easy.这次考试太容易了。

•UK informal "How was the film?" "It was dead good."“那出电影怎么样？”“棒极了！”

•The post office is dead (= straight) ahead.邮局就在前面。

•Aim for the dead (= exact) centre of the target.瞄准靶子的正中心。

•I always try to arrive dead (= exactly) on time.我总是尽量准时到达。

•Martha's dead set on having (= very much wants to have) a new bike.玛莎一心想要一辆新脚踏车。

•He's dead set against (= completely opposed to) living in the city.他坚决反对住在城里。

[ded] noun the dead [plural] ■dead people 死去的人们，死者
•Three children were among the dead.死者中有三名儿童。

•A ceasefire has been called to allow the survivors to bury their dead.人们呼吁停火以便幸存者能够埋葬他们死去的亲人。

[ded] noun  come back from the dead (also rise from the dead) ■to be successful or popular again after a period of not being successful or popular 东山再起，起死回生
•This was a company that had risen from the dead.这是一间已经起死回生的公司。

[ded] noun in the dead of night/winter ■in the middle of night/winter 午夜／隆冬
•The fire broke out in the dead of night.那场火是午夜时分发生的。





dead, dying

这组词都有“死”的意思，其区别是：
dead: 指已停止呼吸和心脏跳动，与alive(活着的，活的)相对。
dying: 指奄奄一息，行将死亡。


adj. 无生命的；呆板的；废弃了的
 - mechanical, wooden
adv. 完全地
 - totally, entirely, completely, absolutely, thoroughly, strictly, fully
n. 死者
 - decedent, departed
examples: 英 [ded] 美 [ded]
adj.死的；不起作用的；无趣的；筋疲力尽的；麻木的；完全的；无效的；沉闷的；（指球）界外的adv.完全地；直接地；突然地

(1) It lay there with its eyes closed, dead as a doornail.(2) He has been dead for two years.(3) The phone went dead.(4) What a dead place this is!(5) The acting was rather dead.(6) The street seems dead without all the bustle of the children.(7) You seem half dead.(8) My dead fingers could not untie the knot.(9) My legs had gone completely dead.(10) She finished speaking, and there was dead silence in the room.(11) His love for you is dead.(12) The debate is now dead.(13) Latin has become a dead language.(14) Many people say that detente is now a dead letter.(15) He fell with a dead thud.(16) He was dead asleep.(17) You can be dead sure of my innocence.(18) The wind was dead against us.(19) She stopped dead on the stairway.

(1) 它躺在那里眼睛闭著，确实死了。(2) 他已死了两年。(3) 电话打不通了。(4) 这地方多没意思!(5) 表演十分乏味.(6) 没有孩子的嬉戏,街道上死气沉沉的。(7) 你看起来累得半死不活的。(8) 我的手指麻木了，解不开结。(9) 我的腿完全没知觉了。(10) 她发言之后,屋内变得鸦雀无声。(11) 他对你的爱情已不复存在。(12) 辩论现已过时。(13) 拉丁语已成为一种死语言。(14) 很多人说缓和国际紧张局势的论调已是明日黄花。(15) 他砰的一声倒了下来。(16) 他酣然大睡。(17) 你绝对可以相信我是无辜的。(18) 风正对着我们吹。(19) 她突然在楼梯上停住了
[sound:youdao-4b60af7d-488f9340-196537e2-f3eba7b2-ee59a9cd.mp3]

translation:
adj. 极端的，非常的; 致命的，致死的; 非常有效的; 如死一般的
adv. 极其，非常; 死了一样地

级别：deadlier, deadliest
分布：致命的(95%)，如死一般地(3%)，如死一样的(1%)，非常地(1%)


a.致命的;势不两立的;极度的;必定的The dreadful tread on the meadow broke the deadly deadlock.草场上可怕的践踏声打破了致命的僵局.



adjective VERY DANGEROUS  非常危险的   ADVANCED  ■likely to cause death 致命的，致死的
•a deadly virus致命的病毒

•a deadly weapon致命的武器

['ded.li] adjective BORING  乏味的  informal ■extremely boring 极其乏味的，非常无聊的
•The party was deadly.那个派对非常乏味。

['ded.li] adjective COMPLETE  完全地  ■complete or extreme 完全的；极端的
•They have been deadly enemies ever since Mark stole Greg's girlfriend.自从马克抢走了葛列格的女朋友后，他们两人就成了死对头。

['ded.li] adverb ■completely or extremely 完全地；极其
•I thought she was joking but she was deadly serious.我原以为她在开玩笑，没想到她说的全是真的。





mortal, fatal, lethal, deadly

这组词都有“致命的”的意思，其区别是：
mortal: 语气强，指导致死亡的直接原因。
fatal: 正式用词，强调死亡的不可避免性，多用于指伤或疾病等。
lethal: 指由于某物本身具有致命的性能。
deadly: 指能致命或实际已致命的事物，也可指企图致死他人的人。


adj. [医] 致命的；非常的；死一般的
 - intense, kill, fatal
adv. 非常；如死一般地
 - extremely, badly, highly, greatly, too
examples: 英 ['dedli] 美 ['dedli]
adj.致命的；如死一样的adv.非常地；如死一般地

(1) Cancer is a deadly disease.(2) Fog is the sailor's deadly enemy.(3) The accident subjected her to a deadly blow.(4) The conference was deadly dull.(5) There was deadly silence in the valley.(6) His face had a deadly paleness after the accident.(7) Mary is finding life deadly monotonous .(8) He is deadly serious about his work.(9) Barkeeper was embraced almost deadly.(10) The good knub will not hurt you deadly.
(1) 癌症是一种致命的疾病。(2) 雾是航海者最致命的敌人。(3) 这次意外使她受到致命的打击。(4) 会议开得死气沉沉的。(5) 山谷里死一般的沉寂。(6) 事故发生以后，他的脸死一般苍白。(7) 玛丽感到生活非常单调。(8) 他对他的工作非常认真。(9) 酒保几乎被拥抱致死。(10) 良性肿瘤不会对你有致命的伤害。

translation:
adj. 聋的; 不愿听的

级别：deafer, deafest
分布：聋的(74%)，充耳不闻的(26%)


→来自dheubh, 混乱，模糊，词源同dumb, dull.引申义聋的。
a.聋的;不愿听的Beneath (Underneath) the wreath the deaf man near death is out of breath.花环下面那个快要死的聋子喘不过气来.



adjective  IMPROVER  ■unable to hear, either completely or partly 耳聋的，听不见的，失聪的
•He's been totally/partially deaf since birth.他一出生就完全失聪／有些听力障碍。
■disapproving ■unwilling to listen 不愿听的；充耳不闻的
•The local council has remained deaf to all the objections to its proposals.当地议会对反对其提案的各种声音充耳不闻。

[def] adjective (as) deaf as a post informal ■completely deaf 一点儿也听不见，完全失聪
•Grandad's as deaf as a post.爷爷一点儿声音也听不见了。

[def] adjective  There's none so deaf as those who will not hear. saying ■said about someone who has been given advice which they have chosen to ignore, or who has been told something which they do not want to believe 无心听者耳最聋。
[def] plural noun the deaf  IMPROVER  ■people who are unable to hear 耳聋者，失聪人士，聋人
•Many of the TV programmes are broadcast with subtitles for the deaf.很多电视节目播出时，都打上给失聪人士看的字幕。




adj. 聋的
 - dunny
examples: 英 [def] 美 [def]
adj.聋的；充耳不闻的
(1) He is deaf in one ear.(2) He's a deaf mute and cannot tell anyone secret.(3) He is always deaf to his teacher's advice.(4) He turns a deaf ear to criticism media.
(1) 他有一只耳朵是聋的。(2) 他是个聋哑人，不会把他们的秘密告诉任何人。(3) 他总是对他老师的忠告充耳不闻。(4) 他对媒体的批评充耳不闻。

translation:
vt. [牌戏]分; 分配; 经营; 施予
n. （一笔）交易; 许多; 待遇; 发牌
vi. 论述; （有效地或成功地）处理; 惩处; 交易
adj. 冷杉木制的，松木制的

时态：dealt, dealing, deals
分布：交易(44%)，处理(40%)，应付(7%)，大量(4%)，经营(3%)，协定(1%)，分配(1%)


→来自dail, 分配，词源同time, demotic. 引申义发牌，交易，经营。
v.处理;做买卖,经营;分配;对待n.交易The zealous dealer has an ideal idea of dealing with the meal.热心的商人有一个处理膳食的理想主意.



noun AGREEMENT  协议   ESSENTIAL  countable ■an agreement or an arrangement, especially in business （尤指商业上的）协议，交易
•a business deal商业交易

•The unions and management have made a two-year pay and productivity deal.工会和管理层签订了一份为期两年的工资与生产效率协议。

•I'll make/do  a deal  with you - you wash the car and I'll let you use it tonight.我和你做个交易吧——你把车洗了，今晚就让你用。

•She got a good deal (= paid a low price) on her new house.她买新房子时捡了个大便宜。

•Is industry getting  a  raw/rough deal from (= being unfairly/badly treated by) the EU?生产制造业是否正受到欧盟的不公平／恶劣待遇？

[dɪəl] noun AMOUNT  数量  a good/great deal  IMPROVER  ■a large amount; much 大量；很多
•She spends a good deal of her time in Glasgow.她通常住在格拉斯哥。

•A great deal of effort has gone into making the software reliable.已投入大量精力去提高该软体的稳定性。

•They still need a great deal more money to finish the project.他们仍然需要更多的资金才能完成那个企划案。

[dɪəl] noun SHARING OUT  分出  countable ■when someone deals (= shares out) , especially playing cards 分出；分发；（尤指）分牌，发牌
•It's your deal (= turn to deal).到你发牌了。

[dɪəl] verb intransitive or transitive (dealt, dealt)DO BUSINESS  做生意   ADVANCED  ■to do business 做生意，出售；经营；买卖
•We only deal with companies which have a good credit record.我们只与信誉良好的公司做生意。

•slang How long had she been dealing (= selling drugs) before she was arrested?她被捕前贩毒多久了？

•slang He was suspected of dealing (= selling) cocaine.他涉嫌贩卖古柯碱。

[dɪəl] verb intransitive or transitive (dealt, dealt)SHARE OUT  分出  ■to give or share out something, especially playing cards 分出；分发；（尤指）分牌，发牌
•Whose turn is it to deal?该谁发牌了？

•Would you like to deal (out) the cards?你想发牌吗？

•[+ two objects] Deal them five cards each./Deal five cards to each of them.给他们每人发五张牌。

•We have only a small amount of food and clothing to deal out to each refugee.我们只能给每个难民分发少量的食物和衣服。
deal a blow to sb/sth (also deal sb/sth a blow) ■to cause someone or something, usually a plan or hope, to fail or to be affected very badly 使（计划或希望）破灭；使受挫，使失败
•The latest trade figures have dealt a severe blow to hopes of an early economic recovery.最新的贸易数据彻底粉碎了经济早日复苏的希望。

[dɪəl] verb intransitive or transitive (dealt, dealt)  Phrasal Verbs   deal in sth ■to buy and sell particular goods as a business 经营，经销；买卖
•They mainly deal in rare books.他们主要经营珍本图书。

[dɪəl] verb intransitive or transitive (dealt, dealt)  Phrasal Verbs   deal with sb  ADVANCED  ■to talk to someone or meet someone, especially as part of your job （尤指工作上）与（某人）打交道，对付
•She's used to dealing with difficult customers.她已经习惯了与难缠的顾客打交道。

[dɪəl] verb intransitive or transitive (dealt, dealt)  Phrasal Verbs   deal with sth TAKE ACTION   IMPROVER  ■to take action in order to achieve something or in order to solve a problem 处理，动手解决
•How do you intend to deal with this problem?你想怎样解决这个问题？

•General enquiries are dealt with by our head office.普通的咨询由我们总部来处理。
BE ABOUT  ■to be about or be on the subject of something 关于，涉及；论述
•Her new film deals with the relationship between a woman and her sick daughter.她的新电影讲述的是一个女人与她患病女儿之间发生的故事。

•The author has tried to deal with (= write about) a very difficult subject.作者试图论述一个难度非常高的主题。





deal, trade, bargain, commerce, business

这组词都有“贸易，交易”的意思，其区别是：
deal: 口语用词，指买卖双方经过交涉达成协议成交。
trade: 普通用词，含义广。既可指某种具体的商业又可指广泛的贸易。
bargain: 多指买卖双方通过谈判、协商就商品质量、数量、价格等项达成协议所成的生意。
commerce: 多指大规模的买卖或易货关系。
business: 指包括售货、购货、换货在内的综合商业活动，方式可以是批发或零售。


vt. 处理；给予；分配；发牌
 - afford, allow, extend, deliver, part
vi. 处理；讨论；对待；做生意
 - manage, debate, cope with
n. [贸易] 交易；（美）政策；待遇；份量
 - policy, business, trade, truck
examples: 英 [diːl] 美 [diːl]
n.协定；交易；大量v.应付；分配；处理；交易；经营

(1) We did a deal with the management on overtime.(2) After weeks of negotiating, they're finalizing the deal today.(3) In addition to leaves, these animals eat a great deal of fruit.(4) If the worst comes to the worst, we can always deal with it.(5) The profits will be dealt out among the investors.(6) The meeting will deal with these problems.(7) We deal in hardware but not software.
(1) 在加班问题上我们与管理部门达成一项协议。(2) 经过几周协商,他们今天会搞定交易。(3) 除了树叶之外,这些动物还吃大量的水果。(4) 事情再糟,我们总可以应付。(5) 红利将分发给投资者。(6) 本次会议将就这些问题作出处理。(7) 我们只经营硬件而不经营软件。
[sound:youdao-a1cfb469-f6f187f0-46658973-d0e60dd8-f862300e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 亲爱的; 敬爱的; 昂贵的; 严厉的
n. 亲爱的人; 宠物
int. 哎
adv. 高价地; 疼爱地; 贵

级别：dearer, dearest
分布：亲爱的(82%)，昂贵的(5%)，亲爱的人(5%)，高价地(3%)，可爱的人(2%)，啊(2%)，宝贵的(1%)


→.来自古英语deore,珍贵的，昂贵的。引申义亲爱的，珍重的。比较汉语成语物以稀为贵。
a.昂贵的;亲爱的;珍贵的int.呵!哎呀!Next year the bearded bear will bear a dear baby in the rear.明年,长胡子的熊将在后方产一头可爱的小崽.



US [dɪr] adjective LOVED  亲爱的   ESSENTIAL  ■loved or liked very much 亲爱的，心爱的；可爱的
•She was a very dear friend.她是一位非常亲密的朋友。

•He was very dear to me.他跟我非常亲近。

•This place is very dear to me - we came here on our honeymoon.这个地方对我来讲非常亲切——我们曾到这里度过蜜月。

•What a dear (= very attractive) little kitten!多么可爱的小猫啊！

•My dear Gina - how lovely to see you!我亲爱的吉娜——见到你真是太好了！
 ESSENTIAL  ■used at the beginning of a letter to greet the person you are writing to （用于信的开头作问候语）亲爱的，尊敬的
•Dear Kerry/Mum and Dad/Ms Smith/Sir亲爱的克里／爸爸妈妈／史密斯女士／尊敬的先生

UK [dɪər] US [dɪr] adjective EXPENSIVE  昂贵的  ■costing too much; expensive 昂贵的，高价的
•The food was good but very dear.这里的饭菜不错，就是太贵。

UK [dɪər] US [dɪr] adjective for dear life ■If you do something for dear life, you do it with as much effort as possible, usually to avoid danger 尽全力，竭力
•As the ship began to tilt, we clung on for dear life.当船开始倾斜的时候，我们竭力抓住船身。

UK [dɪər] US [dɪr] exclamation (also old-fashioned dearie) informal ■used in expressions of anger, disappointment, sadness or surprise 天哪（表示愤怒、失望、伤心、吃惊等）
•Oh dear! I've lost my keys again.哦，天哪！我又把锁匙弄丢了。

•Dear me , it's already four-thirty and I said I'd be home by five!天哪，已经四点半了，我说过我五点前要到家的！

•Dearie me , what a mess!天哪，真是太乱了！

UK [dɪər] US [dɪr] noun countable usually singular informal ■a kind person 善良的人，和善之人，好人
•Annie's such a dear - she's brought me breakfast in bed every morning this week.安妮可真是个大好人——这周她每天早上都把早餐送到我的床边。
[as form of address] ■used to address someone you love or are being friendly to, not used between men 亲爱的（不用于男子之间）
•Here's your receipt, dear.亲爱的，这是你的收据。

•Would you like a drink, dear?亲爱的，你想喝一杯吗？

•Lovely to see you, my dear.亲爱的，见到你真是太好了。





expensive, dear, costly

这组词都有“高的，昂贵的”的意思，其区别是：
expensive: 指物品的价格超过了它本身所值，或超过了购买者的支付能力。
dear: 侧重指要价过高，或远高于公道、合理的价格，其反义词是cheap。
costly: 指物品价格高，通常是因物品稀少或珍贵所致。


adj. 亲爱的；尊敬的；昂贵的
 - loving, expensive, rich, costly
int. 哎呀
 - oh, my, ohone
n. 亲爱的人
 - machree
examples: 英 [dɪə(r)] 美 [dɪr]
adj.亲爱的；宝贵的；昂贵的n.可爱的人；亲爱的人adv.高价地int.啊；哎呀(用以表示惊奇、害怕以及其他强烈感情)

(1) They interred their dear comrade in the arms.(2) Dear Julia, I hope you're feeling better now.(3) Dear young ladies--I am deeply touched by your remembrance.(4) He lost everything that was dear to him.(5) The comfort of others was dear to me.(6) Her daughter is very dear to her.(7) A dear ship stands long in the haven.(8) Clothes are getting dearer.(9) The shop is too dear for me.(10) Thank you, you are a dear!(11) Be a dear and give me that book.(12) Yes, dear, I will write to mother.(13) Don't cry, my dear, you are going to be Ok.(14) Dear, go to bed. You're slumbering.(15) Fear not, my dear, for I am here.(16) If you want to make money, buy cheap and sell dear.(17) Dear me! What a mess!(18) Oh dear! I forgot to post the letter.(19) Oh dear! I think I've lost it.

(1) 他们埋葬了他们亲爱的战友。(2) 亲爱的朱莉,我希望你现在感觉能好点。(3) 亲爱的姑娘们，你们的纪念品使我深受感动。(4) 他所珍贵的一切都损失了。(5) 我珍视别人的幸福。(6) 她的女儿是她心爱的宝贝。(7) 一只贵重的船在港口停留很久。(8) 衣服越来越贵了.(9) 对我来说,这家商店的价格太高了。(10) 谢谢你,你真是个好人！(11) 做做好事,把那本书给我吧。(12) 是的,亲爱的,我要给妈妈写信。(13) 别哭了，亲爱的，你会好起来的。(14) 亲爱的，去上床睡吧，你都打瞌睡了。(15) 不要害怕，亲爱的，因为有我在这里。(16) 要想赚钱就得贱买贵卖。(17) 天哪! 乱成什麽样子了!(18) 哎呀!我忘了寄信。(19) 哎呀！我可能把它丢了。
[sound:youdao-79ffaa47-73a658a7-25ca64ce-9db8d9d7-6f354709.mp3]

translation:
n. 死亡; （某种）死法，死亡方式; 病危; 死神

分布：死(69%)，死亡(28%)，毁灭(2%)，死因(1%)


→来自dead的名词形式。
n.死,死亡;灭亡,毁灭,死因Beneath (Underneath) the wreath the deaf man near death is out of breath.花环下面那个快要死的聋子喘不过气来.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the end of life 死，死亡
•The disease causes thousands of deaths a year.这种疾病每年导致数千人死亡。

•Do you believe in life after death?你相信死后还有来世吗？

•He never got over the death of his daughter.他一直没有从女儿去世的阴影中走出来。

•death threats死亡威胁
bored/frightened, etc. to death  IMPROVER  ■extremely bored, frightened, etc. 无聊／吓得要死的等to death ■until you die 至死，直到死亡
•The animals burned to death in the barn.那些牲口在牲口棚里被活活烧死了。

•He choked to death on a fish bone.他被一根鱼骨鲠死了。

•The traitor was put to death (= killed as a punishment).叛徒被处死了。
the death of sth ■the cause of the end of life, or the end or destruction of something …的死因；…的末路，…的毁灭
•The failure of the family business was the death of him.家族企业的落败把他送上了末路。

•That child will be the death of me (= is always doing something which upsets me) !这孩子非把我烦死不可！

[deθ] noun countable or uncountable be at death's door informal ■to be very ill 病入膏肓
[deθ] noun countable or uncountable be in at the death UK ■to be present at the important time when something comes to an end 目睹了…的结束，目睹了…的终结
[deθ] noun countable or uncountable  catch your death of cold informal ■to catch a very bad cold (= illness) because you are not wearing warm or dry clothes, etc. （因穿着单薄等原因）患上重感冒
[deθ] noun countable or uncountable  look / feel like death warmed up UK (US look/feel like death warmed over) informal  ■to look or feel very ill 看起来／感觉病得不轻
•He shouldn't be working when he's so ill - he looks like death warmed up!他那么不舒服就不应该上班——看来他病得不轻！




n. 死； [医] 死亡；死神；毁灭
 - destruction, dying
examples: 英 [deθ] 美 [deθ]
n.死；死亡；毁灭；死因

(1) The seedling was frozen to death.(2) The farm came to him on his father's death.(3) The film ends with the death of the heroine.(4) Car accidents caused many deaths.(5) He had to choose between death and dishonour.(6) That defeat meant the death of all my hopes.(7) There are conflicting versions of the girl's death.(8) The policeman wanted to determine her death.
(1) 幼苗被冻死了。(2) 他父亲死时把农场留给他了。(3) 这部电影以女主角的死告终。(4) 车祸造成很多人死亡。(5) 他必须在死亡和屈辱之间作出选择。(6) 那次失败毁灭了我所有的希望。(7) 女孩死因的说法相互矛盾。(8) 那名警察想要查明她的死因。
[sound:youdao-186d410a-49ea4c71-a3763a7b-331d9ff1-9ced0973.mp3]

translation:
n. 讨论; 辩论; 争论; 辩论
vt. & vi. 辩论; 仔细考虑; 思考; 盘算

时态：debated, debating, debates
分布：辩论(58%)，争论(28%)，讨论(13%)，思考(1%)


→de-, 加强。-bat, 击打，词源同beat, batter. 引申义交锋，争辩。
辩论,讨论(de加强+dat+e→加强打击→反驳,辩论)[bat=beat,表示"打,击"]
v./n.争论,辩论There has been much debate about the bill.关于该法案有很多争论.
【记】bate打，击－互相打击－辩论【参】debatable（adj 不肯定的，可争议的）



noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■(a) serious discussion of a subject in which many people take part 谈论，讨论；争论，辩论
•Education is the current focus of public debate.教育是目前大众谈论的焦点。

•How we proceed from here is a matter for debate.我们还需要讨论下一步该怎样做。

•Over the year we have had several debates about future policy.一年来，我们就未来的政策进行了几次讨论。

[dɪ'beɪt] verb  ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to discuss a subject in a formal way 讨论；争论
•In Parliament today, MPs debated the Finance Bill.今天在议会上议员们讨论了财政法案。

•They had been debating for several hours without reaching a conclusion.他们已经争论了好几个小时，仍然没有得出一个结论。

•[+ question word] The authorities debated wh ether to build a new car park.政府有关部门就是否要修建一座新停车场进行了讨论。
transitive ■to try to make a decision about something 斟酌；考虑
•[+ question word] We debated wh ether to take the earlier train.我们考虑到底要不要乘早一点的那班列车。

•I'm still debating what colour to paint the walls.我还在考虑要把墙刷成甚么颜色。





argue, reason, discuss, dispute, debate, quarrel

这组词都有“辩论，争论，说理”的意思，其区别是：
argue: 指提出理由或证据为自己或自己一方的看法或立场辩护，着重说理、论证和企图说服。
reason: 指据理力争以说服对方或求得对问题作更深入的研究。
discuss: 最常用词，指就某一或某些问题表明观点、看法等，以便统一认识，解决问题。
dispute: 侧重对分歧进行激烈或热烈的争论或争辩，带一定感情色彩，常隐含“各持已见”或“争论不休”意味。
debate: 侧重指意见等对立的双方之间正式或公开的争辩。
quarrel: 指两人之间或两个团体之间不友好的、吵吵嚷嚷地大声争论某事，尤指“吵嘴、吵架”。



argument, controversy, dispute, debate, conflict, strife, quarrel

这组词都有“争执、不和”的意思，其区别是：
argument: 指辩论双方均以事实或理由来说服对方的辨论。
controversy: 侧重指深刻的意见分歧，多指对引起广泛兴趣或非常重要的问题的辨论。
dispute: 普通用词，侧重指长时间，言词激烈，针锋相对的争辩。
debate: 通常指经过仔细组织和计划的个人或团体之间的辩论。
conflict: 指双方坚持已见、互不妥协，怀有敌意的争论，多暗示分歧极为严重，有时用语言无法解决，只得诉诸武力。
strife: 指因不可缓和的矛盾而引起的争吵或斗殴。
quarrel: 普通用词，既可指言词激烈的争吵，也可指温和的言词上的不和。


vt. [法] 辩论，争论，讨论
 - reason, dispute about
vi. [法] 辩论，争论，讨论
 - deal, pro-and-con
n. [法] 辩论；辩论会
 - dispute, controversy
examples: [联想] 得背它（稿子），辩论的时候的背稿子。[对比] debate, argue, discuss, dispute共同意思是“辩论”“讨论”“争论”。其中最常用的是discuss,通过各种途径(摆事实或讲道理),分析各种观点(肯定的或否定的等),讨论各种问题(国家大事或日常小事等),采用各种方法(激烈争辩或平心静气探讨切磋)都可以用discuss。其他各词则各有侧重：argue强调主体确认自己的观点是正确的,引用单方面论据为自己辩解并批驳对方。debate强调公开地、有组织的讨论或辩论重大问题,口语中则强调不同观点激烈交锋。dispute则强调争论的激烈性,有争吵不休的味道,而内容则多为日常生活
英 [dɪ'beɪt] 美 [dɪ'beɪt]
n.辩论；讨论vt.争论；思考vi.辩论

(1) After a long debate, the house of commons approved the bill.(2) We had a long debate as to whether we should spend so much money on space technology.(3) Her resignation caused much public debate.(4) There has been heated debate about whether the film should be allowed.(5) He debated buying a new car, but didn't in the end.(6) This is a question that they have often debated.
(1) 经过长时间的辩论，下议院通过了议案。(2) 至于我们要否花那么多钱在太空技术上,我们辩论了很久。(3) 她辞职一事引起群众议论纷纷。(4) 关于这场电影是否该通过,人们展开了热烈的讨论。(5) 他思量很久是否买辆新汽车,但最后还是没买。(6) 这是个他们常讨论的问题。
[sound:youdao-dcc2d9f6-03e84f3d-fd594615-44d21fb4-6cba4be0.mp3]

translation:
n. 债务; 负债情况; 义务; 罪，过失

分布：债务(91%)，义务(3%)，罪(2%)，恩情(2%)，负债状态(2%)


→来自拉丁语debitum, 亏欠。来自de-, 向下，离开，-hab, 持，握，拥有，词源同habit. 即把别人的东西拿走的，亏欠的，后指借款，债务。
债务[deb=owe(欠债)]
n.债,债务I am in debt now.我负债累累.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■something, especially money, which is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something 借款，欠款；债务
•He managed to pay off his debts in two years.他设法在两年内还清债务。

•The firm ran up huge debts.公司很快就负债累累。

•They are in debt to (= owe money to) the bank.他们欠银行的钱。

•He ran/got into debt (= borrowed money) after he lost his job.他失业后开始举债。

•The company is deep in debt (= owes a lot of money).公司已经债台高筑。
⇒ See also indebted



n. 债务；借款；罪过
 - liability, loan, borrowing
examples: 英 [det] 美 [det]
n.债务；恩情；负债状态；义务；罪

(1) He promised to pay his debt within a month.(2) If I pay all my debts I'll have no money.(3) We owe you a debt of gratitude for you help.(4) The company is deep in debt.(5) We'll run into debt if you spend more than our income.(6) You have an obligation to pay your debt to society.(7) Liabilities are the obligatio or debt that a busine must pay in money or services at some time in the future.(8) He's in debt to the extent of200.(9) They said that they would drop the charges if we paid off the debt.
(1) 他保证在1个月内偿还债务。(2) 我若还请所有欠债就分文不剩了。(3) 承蒙帮助，感恩不尽。(4) 这家公司正负债累累。(5) 要是你花的比我们挣的还多，我们就要欠债了。(6) 你有义务偿还对社会的债务。(7) 负债是指将来需用货币或服务偿还的债务或履行的义务。(8) 请求为他犯的偷窃罪从轻量刑。(9) 他们说还清欠款就可以顶罪了。
[sound:youdao-3bcbe556-da867bf9-6e5774e3-335edcd1-ba0349de.mp3]

translation:
n. 十年，十年间; 十个一组; 十年期

分布：十年(100%)


→来自dekm, 十，词源同ten,dean.
十年(dec十;参考:decagon十角形[-ade表名词1.表示"状态,物品"2.表示"个人或集体"]
n.十年The academic topic is why the blade of the spade is still sharp after decades' decay.学术话题是为什么铁锨刃口经过几十年的腐烂之后仍然锋利.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a period of ten years, especially a period such as 1860 to 1869, or 1990 to 1999 十年；年代



n. 十年，十年期；十
 - decennium, dix
examples: 英 ['dekeɪd] 美 ['dekeɪd]
n.十年

(1) Prices have risen steadily during the past decade.(2) Several decades have elapsed since I graduated from the college.(3) I believed that this struggle is going to go on and it might well be decided in the next decade.
(1) 在过去十年里，物价一直在上涨。(2) 我大学毕业已数十年了。(3) 我相信这一对抗还将会持续下去，并可能在下一个十年中得出结果。
[sound:youdao-11dfbb97-5a34f28e-67a92f03-15709bab-7eb4fbbc.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. （使）腐烂，腐朽
vi. 衰败，衰退，衰落
n. 腐败、衰退的状态

时态：decayed, decaying, decays
分布：腐烂(63%)，衰退(27%)，腐败(10%)


→de-, 向下。-cay, 同-cad, 掉落，词源同case, accident. 引申义腐烂。
衰退;腐败(de向下＋cay=落下→向下掉→衰退)[cad,cas,cid=fall,表示"落下,降临"]
v./n.腐朽,腐烂;衰减,衰退The academic topic is why the blade of the spade is still sharp after decades' decay.学术话题是为什么铁锨刃口经过几十年的腐烂之后仍然锋利.



verb intransitive or transitive  ADVANCED  ■to (cause something to) become gradually damaged, worse or less 腐蚀；（使）衰败，（使）衰弱
•Sugar makes your teeth decay.糖能引起蛀牙。

•The role of the extended family has been decaying for some time.大家庭的作用开始减弱已经有一段时间了。

•Pollution has decayed the surface of the stonework on the front of the cathedral.大教堂前部的石刻表面已经因为污染受到了侵蚀。

•the smell of decaying meat腐肉气味

[dɪ'keɪ] noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■when something decays 腐蚀；衰败，衰弱
•environmental/industrial/moral/urban decay环境恶化／工业衰退／道德堕落／城市衰落

•dental/tooth decay蛀牙

•The buildings had started to fall into decay.那些建筑已经开始败坏了。

•This industry has been in decay for some time.这行业早就开始息微了。





rot, decompose, decay

这组词都有“烂、腐烂”的意思，其区别是：
rot: 指蔬菜水果或肉类的分解、腐烂。
decompose: 侧重指动物或植物类物体由于内部组织的分解而导致的腐烂过程。
decay: 通常指由良好或完美的状态自然而缓慢地变坏或完全变坏腐烂，或部分地毁坏。


vi. 衰退， [核] 衰减；腐烂， [木] 腐朽
 - fail, flag
n. 衰退， [核] 衰减；腐烂， [木] 腐朽
 - recession, downturn, decline, decomposition
vt. 使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落
 - corrupt, septicize
examples: 英 [dɪ'keɪ] 美 [dɪ'keɪ]
v.(使)衰退；(使)腐败；(使)腐烂n.衰退；腐烂；腐败

(1) Naomi: Your entire body is begining to decay.(2) What made the Roman Empire decay?(3) The dampness of the climate decayed the books.(4) The vegetables have begun to decay.(5) His mental decay is distressing.(6) Bacteria complete the job by causing decay.(7) The dentist could detect no decay in her teeth.
(1) 直美:你的整个身体都在衰退。(2) 罗马帝国为何衰亡？(3) 气候潮湿，把书都霉坏了。(4) 那些蔬菜已开始腐烂。(5) 他的智力衰退令人苦恼。(6) 细菌通过引起腐烂而完成这个变化。(7) 牙医检查了她的牙，未见有龋齿。
[sound:youdao-9549a738-6f70e7e4-a991e0f7-d7cbef33-f79e7b83.mp3]

translation:
n. 欺骗，欺诈; 诡计; 谎言

分布：欺骗(83%)，诡计(13%)，不诚实(4%)


→de-, 向下，离开。-ceit, 拿，握，词源同capture, conceit,conceive. 引申义拿走，欺骗。
n.欺骗,欺骗行为I perceived that the veil clung on the ceiling of the clinic was deceit.我觉察到粘附在诊所天花板上的幔子是个骗局.
【记】de下面，ceit抓住－在牌桌下面抓住一张牌－出老千－欺骗【参】conceit（n 自负；狂妄）；conceive（vt 构思）；deceitful（adj 不诚实的）＝dishonest



noun countable or uncountable ■(an act of) keeping the truth hidden, especially to get an advantage 欺骗；欺诈
•The story is about theft, fraud and deceit on an incredible scale.小说描述了令人难以置信的盗窃、行骗和欺诈行为。

•When the newspapers published the full story, all his earlier deceits were revealed.报纸登出事情的种种经过后，他以前的所有欺骗行为也就暴露无遗了。





deception, fraud, deceit

这组词都有“欺骗”的意思，其区别是：
deception: 语气较弱，一般用词，侧重于具体的骗人行为。但有时并无欺骗行为，只是玩弄把戏，故弄玄虚而已。
fraud: 一般用于犯罪行为的欺骗，通常指政治或经济活动中的舞弊行为。
deceit: 指歪曲实情，惯于说谎或蓄意欺骗。


n. 欺骗；谎言；欺诈手段
 - fraud, lie, fiction
examples: [联想] de=得，ce=测，it=他，得测测他是不是【欺骗】我deceive v.欺骗欺诈；deceit n.欺骗欺诈；fraud v.欺骗
英 [dɪ'siːt] 美 [dɪ'siːt]
n.欺骗；诡计；不诚实
(1) She told him of his old mother's deceit.(2) Deceit is a gift, but vengeance is swift.(3) He was enmeshed in a web of deceit and lies.
(1) 她向他诉说了母后的欺骗行为。(2) 欺骗可能会获得短暂的利益，但报复也会迅速地随之而来。(3) 他陷入充满诡计和谎言的圈套。
[sound:youdao-fdcef562-8ea4823a-584bbc6e-8d5db863-094d4624.mp3]

translation:
v. 欺诈; 误导

时态：deceived, deceiving, deceives
分布：欺骗(92%)，行骗(8%)


→来自deceit, 欺骗。
欺骗[cap,capt,cept,ceive,cip,cup=take,hold,seize,表示"拿,抓,握住"]
v.欺骗,蒙蔽He has deliberately deceived us.他有意地欺骗我们.
【记】刚刚receive了好吃的，就被deceive了，shit！



verb transitive  ADVANCED  ■to persuade someone that something false is the truth; to keep the truth hidden from someone for your own advantage; to trick 欺骗，蒙骗；隐瞒
•The company deceived customers by selling old computers as new ones.该公司用旧电脑冒充新机器欺骗顾客。

•The sound of the door closing deceived me into thinking they had gone out.关门声让我以为他们己经出门了。
deceive yourself [R] ■to refuse to accept the truth 自欺欺人，欺骗自己
•She thinks he'll come back, but she's deceiving herself.她认为他会回来，实际上她是在自欺欺人。

[dɪ'si:v] verb transitive  Are my eyes deceiving me? ■something you say when you cannot believe what you see 我眼前的一切是真的吗？
•Is that snow in May, or are my eyes deceiving me?那是五月雪，是真的吗？





deceive, cheat, hide, conceal

deceive: 不告诉实情
cheat: 不诚实手段获取个人利益；
hide: 不含故意的意思；
conceal: 故意隐藏；



deceive, cheat, trick, fool

这组词都有“欺骗”的意思，其区别是：
deceive: 最普通用词，指用虚假外表使人信以为真，或蓄意歪曲事实，或造成错误印象使人上当受骗。
cheat: 普通用词，指用蒙蔽他人的手段取得所需之物，尤多指在赢利的买卖中欺骗人。
trick: 指用阴谋诡计等骗得信任或得到所需之物。
fool: 指把别人当傻瓜，愚弄欺骗别人。


v. 欺骗；行骗
 - take in sb, give the shaft
examples: 英 [dɪ'siːv] 美 [dɪ'siːv]
vt.欺骗vi.行骗

(1) It's not honorable to deceive them.(2) He was foiled in his attempt to deceive us.(3) He deceived me into signing the papers.(4) You are deceiving yourself if you still believe that she loves you.(5) Appearances can deceive.(6) Who are ready to believe are easy to deceive.
(1) 欺骗他们是不光彩的。(2) 他企图欺骗我们,但没有得逞。(3) 他骗我在文件上签了字。(4) 你如果还相信她爱你，你就是在欺骗自己。(5) 外表是有欺骗性的。(6) 轻信的人容易受骗。
[sound:youdao-d1d2ef7d-a343f940-379d5025-5e9dad25-9282cdc0.mp3]

translation:
n. 十二月

分布：十二月(100%)


→来自decem-, 十，词源同ten.原指古罗马历的十月，后为使历法更科学，加入了January, February, 而原来的十月顺延到十二月。
n.十二月Christmas is on December 25th.圣诞节是十二月二十五日.



US [-bɚ] (written abbreviation Dec) noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the twelfth and last month of the year, after November and before January 十二月
•23(rd) December/December 23(rd)12月23日

•We went to Mexico on the twelfth of December/December the twelfth/ mainly USDecember twelfth.12月12日我们去了墨西哥。

•Their baby was born last /is expected next December.他们的孩子是去年12月出生的／预计今年12月出生。

•My parents got married in/during December.我父母是在12月结婚的。

•It was one of the coldest Decembers ever.那是极冷的一个12月。
examples: 英 [dɪ'sembə(r)] 美 [dɪ'sembər]
n.十二月

(1) The weather in early December was bleak and unpleasant.(2) My little daughter was born in December.(3) December is the last month of the year.(4) Postal applications must be received by 12 December.(5) Here it is December and New Year is coming.
(1) 十二月初的天气又阴冷又难受。(2) 我的小女儿是十二月出生的。(3) 十二月是一年的最后一个月份。(4) 邮寄的申请书须于12月12日以前寄达。(5) 现在是十二月，新年就要来了。
[sound:youdao-34b6056a-ed4a3a08-ecb761cc-6bc2a17c-4f8f4f2a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 正派的; 得体的; （服装等）相称的，合宜的; 相当好的

分布：体面的(53%)，正派的(25%)，相当好的(12%)，适当的(10%)


→来自dek, 接受，得体，合适，词源同doctor, dignity.
a.体面的;正派的,合乎礼仪的;合适的Those innocent adolescents ascending the hill are the tribe's descendants of decent descent.这些爬山的天真青少年是这个部落具有正派血统的后代.
【记】de地，cent硬币：我在马路边，拣到一分钱，把……（多么得体的行为！！）【参】decency（n 庄重；正派；端庄）；decant（vt 移入其他容器）【反】seamy（adj 丑恶的）



adjective  IMPROVER  ■socially acceptable or good 正派的；体面的，正经的；像样的，相当不错的
•Everyone should be entitled to a decent wage/standard of living.人人都应该有权获得像样的工资／过着体面的生活。

•I thought he was a decent sort of person.我认为他是个正派人物。

•It  was very decent (= kind) of you  to help.你能帮忙，真是个大好人啊。

•It made quite a decent-sized (= large) hole.它弄出了一个很大的洞。

•After the recent scandal, the priest is expected to do the decent thing and resign from his position.近来的丑闻过后，估计那个牧师会做该做的事，引咎辞职。
■informal ■dressed or wearing clothes 穿好衣服的
•Are you decent yet?你穿好衣服了吗？

•You can come in now, I'm decent.我穿好衣服了，你可以进来了。




adj. 正派的；得体的；相当好的
 - proper, goodish
examples: 英 ['diːsnt] 美 ['diːsnt]
adj.相当好的；体面的；适当的；正派的

(1) Are there any decent restaurants around here?(2) He dreamed of living in decent conditions.(3) The lack of decent public transport is a great disadvantage.(4) John and his wife Leah are very decent people.
(1) 这附近有没有好的餐厅？(2) 他梦想着过体面的生活。(3) 没有适当的公共交通工具是很不方便的。(4) 约翰是他的妻子丽亚都是非常正派的人。
[sound:youdao-2a9964bd-87f5cbc1-c5d9eaf4-6ae1dfa0-67bbf157.mp3]

translation:
vt. 决定; 决心; 解决; 裁决
vi. 决定; 下决心

时态：decided, deciding, decides
分布：决定(96%)，判断(3%)，断定(1%)


→de-, 向下。-cid, 砍，击，词源同concise, incision. 引申义决定。
决定,决心(de加强＋cide切→切下去→下决心)[cid,cis=cut,kill,表示"切开,杀"]
v.决定,下决心;解决,裁决The decisive decimal point made the acid man decide to suicide.决定性的小数点使刻薄之人决定自杀.



verb  ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to choose something, especially after thinking carefully about several possibilities （尤指仔细考虑后）决定，决断，确定
•They have to decide by next Friday.他们必须在下周五前作出决定。

•I don't mind which one we have - you decide.我不在乎给我们哪个——你来决定吧。

•[+ to infinitive] In the end, we decided to go to the theatre.最后我们决定去剧院。

•[+ (that)] She decided (that) she would retire to the country.她决定隐居乡间。

•[+ question word] I can't decide wh at to do.我不知道该怎么办。

•He can't decide wh ether to buy it.他决定不了要不要把它买下来。

•The committee decided in favour of (= made a formal judgment to choose) the cheapest option.委员会决定选用最经济的方案。
transitive ■to be the reason or situation that makes a particular result happen 决定（事情的结果），导致…的结果
•The weather decided the outcome of the cricket match.天气状况决定了板球赛的结果。

•Tim's mistake decided the game (= caused him to lose).蒂姆的失误导致了那场比赛的落败。

[dɪ'saɪd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   decide on sth/sb ■to choose something or someone after careful thought 决定；选定
•I've decided on blue for the bathroom.我已经决定浴室用蓝色。

[dɪ'saɪd] verb   Common Learner Errors   decideWarning: Check your spelling!Decide is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.




decide, resolve, determine, settle

这组词都有“决定”的意思，其区别是：
decide: 侧重指经过思考、比较、讨论或询问之后做出的决定。
resolve: 语气较强，强调以坚定不移的信念去做或不做某事，暗含有远大抱负和坚强决心。
determine: 指经过深思熟虑，决心去做某事并坚持施行。
settle: 指排除犹豫、怀疑和争论之后作出明确的最终结论。


vt. 决定；解决；判决
 - settle, condition, conclude
vi. 决定，下决心
 - will, determine to
examples: 英 [dɪ'saɪd] 美 [dɪ'saɪd]
v.决定；判断；断定

(1) That decided me to leave my job.(2) A chance meeting decided my career.(3) He decided to get married.(4) Don't decide on important matters too quickly.(5) It's difficult to decide between the two.(6) For each pair of sentences, decide where to use the active or passive form of the verb.
(1) 那件事使我决定离职。(2) 偶然的会面决定了我的事业。(3) 他决定结婚。(4) 不要过于匆忙地对重要的事情作决定。(5) 对这两者，不易做出抉择。(6) 在以下每组句子里,判断是该用单词的主动语态还是被动语态。
[sound:youdao-7b943dc8-c21ea3e4-dc85c2f1-798f3692-abf33b46.mp3]

translation:
n. 决定; 果断; 决议; （法院的）判决
vt. [口语][拳击]靠判定击败（对手）

分布：决定(92%)，判决(4%)，决心(4%)


→来自decide,决定。
决心,决议(decide的名词)[cid,cis=cut,kill,表示"切开,杀"]
n.决定,决心;决议;决策Have they reached a decision yet?他们是否已有所决定?



noun CHOICE  选择   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities 决定；决策；选择
•She has had to make some very difficult decisions.她必须作出一些非常艰难的决定。

•The company will reach/come to/make a decision shortly.公司很快便会作出决定。

•Let me have a/your decision (= Tell me what you have decided) by next week.下周前告诉我你的决定。

•[+ to infinitive] It was his decision to leave.是他决定要离开的。

•The decision about/on whether he is innocent or guilty rests with the jury.要由陪审团来裁决他是否有罪。

•We need to take a lot of factors into account in our decision -making.我们决策时要考虑很多因素。

•[+ that] I accepted his decision that he wished to die with dignity.他希望死得有尊严，我同意他的选择。

[dɪ'sɪʒ.ən] noun DECIDING QUICKLY  果断  uncountable approving ■the ability to decide quickly and without pausing because you are not certain 果断，干脆；决断（力）
•She acted with decision, closing the bank account and phoning the police.她采取果断的行动，冻结了银行帐户，并打电话报警。
 Opposite indecision




resolve, determination, resolution, decision

这组词都有“决定、决心”的意思，其区别是：
resolve: 语气较强，强调克服感情上的软弱，下决心干具体的一件事。
determination: 侧重坚定不移的顽强意志力。
resolution: 指自觉地正式表示的决心，含极强的主观能动意味。
decision: 既可指重大的或一般的决定或决心，又可指在多种情况下作出果断的抉择，毫不犹豫地采取行动。


n. 决定，决心；决议
 - determination, resolution, push, backbone
examples: 英 [dɪ'sɪʒn] 美 [dɪ'sɪʒn]
n.决定；决心；判决
(1) I don't think his decision is wise in reality.(2) We can' t reach a decision without our chairman.(3) All is dependent on your decision.(4) The judge will give his decision tomorrow.
(1) 实际上,我觉得他的决定并不明智。(2) 主席不在场(3) 一切看你的决心而定。(4) 法官将于明天做出判决。
[sound:youdao-b5e379d2-238308ba-6d796058-f1f7bc06-3ffff7d0.mp3]

translation:
n. 甲板，舱板; [建]平屋顶，桥面; [铁路]客车车顶; 〈俚〉地面
vt. 装饰; 给…铺上甲板; 打扮

时态：decked, decking, decks
分布：甲板(88%)，装饰(5%)，层面(4%)，一副牌(3%)


→来自steg, 覆盖，词源同thatch, detective. 引申义甲板。
n.甲板At the neck of the wrecked deck, the reckoner checked the opaque cheque.在遭破坏的甲板的颈部,计算者检查了这张不透明支票.



noun countable FLOOR  层   ADVANCED  ■a flat area for walking on, especially one built across the space between the sides of a boat or a bus; a type of floor 甲板，舱面；（公车的）地板；（船或公车的）一层，层面
•We sat on deck until it was dark.我们在甲板上一直坐到天黑。

•The upper/top deck of the bus was always full of people smoking.公车上层总是挤满了抽烟的人。
⇒ See also quarterdeck;sundeckUS  a raised area without a roof, which is connected to a house, similar to a balcony （房屋的）露天平台，凉台below decks ■on a level of a ship below the main deck 在主甲板下面
•Our cabin was below decks.我们的舱位在主甲板之下。

[dek] noun countable CARDS  牌  (also pack) mainly US ■a set of cards used for playing card games 一副牌
•a new deck of cards一副新牌

[dek] verb transitive DECORATE  装饰  ■to decorate or add something to something to make an effect 装饰；装扮；打扮
•The room was decked with flowers.房间里有花朵装饰。

•The wedding guests were decked out in their finery (= wearing their best clothes).参加婚礼的宾客都穿着自己最好的礼服。
⇒ See also bedeck
[dek] verb transitive HIT  打击  slang■to hit someone, especially to hit someone and knock them down 打击；（尤指）击倒，把…打趴下
•Do that again and I'll deck you.你再这样做，我非把你打趴下来不可。




n. [船] 甲板；行李仓；露天平台
 - board, storage room
vt. 装饰； [船] 装甲板；打扮
 - paint, hang, dress oneself, array
examples: 英 [dek] 美 [dek]
n.甲板；层面；一副牌vt.装饰；用力击倒

(1) The colonel ordered their soldiers to gather on the deck.(2) The deck of the sailing ship was made of thick planks.(3) The sailor suddenly saw a pirate jumping onto the deck.(4) Passengers may smoke only on the upper deck of the bus.(5) Please chose a card at random from the deck.(6) She did not want to deck herself with knowledge.
(1) 上校命令士兵们在甲板上集合。(2) 这艘帆船的甲板是用厚木板制作的。(3) 那水手忽然看到一名海盗跳上了甲板。(4) 乘客只可以在公共汽车的上层吸烟。(5) 从一副牌中任意选出一张。(6) 她并不想把知识当装饰品。
[sound:youdao-05cca9c0-c16e70b0-4e3e1dba-72929e91-a025b443.mp3]

translation:
vt. 宣布; 声明，声称; 申报; [法]供述
vi. 声明，发表宣言; 宣称

时态：declared, declaring, declares
分布：声明(79%)，申报(21%)


→de-, 向下，强调。-clar, 清晰，明确，词源同clear, clarify.引申义公告。
v.宣布,宣告,声明;断言,宣称I daren't declare that the shares are my spare fare and welfare on the farewell party.在告别会上,我不敢宣称这些股票是我的备用车费和福利.
【记】de加强语义，clare＝clear使…清晰明了－宣布【参】declaration（n 宣布；声明）



US [-'kler] verb EXPRESS  表达   IMPROVER  transitive ■to announce something clearly, firmly, publicly or officially 宣布；声明；公布
•They declared their support for the proposal他们宣布支持这个提议。

•[+ (that)] She declared (that) it was the best chocolate cake she had ever tasted.她说那是她吃过的最好的巧克力蛋糕。

•[+ obj + (to be) + noun/adj] They declared themselves (to be) bankrupt.他们宣布破产了。

•[+ speech] "I won't do it!" he declared.“我不做！”他坚定地说。

•America declared war on Japan in 1941 (= announced officially that it was at war).美国在1941对日本宣战。
