(1) Coarse crumb rubber is apt to deposit in asphalt.(2) The Nile floods the fields and deposits mud on them.(3) He deposits a sum of money in the bank each month.(4) I had to deposit 10% of the price of the house.(5) He deposited the case in the left luggage office.(6) Ten yuan is the minimum initial deposit.(7) You must pay a deposit if you want to reserve the room.(8) There is some deposit in the bottom of the cup.(9) We have found a promising iron deposit.
(1) 粗的橡胶颗粒容易在沥青中沉淀。(2) 尼罗河泛滥，在田野上淤积一层泥。(3) 他每月在银行存一笔钱。(4) 我必须先付房价的10%25作定钱。(5) 他把箱子放在行李寄存处。(6) 最低的开户存款金额是十元。(7) 你要预订房间,就得先付定金。(8) 这只烧杯的底部有些沉淀物。(9) 我们已经发现了一个有开采价值的铁矿床。
[sound:youdao-5524a041-86ca2bcd-1d3fc852-81512206-eb1b1c04.mp3]

translation:
vt. 压下，压低; 使沮丧; 使萧条; 使跌价

时态：depressed, depressing, depresses
分布：降低(57%)，压抑(13%)，使萧条(11%)，压下(10%)，使沮丧(9%)


→de-, 向下。press, 压，压制。即压制，引申词义抑郁，沮丧。
压制,压抑(de+press压→向下压→压制)[de-①表示"去掉,变坏,离开,变慢,向下"等②表示"使…成为,加强"等]
压下;使沮丧(de向下+press→向下压→使情绪低下)[press=press表示"挤压"]
v.压抑,降低;使沮丧,压下The man depressed by the pressure from the press expressed the impression on him.那个受到来自新闻界压力压抑的人表达了他的印象.
【记】de向下，press压－向下压－使沮丧【反】bulge（vt 使膨胀）



verb transitive CAUSE SADNESS  引起忧郁  ■to cause someone to feel unhappy and without hope for the future 使忧郁，使沮丧
•This weather depresses me.这种天气让我感到心情忧郁。

•[+ -ing verb] Doesn't it  depress you  listening to the news these days?最近的新闻不令你感到沮丧吗？

•[+ to infinitive] It  depresses me  to think that I'll probably still be doing exactly the same job in ten years' time.想到十年后很可能还在做同样的工作，我就感到非常沮丧。

[dɪ'pres] verb transitive REDUCE  降低  ■to reduce the value of something, especially money 使贬值，使降价
•A surplus of corn has helped depress the grain market /grain prices.玉米过剩促使粮食价格下降。

•The rise in the value of the dollar has depressed the company's earnings/profits this year.今年美元升值导致该公司营业额／利润降低。
■to reduce the amount of activity in something, especially a business operation 使萧条，使不景气
•High interest rates are continuing to depress the economy.高利率使经济持续萧条。
■to lower the level or amount of something 使降低，使减少
•This drug helps depress high hormone levels.这种药物有助于降低荷尔蒙水准。

[dɪ'pres] verb transitive PRESS DOWN  压下  slightly formal ■to press down or lower 按下，压下
•Slowly depress the accelerator/brake pedal.慢慢踩下油门／刹车踏板。




vt. 压低；使沮丧；使萧条
 - drive down, weigh down
examples: 英 [dɪ'pres] 美 [dɪ'pres]
vt.使沮丧；压下；使萧条；降低；压抑

(1) He was depressed by his defeat.(2) The thought of having to take the exam again depressed me.(3) The rainy days always depress me.(4) Depress this button to rewind the tape.(5) The threat of war has depressed business activity.(6) Runaway inflation will depress the economy.(7) High interest rates may depress share prices.(8) Does mass unemployment depress the wages?(9) It's bad to depress your sorrow.
(1) 失败让他沮丧。(2) 想到还需重新考试，我就感到沮丧。(3) 雨天总是使我沮丧。(4) 按下这个按钮倒带。(5) 战争的威胁使经济萧条。(6) 无法控制的通货膨胀将会使经济萧条。(7) 高利率可以降低股票价格。(8) 大量失业是否降低了工资?(9) 压抑内心的悲痛不好。
[sound:youdao-8ab1bfc1-b44f8fd1-5f98811d-28303f04-c3fbdc89.mp3]

translation:
n. 深度; 深处，深海; 深奥，奥妙; 进深

分布：深(60%)，深度(35%)，深奥(2%)，深刻(2%)，厚度(1%)


→来自deep的名词形式。
深度(dep=deep深的)[-th表名词,通常指抽象名词]
n.深,深度,深奥,深刻Snow accumulated to a depth of 12 feet.雪已积到十二英尺深.



noun DISTANCE DOWN  向下的距离   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■the distance down either from the top of something to the bottom, or to a distance below the top surface of something 深度；高度
•the depth of a lake/pond湖泊／池塘的深度

•There are very few fish at depths (= distances below the surface) below 3000 metres.水下3000米处很少有鱼。

•The river froze to a depth of over a metre.河面冰层厚度超过一米。
the depths [plural] literary ■the lowest part of the sea 海底；深渊
•The ship sank slowly to the depths of the ocean.那艘船慢慢沉入大洋深处。

[depθ] noun SERIOUSNESS  严肃   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■when you have serious qualities or the ability to think seriously about something （思维的）深度，深刻；洞察力
•Terry lacks depth - he's a very superficial person.特里的思想缺乏深度——他是个很肤浅的人。

•Her writing shows astonishing depth.她的作品思想深刻，令人惊讶。

•Jo has hidden depths (= serious qualities that you do not see immediately).祖是个深藏不露的人。
in depth ■in a serious and detailed way 深入细致地
•I'd like to look at this question in some depth.我要深入细致地研究一下这个问题。

[depθ] noun DISTANCE BACKWARDS  深度  countable or uncountable ■the distance from the front to the back of something 深度；厚度；宽度
•Measure the depth of the cupboard/shelf.量一量橱柜／书架的深度。

[depθ] noun STRENGTH  力度  countable or uncountable ■when a feeling, state or characteristic is strong, extreme or detailed （情感、状态、特性等的）深度，力度，强度
•He spoke with great depth of feeling.他饱含深情地发表讲话。

•I was amazed at the depth of her knowledge.她的学识渊博，令我十分惊讶。
in the depth(s) of sth ■experiencing an extreme and negative emotion 处于极为…的消极情绪之中
•He was in the depths of despair/depression about losing his job.他丢了工作，深感绝望／沮丧。
■during the worst period of a bad situation 处于最艰难的时期
•The company was started in the depth of the recession of the 1930s.该公司在20世纪30年代经济最萧条的时期创办。

[depθ] noun LOW SOUND  低音  uncountable ■the quality of having a low sound （声线）深沉，低沉
•The depth of his voice makes him sound older than he is.他声线低沉，听起来要比他实际年龄大一些。

[depθ] noun DARKNESS  暗  uncountable ■when something, especially a colour, has the quality of being dark and strong （尤指颜色的）浓厚
•I love the depth of colour in her early paintings.我喜欢她早期油画作品的浓厚色彩。

[depθ] noun in the depth(s) of somewhere ■in the middle of somewhere, and a long distance from its edges 在…的深处
•a house in the depths of the forest森林深处的房屋

[depθ] noun in the depth(s) of winter ■in the middle of winter 隆冬
[depθ] noun out of your depth ■not having the knowledge, experience, or skills to deal with a particular subject or situation 无法驾驭，不能胜任
•I was out of my depth in the advanced class, so I moved to the intermediate class.由于高级班太难，我转到了中级班。
■in water that is so deep that it goes over your head when you are standing 淹没头顶，没过头顶
•I'm not a strong swimmer so I prefer not to go out of my depth.我不谙水性，所以不会到水深超过我身高的区域。




n. [海洋] 深度；深奥
 - profoundity, deepness
examples: 英 [depθ] 美 [depθ]
n.深度；深刻；深奥；深；厚度

(1) The young man dived to a depth of 40 feet.(2) Her latest poem has remarkable depth.(3) The child is being taught subjects that are beyond his depth.(4) Nobody knew the depth of her love for the child.(5) A tread depth of less than 1/16 inch is unsafe.
(1) 那个青年人潜到四十尺的深度。(2) 她最近的那首诗极有深度。(3) 现在教给孩子的学科都过于深奥。(4) 谁也不知道她对这孩子的爱有多深。(5) 台胎纹厚度低于1/16英寸则不安全。
[sound:youdao-b76f13b3-887b09be-bbecdfe7-ea585b5f-79a07356.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 得到，导出; 源于，来自; （从…中）提取

时态：derived, deriving, derives
分布：起源(54%)，获取(33%)，得自(13%)


→de-, 从，向下，离开。-riv, 流动，词源同run, rivulet. 原指从源头处流下，引申义衍生于。
派生,得出[riv=stream(河流)]
v.取得;导出;引申;来自;源自;出自From the fact, the shivering driver derives that the diver may thrive on river.发抖的司机从这个事实得出结论说跳水员可以靠河流繁荣.



verb derive sth from sth  ADVANCED  ■to get something from something else 从…中得到，从…中获得
•The institute derives all its money from foreign investments.该机构的资金均来自海外投资。

•She derives great pleasure/satisfaction from playing the violin.拉小提琴能给她得到极大乐趣／满足。

[dɪ'raɪv] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [often passive] derive from sth ■to come from something 来自于，源自
•The English word 'olive' is derived from the Latin word 'oliva'.英语的 olive 一词源自拉丁语中的 oliva。




vi. 起源
 - to originate
examples: [联想] 地里（de）涌出一条河（river），这是河的起源（derive）。derive a conclusion from facts从事实得出结论
英 [dɪ'raɪv] 美 [dɪ'raɪv]
v.获取；得自；起源

(1) We shall derive much benefit from reading good novels.(2) We derive our sustenance from the land.(3) One kind of vacation is camping, from which many Americans derive pleasure and benefit.(4) If we start some a year earlier, we shall derive the benefits a year earlier.(5) The two attitudes derive from different historical perspectives.
(1) 我们将从优秀小说中获得很大好处。(2) 我们从土地获取食物。(3) 露营是一种度假方式，许多美国人从中得到乐趣，受益匪浅。(4) 我们如果早开始一年,我们可以早得利一年(5) 这两种态度产生于不同的历史观点。
[sound:youdao-a48d37d8-205ab33b-4504e51f-ad302678-1c510bb6.mp3]

translation:
v. 下来，下降 ; 下斜; 降临; 突然造访

时态：descended, descending, descends
分布：下降(61%)，降临(15%)，遗传(9%)，突然袭击(7%)，传下来(5%)，突然拜访(3%)


→de-, 向下。-scend, 爬，上升，词源同ascend, scan.即爬下，下降。
下降;传下(de向下+scend→向下爬)[scend,scens,scent=climb,表示"爬,攀"]
v.下来,下降;遗传(指财产,气质,权利)He descended from a royal family.他出身贵族.
【记】de下，scend爬－向下爬－下降；参：ascend（v 上升）



verb POSITION  位置   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive formal ■to go or come down 下降；走下；降下
•The path descended steeply into the valley.这条路很陡，一直通到山谷。

•Jane descended the stairs.简走下了楼梯。
intransitive literary ■If darkness or night descends, it becomes dark and day changes to night. （暮色）降临；（天幕）落下
[dɪ'send] verb NEGATIVE MOOD  负面情绪  intransitive literary ■If a negative or bad feeling descends, it is felt everywhere in a place or by everyone at the same time （坏心情）遍布
•A feeling of despair descended (on us) as we realized that we were lost.当我们发现自己迷了路的时候，一种绝望的情绪（在我们之间）弥漫开来。
intransitive literary ■If a condition, usually a negative condition, descends, it quickly develops in every part of a place 笼罩
•Silence descended on the room/ over the countryside.寂静笼罩着房间／田野。

[dɪ'send] verb   Phrasal Verbs   descend from sth ■to have developed from something that existed in the past 从…发展演变而来
•All living creatures are thought to descend from an organism that came into being three billion years ago.据说所有生物都是从30亿年前出现的一种有机体演变而来的。
be descended from sb ■to be related to a particular person or group of people who lived in the past 从…繁衍而来；是…的后代
•Her father is descended from Greek royalty.她的父亲是希腊皇室的后代。

•Humans are descended from (= developed from) ape-like creatures.人类是从类人猿进化而来的。

[dɪ'send] verb   Phrasal Verbs   descend into sth formal ■If a situation descends into a particular state, it becomes worse 陷入
•The demonstrations in the capital rapidly descended into anarchy.首都的游行示威活动迅速陷入一种无政府状态。

[dɪ'send] verb   Phrasal Verbs   descend on/upon sb/sth ■If a group of people descend on a place or person, they arrive, usually without warning or without being invited 突然造访，突然到达
•Sorry to descend on you like this, but we had no time to phone.如此唐突造访非常抱歉，我们实在没来得及事先给你打电话。

•The police descended on the house in the early hours of the morning.凌晨员警突然闯进那所房子。

[dɪ'send] verb   Phrasal Verbs   descend to sth ■to behave badly in a way that other people would not expect you to 堕落成为，堕落到
•I never thought she would descend to stealing.我从来没想到她会堕落到行窃的地步。





drop, fall, sink, descend

这组词都有“落下，下降”的意思，其区别是：
drop: 指物体从一定高度落下。
fall: 与drop同义，指突然或猛烈地降落，但fall也可指任何下落，同高度或形式无关。
sink: 指在空气或水中垂直下降、下沉。
descend: 通常指沿斜线或斜坡下降。


vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊
 - decline, go down
examples: 英 [dɪ'send] 美 [dɪ'send]
v.下降；降临v.传下来；遗传v.突然袭击；突然拜访

(1) The sun descended behind the hills.(2) I wish that the prices can descend.(3) I didn't expect him to descend to personal abuse.(4) At 6:30 p.m. the tropical darkness descends.(5) The custom has descended to our day.(6) Armed thieves descended on the helpless travelers.(7) My sister's family is descending on us this weekend.
(1) 太阳下山了。(2) 但愿物价会下降。(3) 我没料到他会堕落到对我进行人身攻击的地步。(4) 在傍晚六点半的时候,热带地区的黑夜降临。(5) 这一习俗一直传到今天。(6) 一群武装盗贼袭击了无依无靠的旅客。(7) 想不到我姐姐一家本周末要到我们这里来

translation:
vt. 描写，形容; 叙述; 描绘，作图; （行星等）周转

时态：described, describing, describes
分布：描述(85%)，形容(14%)，说成(1%)


→de-, 向下。-scribe, 写，词源同scribe, conscript.
描写,叙述(de着重+scribe→着重写→描写)[scrib,script=write,表示"写"]
v.描述,形容The briber described the tribe head's bribery.行贿者描述了部落首领的受贿行为.



verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to say or write what someone or something is like 描述，描写，描绘
•Could you describe your attacker?你能描述一下袭击者的样子吗？

•He described the painting in detail.他详细地描述了那幅油画的内容。

•[+ question word] Let me describe (to you) how it happened.让我来（给你）讲讲事情的经过吧。

•She described Gary as shy.她说加利很害羞。
■formal ■If you describe a shape, you draw it or move in a direction that follows the line of it 画；画出…图形
•He used compasses to describe a circle.他用圆规画圆。





picture, sketch, describe, represent

这组词都有“描写、描述”的意思，其区别是：
picture: 着重能够栩栩如生地把事物或场景等描绘出来。
sketch: 指快速地勾勒或概略地叙述。
describe: 侧重指描述细节，给读者或听众提供清晰的视觉图像。
represent: 指有代表性或象征性地描述或讲述。


vt. 描述，形容；描绘
 - represent, trace, figure, depict
examples: 英 [dɪ'skraɪb] 美 [dɪ'skraɪb]
vt.描述；说成；形容；画(尤指几何图形)

(1) The police asked me to describe exactly how it happened.(2) Words cannot describe the beauty of the scene.(3) He describes himself as a doctor.(4) No one could describe the scorn of her expression.(5) It is very difficult to describe my joy in words.(6) The falling star described a long curve in the sky.
(1) 警察让我描述一下这事是怎样发生的。(2) 语言难以描述那景色之美丽。(3) 他自称是医生。(4) 谁也无法形容她那股鄙夷万分的表情。(5) 我的快乐难以用语言来形容。(6) 流星在空中画出了一道长长的弧线。
[sound:youdao-06289be2-f1ab6005-c2b9e8a5-2c2af759-d9b03496.mp3]

translation:
n. 描述; 形容; 种类; 类型

分布：描述(90%)，说明书(5%)，类型(4%)，刻画(1%)


描绘,形容(de+script+ion)[scrib,script=write,表示"写"]
n.描写,形容;种类The pious man is dubious about the vicious civilian's vivid description of his vicinity to his wife.虔诚的男子对邪恶的平民生动的描述他与其妻子的密切(关系)半信半疑.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■something that tells you what something or someone is like 描述，描写，描绘
•Write a description of your favourite seaside resort.描述一下你最喜欢的海滨胜地。

•She has given the police a very detailed/full description of the robber.她向员警详细描述了抢劫者的相貌。

•A girl answering (= matching) the description of the missing teenager was spotted in Hull.有人在赫尔发现一个女孩，相貌特征符合失踪少女的描述。

•Your essay contains too much description, and not enough discussion of the issues.你的文章描述性内容太多，而对问题的讨论不足。
of every description ■of all types 各种各样的
•Boats of every description were entering the harbour.各种船只正在驶入港湾。
be beyond description (also defy description) ■to be something that you cannot describe accurately because of its great size, quality or level 无法形容，难以描述
•Her beauty is beyond description.她的美无与伦比。

•The mess in Bart's room defies description (= is very bad) !巴特的房间乱得难以形容！





exposition, definition, description, explanation, interpretation

这组词都有“解释”的意思，其区别是：
exposition: 通常指对论点、假设、理论等的重点作详尽的阐述。
definition: 主要指对某一词、短语或专门术语的含义作解释、下定义。
description: 指对某一事物的重要方面进行详细叙述，常含教育与启迪意味。
explanation: 普通用词，指使人明白未知或不清楚的事。
interpretation: 多指对文字上较难的段落，或难于理解，令人迷惑的问题作出解释或说明。


n. 描述，描写；类型；说明书
 - presentation, type, style, characterization
examples: 英 [dɪ'skrɪpʃn] 美 [dɪ'skrɪpʃn]
n.描述；刻画；类型；说明书

(1) He gave a description of what he had seen.(2) He is very good at the description about the characters of different figures in his book.(3) There are boats of every description on the lake.(4) A description about a product should not mislead the customers.
(1) 他描述了他所见到的一切。(2) 他非常擅长在书中刻画不同人物的性格。(3) 湖上漂着各种类型的船。(4) 产品的说明书不能误导顾客。
[sound:youdao-4f01e4d4-3c901609-e369afa1-bd5848cd-5421069b.mp3]

translation:
n. 沙漠; 荒地; 应得的赏罚; 功劳，美德
adj. 沙漠的; 荒芜的，不毛的; 无人的

时态：deserted, deserting, deserts
分布：沙漠(92%)，遗弃(4%)，放弃(1%)，荒地(1%)，离弃(1%)，擅离职守(1%)


→de-, 不，非，使相反。-sert, 连接，词源同series, insert. 即断开连接，逃离，遗弃，引申词义被遗弃的地方，沙漠。
离开;抛弃(de分开+sert→不再加入→离开)[sert=join,insert表示"加入,插入"]
n.沙漠,不毛之地v.抛弃,遗弃;擅离,开小差The desert deserves the nervous servants to observe.那个沙漠值得神经紧张的公务员们去观察.
【记】de反，sert加入－反加入－离开【参】deserted（adj 荒芜的；为人所弃的）；deserter（n 背弃者；逃亡者；脱党者）；desertification（n 土壤荒漠化）；desertion（n 丢掉；遗弃；逃亡）



US [-ə˞t] IMPROVER  ■an area, often covered with sand or rocks, where there is very little rain and not many plants 沙漠，荒漠
•They were lost in the desert for nine days.他们在沙漠里迷路已经有9天了。

•We had to cross a large area of arid, featureless desert.我们必须穿越一大片干燥荒芜的沙漠。

•the desert sun沙漠里的太阳
cultural/intellectual, etc. desert disapproving ■a place that is considered to have no cultural, intellectual, etc. quality or interest 文化沙漠等
•This town is a cultural/intellectual desert.这个城镇是一片文化沙漠。

verb UK [dɪˈzɜːt] US [-ˈzɜ˞ːt]RUN AWAY  跑掉  intransitive or transitive ■to leave the armed forces without permission and with no intention of returning 开小差，当逃兵；擅离（部队）
•Soldiers who deserted and were caught were shot.抓回来的逃兵被枪毙了。

•How many people desert from the army each year?军队中每年有多少逃兵？

verb UK [dɪˈzɜːt] US [-ˈzɜ˞ːt]LEAVE BEHIND  丢下  transitive ■to leave someone without help or in a difficult situation and not come back 抛弃，丢弃
•He deserted his wife and family for another woman.他为了另一个女人，抛弃妻子和家庭。
transitive ■If a quality deserts you, you suddenly and temporarily lose it 失去，丧失
•All my confidence/courage deserted me when I walked into the exam room.进入试场后，我完全丧失信心／勇气。





desert, leave, give up, forsake, abandon

这组词都有“抛弃、放弃”的意思，其区别是：
desert: 着重指违背法律责任和义务，或自己的信仰与誓言的行为，多含非难的意味。
leave: 普通用词，指舍弃某事或某一职业，或终止同一某人的关系，但不涉及动机与果。
give up: 普通用语，侧重指没有希望或因外界压力而放弃。
forsake: 侧重断绝感情上的依恋，自愿抛弃所喜欢的人或物。也指抛弃信仰或改掉恶习。
abandon: 强调永远或完全放弃或抛弃人或事物等，这可能是被迫的，也可能是自愿的。



desert, dessert

desert: 沙漠。如：Have you ever been to a desert?
dessert: 甜食。如：What would you like for dessert, an apple pie or ice-cream?


vt. 遗弃；放弃；逃跑
 - yield, quit
vi. 遗弃；开小差；逃掉
 - run out on, walk out on
n. [地理] 沙漠； [农] 荒原；应得的赏罚
 - sands, wold
adj. [地理] 沙漠的；荒凉的；不毛的
 - wild, hungry
examples: 英 ['dezət] 美 ['dezərt]
n.沙漠；荒地；应得(的惩罚或奖励)v.遗弃；离弃；放弃；擅离职守

(1) Two thirds of the country is dry or desert.(2) Some of them died of thirst in the desert.(3) Water can transform a desert into a garden.(4) The baby's mother deserted him soon after giving birth.(5) The price rise caused many readers to desert the magazine.(6) A soldier who deserts in time of war is punished severely.
(1) 这个国家有三分之二的地方气候干燥,或者是沙漠。(2) 他们中有些人在沙漠中渴死了。(3) 水能把一片不毛之地变成一座花园。(4) 那个母亲生下他后不久就把他遗弃了。(5) 价格上涨让使这本杂志丧失了很多读者。(6) 战争期间开小差的士兵要受到严惩。
[sound:youdao-a7291590-504ec68c-5cb4854c-29bebf75-283eee5f.mp3]

translation:
vt. 应受; 应得; 值得
vi. 应受报答; 应得报酬; 应得赔偿; 应受惩罚

时态：deserved, deserving, deserves
分布：值得(84%)，应受(16%)


→de-, 向下，强调。serve, 服务。原指服务所应得的报酬，后词义通用化。
应受,值得(de加强+serve→加强服务→值得[重视])[serv=serve,keep表示"服务,保持"]
v.应受,值得The desert deserves the nervous servants to observe.那个沙漠值得神经紧张的公务员们去观察.



US [-'zɝ:v] verb transitive not continuous  ESSENTIAL  ■to have earned or to be given something because of the way you have behaved or the qualities you have 值得；应得
•After all that hard work, you deserve a holiday.辛劳过后，你该放假了。

•Chris deserves our special thanks for all his efforts.我们应该特别感谢克里斯所付出的心血。

•I hope they get the punishment they deserve.我希望他们受到应有的惩罚。

•[+ to infinitive] They certainly deserved to win that match.他们理应赢得那场比赛。

UK [dɪ'zɜ:v] US [-'zɝ:v] verb transitive not continuous  She/He deserves a medal humorous ■said when you admire someone for dealing with a difficult person or situation for a long time 她／他值得钦佩，值得赞叹
•She deserves a medal for putting up with that husband of hers.她能够忍受那样的丈夫真不容易。

UK [dɪ'zɜ:v] US [-'zɝ:v] verb transitive not continuous  He/She deserves whatever / everything he/she gets. ■said if you think someone should have to suffer because of their bad behaviour 无论怎样惩罚他／她都是活该，罪有应得
•After all the harm she's done, she deserves whatever she gets.她做了那么多坏事，无论受到甚么惩罚都是罪有应得。




vi. 应受，应得
 - be deserving of
vt. 应受，应得
 - be deserving of
examples: 英 [dɪ'zɜːv] 美 [dɪ'zɜːrv]
vt.应受；值得
(1) He has done nothing to deserve death.(2) You deserve a reward for being so helpful.(3) These proposals deserve careful study.
(1) 他没做过该受死刑的事。(2) 你帮了这么大的忙，理应受到奖励。(3) 这些建议值得认真研究。
[sound:youdao-5a513ec1-58a1b960-d3ab86ac-60269740-8f120a5e.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 设计; 绘制
vt. 设计; 计划; 企图; 决意（做）
n. 设计; 图案; 结构; 计划
vi. 设计略图; （为工艺品、装潢项目等）设计; 当设计师; 构思

时态：designed, designing, designs
分布：设计(92%)，计划(4%)，图案(2%)，目的(1%)，图样(1%)


→de-, 向下。sign, 写，标记。即写下来，描绘，设计。
设计;计划(de+sign做标志→设计)[de-①表示"去掉,变坏,离开,变慢,向下"等②表示"使…成为,加强"等]
计划;设计(de着重+sign→着重做记号→设计)[sign=mark表示"记号,信号"]
v.设计;构思;绘制;图案;企图n.设计,图样The resigned designer is designated to an assignment of reigning the foreigners.辞职的设计者被指派了一个去统治外国人的任务.



verb PLAN  计划   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to make or draw plans for something, for example clothes or buildings 设计；制（图）
•Who designed this building/dress/furniture?是谁设计这座建筑物／这款裙子／这套家俱？

•This range of clothing is specially designed for shorter women.这系列服装是专为身材较矮的女性设计的。

[dɪ'zaɪn] verb INTEND  意图   IMPROVER  transitive usually passive ■to intend 意图，打算
•This dictionary is designed for advanced learners of English.本词典是为高级英语学习者编写的。

•[+ to infinitive] These measures are designed to reduce pollution.采取这些措施旨在减低污染。

[dɪ'zaɪn] noun PLAN  计划   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a drawing or set of drawings showing how a building or product is to be made and how it will work and look 设计图，图纸
•Have you seen the designs for the new shopping centre?你看过新购物中心的设计图了吗？
 IMPROVER  uncountable (also designing) ■the art of making plans or drawings for something 设计（艺术）
•She's an expert on kitchen/software design.她是厨房／软体设计专家。

•He's studying design at college.他正在大学学习设计。
 IMPROVER  [S or U] ■the way in which something is planned and made 设计（方法）；设计风格
•I don't like the design of this kettle.我不喜欢这个茶壶的设计。

•The building was originally Victorian in design.这座建筑物原是维多利亚式设计风格。

•a serious design fault严重的设计缺陷

•The car has some excellent design features.这款汽车有一些很棒的设计特色。

[dɪ'zaɪn] noun PATTERN  图案  countable ■a pattern used to decorate something 图案
•a floral/abstract design花卉／抽象图案

•I like the design on your sweatshirt.我喜欢你运动服上的那个图案。

[dɪ'zaɪn] noun INTENTION  故意  by design ■intentionally 特意；故意，有意
•I'm sure he ignored you by accident and not by design.我敢肯定他绝非有意冷落你。
designs [plural] ■plans, often ones which are not honest, to get something or someone for yourself 阴谋计划，不轨企图
•to have territorial designs (on neighbouring countries)有夺取（邻国）领土的企图

•humorous I think Alan has designs on/upon your job/wife!我觉得亚伦对你的工作／妻子有不轨企图！





invent, compose, make, create, design, produce

这组词都有“创造”的意思，其区别是：
invent: 主要用于科技领域，指通过思考、研究或实验制造出新的前所未有、极为有用的东西。
compose: 多指音乐或诗歌、画的创作。
make: 最普通用词，指任何东西的创作或制造。
create: 侧重创造出来的东西以前并不存在，或者指独具特色的创作。
design: 主要指在艺术或技术领域的创作设计，强调构思多于实际制造。
produce: 指产品的生产，或作品创作的完成。



figure, pattern, design

这组词都有“装饰图案”的意思，其区别是：
figure: 指呈现于整个表面的简单的几何图形或小型图案。
pattern: 一般指简单的重复图案，或整个装饰的格调或事物的布局，也指由一些相连图形拼成的较大图案。
design: 专指线条、轮廓、图案。强调设计的完美或有秩序。



intention, intent, design

这组词都有“意图，企图”的意思，其区别是：
intention: 普通用词，指某人内心产生的想做某事的想法，侧重内心活动。
intent: 法律用词，常指某人怀有歹意而犯罪。
design: 多用复数形式，含贬义多指行为不轨的意图。



programme, project, scheme, plan, blueprint, design, plot

这组词都有“计划”的意思，其区别是：
programme: 使用广泛，既可指思想上的计划，又可指任何形式的书面计划或规划。
project: 多指由个人或集体为进行某项工作或完成某一项较大的任务，而制定的计划方案或设想。
scheme: 普通用词，比plan更强调计划的通盘筹划和某些细节的精心安排。在现代英语中，常用于指阴谋诡计。
plan: 最普通常用词，多指事先经过较充分的准备或考虑后制定的计划，也可指非决定性的打算或设想。
blueprint: 从本义蓝图，引申指详细而具体的行动计划。
design: 侧重指按照目标、目的意向，根据固定格式精心作出的计划或安排。
plot: 主要指为实现某一阴谋而拟定秘密的计划。


vt. 设计；计划；构思
 - project, engineer, style, schedule, frame
n. 设计；图案
 - programming, device, pattern
vi. 设计
 - project, engineer
examples: 英 [dɪ'zaɪn] 美 [dɪ'zaɪn]
n.设计；图样；图案；目的v.设计；计划

(1) This dress is of the latest design.(2) He chalked out a design on the blackboard.(3) The bedcover was quilted in a flower design.(4) His evil designs were frustrated.(5) He designed us a beautiful house.(6) How do you design your college campus life?
(1) 这件衣服是最新设计。(2) 他用粉笔在黑板上勾划出一个图样。(3) 床罩被缝成花卉图案。(4) 他的罪恶企图未能得逞。(5) 他为我们设计了一所很美的房子。(6) 如何规划大学四年的学习生活?

translation:
adj. 令人满意的; 值得拥有的; 可取的; 性感的
n. 称心如意的人[东西]

分布：令人满意的(40%)，令人向往的(23%)，性感的(12%)，值得的(10%)，有吸引力的(10%)，有吸引力的人或物(5%)


值得要的(desire渴望)[-able表形容词"可…的,能..."]
a.值得做的;合意的,称心的;期望得到的It is most desirable that he should attend the meeting.他能参加此次会议,是最好不过的了.



US [-'zaɪr.ə-] adjective WANTED  渴望的   ADVANCED  ■worth having and wanted by most people 值得拥有的；渴望获得的，令人向往的
•Reducing class sizes in schools is a desirable aim.大家希望减少学校的班别人数。

•It's regarded as a highly desirable job.那是一份很多人都很想得到的工作。

•The house is in a very desirable area of the city.那座房子坐落在城里一个很多人向往居住其中的区域。

UK [dɪ'zaɪə.rə.bl] US [-'zaɪr.ə-] adjective ATTRACTIVE  有吸引力的  ■sexually attractive 性感的
•a highly desirable man非常性感的男人





plausible, desirable, negative

plausible: 似是而非的
desirable: 合意的，令人想要的，悦人心意的
negative: 否定的，消极的


adj. 令人满意的；值得要的
 - satisfying, fulfilling
examples: 英 [dɪ'zaɪərəbl] 美 [dɪ'zaɪərəbl]
adj.令人满意的；性感的；有吸引力的；值得的；令人向往的n.有吸引力的人或物

(1) It is desirable that we (should) provide for the poor at Christmas.(2) It is desirable that atomic energy should be used for peaceful purpose.(3) You will also make some desirable acquaintances.(4) She suddenly saw herself as a desirable young woman.(5) The house has many desirable features.(6) It isn't really desirable to have him working here.(7) It is not desirable to overbalance the budget.(8) It is desirable to apply to good schools.(9) The girl is a desirable.
(1) 在圣诞节施舍穷人是可喜的事。(2) 原子能应该为了和平的目的而使用，这是合乎情理的。(3) 你也可以结识几个合意的朋友。(4) 她突然觉得自己是一个非常性感的女郎。(5) 这栋房子有许多吸引人的特点。(6) 让他在这里工作其实并不必要。(7) 超出预算是不值得的。(8) 申请好学校是令人向往的。(9) 这个女孩是个有吸引力的人。
[sound:youdao-68655c5e-0a76f823-f6a7074b-c96266eb-d5310fd9.mp3]

translation:
vt. 希望; 渴望; 要求; 请求
n. 愿望; 欲望; 希望; 请求
vi. 有希望; 期望; 愿望; 想望

时态：desired, desiring, desires
分布：渴望(39%)，愿望(28%)，欲望(24%)，要求(8%)，向往(1%)


→来自法语，来自拉丁语de sidere, 星星，星辰，词源同consider, sidereal. 来自古代的占星术，通过星辰移位来推测人世变迁，期望星辰按理想的状态运行，引申词义渴望。参照disaster.
v./n.愿望,欲望,要求The hired admirer inspired his desire for the wire.雇佣钦佩者激发了他对铁丝的渴望.



US [-'zaɪr] noun WANT  渴望   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a strong feeling that you want something 欲望，渴望，愿望
•I certainly have no desire to have children.我当然没有想要孩子的愿望。

•There is a strong desire for peace among the people.人民极盼和平。

•He needed to satisfy his desire for revenge.他需要满足自己复仇的愿望。

•[+ to infinitive] She had a burning/strong desire to go back to her home country before she died.她极其渴望在临死之前回到祖国。

•Several people have expressed a desire to see the report.有几个人表示想要看看这份报告。

UK [dɪ'zaɪər] US [-'zaɪr] noun SEXUAL NEED  性需求  uncountable formal ■the strong feeling that you want to have sex with someone 情欲，欲火
•sexual desire性欲

•Beatrice was the object of Dante's desire.贝雅特丽齐是勾动但丁情欲的女人。

UK [dɪ'zaɪər] US [-'zaɪr] verb transitive not continuous formal WANT  想要  ■to want something, especially strongly （尤指强烈地）渴望，希望，想要
•I desire only to be left in peace.我只想清清静静地不受打扰。

•The hotel had everything you could possibly desire.那间饭店有你可能想要的任何东西。

•What does her Ladyship desire me to do/desire of me?夫人她想要我做些甚么？

•[+ to infinitive] The President desires to meet the new Prime Minister.总统希望与新首相会面。

UK [dɪ'zaɪər] US [-'zaɪr] verb transitive not continuous formal SEXUAL NEED  性需求  ■to have a strong feeling that you want to have sex with someone 情欲，欲火
UK [dɪ'zaɪər] US [-'zaɪr] verb transitive not continuous formal  sb's heart's desire ■something that you want very much （某人）渴望获得之物




expect, desire, wish, long, want, hope

这组词都有“希望”的意思，其区别是：
expect: 通常指有很大程度的把握，但仍含有预料之意，或预计某事或某行动的发生。
desire: 语气较正式庄重，着重渴望的力量与热切，常含有强烈的意图和目的。
wish: 语气较弱，多指难于实现或不可能实现的愿望。
long: 语气强，指极殷切地盼望着，这种盼望侧重于很难或不可能得到的东西。有时也指一般愿望，但含一定感情色彩。
want: 一般指所想要的东西是切望得到的东西，能弥补实际需要。
hope: 指对愿望实现有一定信心的希望。


n. 欲望；要求，心愿；性欲
 - requirement, wants, do, need, wish
vt. 想要；要求；希望得到…
 - feel like, wanna, require, mean, exact
vi. 渴望
 - rare, aspire, long for, yearn for, die for
examples: 英 [dɪ'zaɪə(r)] 美 [dɪ'zaɪər]
n.渴望；愿望；欲望v.渴望；向往；要求

(1) I am filled with the desire to go back home.(2) Young people have no desire to work for the government.(3) She desires for a breakthrough in her research.(4) Everyone desires to live in a world free of worries and pains.(5) We desire you to complete the work within one month.
(1) 我心中充满了回家的渴望。(2) 年轻人没有在政府部门工作的意愿。(3) 她渴望自己的研究能够出现突破。(4) 每个人都向往生活在一个无忧无虑的世界里。(5) 我们要求你在一个月内完成这项工作。
[sound:youdao-1da0fb22-c6d30c23-e53f9512-ade6437e-6744ad46.mp3]

translation:
n. 书桌，办公桌; 服务台; 部门; （美）讲道台
adj. 书桌的，书桌上用的

分布：书桌(73%)，服务台(18%)，柜台(6%)，部门(2%)，小台架(1%)


→词源同disk, 圆盘。引申词义圆桌，书桌。
n.书桌,办公桌,服务台The man in mask asked me for a task; I let him put the basket on the desk in the dusk.戴面具的人向我要任务,我让他在黄昏时把篮子放到桌子上.



noun countable TABLE  桌子   ESSENTIAL  ■a type of table that you can work at, often one with drawers （常指带抽屉的）书桌，办公桌，写字枱
•an office/school desk办公桌／书桌

•She sat at her desk writing letters.她坐在书桌前写信。

•He had a pile of papers on his desk.他的办公桌上有一叠文件。

•The report arrived on/landed on/reached my desk (= I received it) this morning.这份报告是今天早上送到我的桌上的。

[desk] noun countable SERVICE AREA  服务区  ■a place, often with a counter (= a long flat narrow surface) especially in a hotel or airport, where you can get information or service （尤指饭店或机场的）服务台，询问处
•a check-in/information/reception desk登机柜枱／询问处／接待处

[desk] noun countable NEWSPAPER OFFICE  报馆办公室  ■an office which deals with a particular type of news for a newspaper or broadcasting company （报馆或广播公司负责某一类新闻的）办公室，部，室，组
•the foreign/sports desk国际／体育部

•Now let's hear from Sue at our travel desk.现在我们来听听旅行部的休带来的新闻。





table, desk

这组词都有“桌子”的意思，其区别是：
table: 桌子，台子。指一般没有抽屉，供劳作、游戏或吃饭等用的桌子。
desk: 书桌，办公桌，通常有抽屉。


n. [家具] 办公桌；服务台；编辑部；（美）讲道台；乐谱架
 - bureau, Information Counter
examples: 英 [desk] 美 [desk]
n.书桌；服务台；柜台；部门；小台架

(1) There are three books on the desk.(2) The speaker had a sheaf of notes on the desk in front of him.(3) He was rifling through her desk in a desperate search for the letter.(4) This kind of desk can be adjusted to the height you need.(5) You may leave your key at the reception desk.(6) The couple went to check in at the front desk.(7) Jefferies is running the sports desk.
(1) 书桌上有三本书。(2) 演讲者在他面前的桌子上放着一叠笔记。(3) 他拼命在她的书桌里搜寻那封信。(4) 这种书桌的高低可以按照你的需要调节。(5) 你可以把钥匙留在服务台。(6) 夫妻到前方柜台登记住入旅馆。(7) 杰弗里斯负责体育新闻组。
[sound:youdao-553250ec-4b44f870-4f01784c-1ecafe49-322e09af.mp3]

translation:
n. 绝望; 使人绝望的人（或事物）
vi. 绝望

时态：despaired, despairing, despairs
分布：绝望(84%)，失望(16%)


→de-, 不，非，使相反。-spair, 希望，词源同speed, prosper. 即没有希望的，绝望。
绝望(de去掉+spair[=sper希望])[Sper=hope,表示"希望"]
n.绝望;失望;令人失望的人(事物)v.绝望I deliberately liberated the man who was in despair and desperately struggled for liberation and liberty.我有意解放了那个拼命地争取解放和自由的绝望者.
【记】de去掉，spair＝sper希望【参】desperado（n 暴徒；早期美国西部的亡命之徒）；desperate（adj 不顾一切的；拚死的；令人绝望的）



US [-'sper] noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■the feeling that there is no hope and that you can do nothing to improve a difficult or worrying situation 绝望
•a mood/sense of despair绝望的情绪／感觉

•They're in (the depths of) despair over/about the money they've lost.他们对找回丢失的钱已经不抱（任何）希望了。

•To her teacher's despair, Nicole never does the work that she's told to do.妮歌从不做功课，这让她的老师感到非常失望。

•Their fourth year without rain drove many farmers to (= caused them to feel) despair.第四年仍然没有雨水，让许多农民感到非常绝望。
be the despair of sb ■to cause someone such difficulties that they do not know how to deal with you 成为（某人）的心病，使（某人）头痛
•He's the despair of his parents because he shows no interest in getting a job.他对找工作没有任何兴趣，让父母感到非常头痛。

UK [dɪ'speər] US [-'sper] verb intransitive ■to feel despair about something or someone 绝望；失去希望
•Don't despair! We'll find a way out!不要绝望！我们会想到办法的！

•I despair at/over the policies of this government.我对该政府的政策感到失望。

•They began to despair of ever being rescued.他们开始对获救失去了希望。





disappointment, despair, desperation, depression

这组词都有“绝望、沮丧”的意思，其区别是：
disappointment: 多指愿望或期望的落空。
despair: 普通用词，指因灾难等因素而丧失希望和信心，陷入沮丧，绝望的境地。
desperation: 语气强烈，指因绝望而使人采取无所顾忌的疯狂行动。
depression: 侧重指因遭受重大失利或挫折而产生的低落情绪。


n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事
 - hopelessness, acedia
vi. 绝望，丧失信心
 - throw up one's hands, lose heart
examples: 英 [dɪ'speə(r)] 美 [dɪ'sper]
n.绝望；失望vi.失望

(1) A person is most disappointed when he is in despair.(2) He has been in the abyss of despair.(3) He fluctuated between hope and despair.(4) He is the despair of all other pianists.(5) We cannot despair of humanity, since we are ourselves human beings.(6) They despaired of winning the game.
(1) 一个人在绝望时最失望。(2) 他已陷入绝望的深渊。(3) 他时而充满希望时而失望。(4) 他使其他所有的钢琴家都感到失望。(5) 身为人类,我们不能对人性失望。(6) 他们不抱比赛得胜的希望。
[sound:youdao-401390f8-ba86f827-3a36d7c6-380017ce-b4a5ee0e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 绝望的; 由绝望而引起的; 铤而走险的，孤注一掷的; 急切的，极度渴望的

分布：绝望的(53%)，不顾一切的(38%)，极其想要的(9%)


→来自despair, 绝望。
绝望的(de去掉+sper+ate→去掉希望→绝望的)[Sper=hope,表示"希望"]
a.不顾一切的,铤而走险的;绝望的,危急的I deliberately liberated the man who was in despair and desperately struggled for liberation and liberty.我有意解放了那个拼命地争取解放和自由的绝望者.



US [-pɚ-] adjective SERIOUS  严重的   ADVANCED  ■very serious or bad 非常严重的，非常糟糕的
•desperate poverty赤贫

•a desperate shortage of food/supplies食物／供应品的极度匮乏

•The situation is desperate - we have no food, very little water and no medical supplies.形势非常严峻——我们没有食物和药物，只有很少的水。
 ADVANCED  ■very great or extreme 巨大的；极端的；非常的
•The earthquake survivors are in desperate need of help.地震幸存者极需帮助。

•He has a desperate desire to succeed.他非常渴望成功。

•informal I'm in a desperate hurry.我饿极了。

UK ['des.pər.ət] US [-pɚ-] adjective WANTING  想要的   ADVANCED  [usually after verb] ■needing or wanting something very much 非常需要的；非常想要的
•They are desperate for help.他们非常需要帮助。

•humorous I'm desperate for a drink!我特别想喝一杯！

•[+ to infinitive] He was desperate to tell someone his good news.他很想把自己的好消息告诉别人。

UK ['des.pər.ət] US [-pɚ-] adjective RISKY  冒险的   ADVANCED  ■feeling that you have no hope and are ready to do anything to change the bad situation you are in （因绝望而）拼命的，不顾一切的
•The doctors made one last desperate attempt/effort to save the boy's life.医生们为挽救男孩的生命作了最后一次努力。

•Desperate measures are needed to deal with the growing drug problem.需要对越来越严重的毒品问题采取强而有力的措施。

•They made a desperate plea for help.他们拼命求助。
■willing to be violent, and therefore dangerous 疯狂的，狂暴的
•This man is desperate and should not be approached as he may have a gun.此人已是亡命之徒，可能还有枪，千万不要靠近。





desperate, hopeless

desperate: 因绝望而铤而走险
hopeless: 无任何希望；


adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的
 - venturous, devil-may-care
examples: 英 ['despərət] 美 ['despərət]
adj.绝望的；不顾一切的；极其想要的

(1) I had no money left and was desperate.(2) They made a desperate plea for help.(3) His failure made him desperate.(4) The man lost in the desert was desperate for water.(5) He is desperate to get a job.
(1) 我一点钱都没有了,简直绝望了。(2) 他们不顾一切地恳求帮助。(3) 他因失败而铤而走险。(4) 在沙漠中迷失方向的人极度渴望得到水。(5) 他非常渴求得一职。
[sound:youdao-133505ba-ef01d10d-77cdadf4-93c0537e-48ce64b4.mp3]

translation:
vt. 鄙视，看不起

时态：despised, despising, despises
分布：轻视(100%)


→来自古法 语despis, de-, 向下，-spis, 看，词源同special, spectator. 即向下看，鄙视。
轻视,看不起(spis=spic)[spect,spic=look,see,表示"看"]
v.轻视,蔑视"The enterprise will be supervised by a group comprising prominent men," the despising chairman said concisely with no compromise."企业将由杰出人员构成的小组来监管,"轻蔑的主席毫不妥协简明地
【记】de向下，spise＝spic看：向下看－鄙视【反】reverence（n /v 尊敬；敬重）；venerate（v 崇敬）



verb transitive not continuous ■to feel a strong dislike for someone or something because you think they are bad or have no value 鄙视，蔑视；厌恶
•The two groups despise each other.这两个团体互相鄙视。

•She despised him for the way he treated her sister.他那样对待她姐姐，让她感到很厌恶。

•[R] He despised himself for being such a coward.他厌恶自己竟然如此胆小。





scorn, look down upon, despise

这组词都有“轻视，蔑视”的意思，其区别是：
scorn: 语气较强，指极端的蔑视，常伴有愤怒或恼怒的情感。
look down upon: 指自视地位优越而蔑视他人或事。
despise: 指由于卑鄙、软弱，渺小或无价值等而被轻视。


vt. 轻视，鄙视
 - slight, set light by
examples: 英 [dɪ'spaɪz] 美 [dɪ'spaɪz]
vt.轻视

(1) He claims to despise riches.(2) You must not despise a man because he is poor.(3) I despise his refusing to accept responsibility.(4) It is incorrect to despise woman.(5) Practice is as important as theory, but we are apt to value the latter and despise the former.
(1) 他宣称蔑视钱财。(2) 你不可因一个人贫穷而轻视他。(3) 他拒不承担责任，我鄙视他。(4) 轻视妇女是错误的。(5) 实践与理论一样重要，但是我们易于珍视后者而轻视前者。
[sound:youdao-7686aa55-cb291d67-e982f7eb-09dca435-ad8ba068.mp3]

translation:
prep. 不管; 尽管（自己）不愿意; 不在乎; 虽有
n. 侮辱; 憎恨; 怨恨; 轻蔑的拒绝或不承认

分布：尽管(89%)，不管(8%)，憎恨(2%)，轻视(1%)


→词源同despise,鄙视，-t, 过去分词后缀。用于引申义，尽管（鄙视），仍然。
prep.不管,不顾I had appetite for inviting the man who bit me despite I had spite against him.我有意邀请咬我的人,尽管我怨恨他.



preposition  ESSENTIAL  ■without taking any notice of or being influenced by; not prevented by 不管；尽管；无论
•I still enjoyed the week despite the weather.不管天气如何，这一周我过得还是很愉快的。

•Despite repeated assurances that the product is safe, many people have stopped buying it.尽管已反覆保证了该产品的安全性，很多人还是不再购买。

•[+ -ing verb] He managed to eat a big lunch despite having eaten an enormous breakfast.尽管早餐吃了很多，他午饭还是大吃了一顿。
  Common Learner Errors   despiteRemember that despite  is never followed by 'of'.Don't say 'despite of something', say despite something:✗ She is an excellent assistant, despite of her lack of computer skills.She is an excellent assistant, despite her lack of computer skills.Note that in spite  has a similar meaning but is always followed by 'of'In spite of her lack of computer skills, she is an excellent assistant.
[dɪ'spaɪt] preposition despite yourself ■If you do something despite yourself, you do it although you do not want to or although you know you should not 不由自主地，忍不住地
•He laughed despite himself.他忍不住笑了起来。

•She took the money from her mother's purse, despite herself.她忍不住从母亲的银包里拿了钱。





regardless of, in spite of, despite

regardless of: regardless of=without considering or take notice of(有意识的行为，notice: 无意识的行为)
in spite of: in spite of/despite+n=although+clause
despite: despite=in spite of, 因此despite不再与of连用



in spite of, notwithstanding, despite

这组词都有“虽然，尽管”的意思，其区别是：
in spite of: 在这些词中语气最强，可与despite换用，口语或书面语中均可使用。
notwithstanding: 语气最弱，仅表示一种障碍的存在。
despite: 书面用词，指不受某事或某种原因的阻碍，语气轻于in spite of。


prep. 尽管，不管
 - in spite of, for all that
n. 轻视；憎恨；侮辱
 - hate, hatred, contempt
examples: 英 [dɪ'spaɪt] 美 [dɪ'spaɪt]
prep.尽管；不管n.憎恨；轻视

(1) Despite old age, she is still learning to drive.(2) Despite all our efforts we still lost the game.(3) He came to the meeting despite his illness.(4) She managed despite everything to preserve her sense of humour.(5) The statesman scoffed at the despites from his political enemy.(6) She ignored all despites and carried on with her dreams.
(1) 尽管年事已高,她还在学开车。(2) 尽管我们尽了全力，我们还是输掉了比赛。(3) 尽管生病，他还是来参加会议。(4) 她不管遇到什么情况都竭力保持着幽默感。(5) 这位政治家对政敌的攻击嗤之以鼻。(6) 她不在乎别人的轻视,继续追逐自己的梦想。
[sound:youdao-ccb81318-098a916f-a5387104-ceebda57-2de75bcc.mp3]

translation:
n. 目的，目标; 目的地，终点; [罕用语]预定，指定

分布：目的地(91%)，终点(9%)


→de-, 向下，强调。-stin, 站，站立，词源同stand, institute. 即下一个立足点，目的的。
n.目的地,终点The destiny of the pest in chestnut is not known before reaching the destination.栗子中害虫的命运在到达目的地之前是未知的.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■the place where someone is going or where something is being sent or taken 目的地；终点
•We arrived at our destination tired and hungry.我们到达目的地时又累又饿。

•His letter never reached its destination.他的信没有被送到收信人处。

•The Caribbean is a popular tourist / UK holiday / US vacation destination.加勒比海是人们喜爱的旅游／渡假胜地。




n. [计] 目的地，终点
 - goal, end-point
examples: 英 [ˌdestɪ'neɪʃn] 美 [ˌdestɪ'neɪʃn]
n.目的地；终点

(1) We eventually arrived at our destination.(2) The parcel was sent to the wrong destination.(3) The coach followed a rather devious course to its destination.(4) The destination of bus No. 8 is the State University.
(1) 我们终于到达了目的地。(2) 包裹送错了地方。(3) 长途汽车要绕很多弯路才到达目的地。(4) 8路车的终点是州立大学。

translation:
n. 破坏，毁灭，消灭，灭亡，扑灭，驱除; 摧毁; 毁灭的原因，破坏手段; 杀害

分布：破坏(60%)，毁灭(40%)


→de-, 夺去，损毁。-struct, 建造，词源同structure,destroy.
破坏(de+struct结构;建造＋ion→弄坏结构→破坏)[de-①表示"去掉,变坏,离开,变慢,向下"等②表示"使…成为,加强"等]
n.毁坏,毁灭(的原因)The instructor struggled to say, "The structure of the construction led to the destruction."教师挣扎着说:"建筑物的构造导致这场毁灭."



noun uncountable  IMPROVER  ■when something is destroyed 毁灭，消灭，破坏
•Many people are very concerned about the destruction of the rainforests.许多人都非常关注雨林遭破坏的问题。

•Unusually high winds left a trail of destruction over southern Britain.罕见的大风在英国南部造成了一连串的破坏。

•weapons of mass destruction (= those which kill or hurt large numbers of people)大规模杀伤性武器




n. 破坏，毁灭；摧毁
 - breaking, death, blasting, disruption, demolition
examples: 英 [dɪ'strʌkʃn] 美 [dɪ'strʌkʃn]
n.破坏；毁灭

(1) It will cause pollution and the destruction of our seas and oceans.(2) Scientific knowledge was perverted to help cause destruction and war.(3) Gambling was his destruction.(4) The destruction of the village must have been an act of god.
(1) 这会引起污染，破坏我们的海洋和江河。(2) 科学知识被滥用于破坏和战争。(3) 赌博把他毁了。(4) 那座村庄的毁灭一定是天灾造成的。

translation:
n. 详述; （照片、绘画等的）细部; 细目，琐碎; 各种细节
vt. 详述，仔细汇报; 选派; 清晰地说明; 给于细部装饰

时态：detailed, detailing, details
分布：细节(79%)，详述(8%)，详细说明(8%)，琐事(3%)，枝节(2%)


→de-, 向下，强调。-tail, 切，词源同retail, tailor. 即完全切开的，引申义细节。
琐事;详情(de加强+tail→不断剪下去→琐事)[tail=cut,表示"剪,割"]
n.细节,详情v.详述He explained it in detail.他详细地说明那件事.



US [-'-] noun INFORMATION  信息   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a single piece of information or fact about something 消息；细节
•She insisted on telling me every single detail of what they did to her in hospital.她坚持要告诉我她在医院遭遇的一切。

•We don't know the full/precise details of the story yet.我们还不知道故事的全部／具体情节。

•She refused to disclose/divulge any details about/of the plan.她拒绝透露该计划的任何细节。
details [plural]  IMPROVER  ■information about someone or something 细节，详情
•Can I have your details (= name and address, etc.) , please?可以告诉我你的详细情况吗？

•I've sent off for the details of a job I saw advertised in the paper.我已经发信索取刊发在报纸广告上的那份工作的细节。
■3. A police officer took down the details of what happened. ADVANCED  uncountable ■the small features of something that you only notice when you look carefully 细微特征
•I was just admiring the detail in the doll's house - even the tins of food have labels on them.我只是感叹布娃娃的玩具房子制作之精致——就连食品罐头上都还贴着标签呢。

•It's his eye for (= ability to notice) detail that distinguishes him as a painter.正是因为具有细致入微的观察能力，他才成为一位杰出的画家。
in detail  ADVANCED  ■including or considering all the information about something or every part of something 详细地，详尽地
•We haven't discussed the matter in detail yet.我们还没有详细讨论此事。

•The book described her sufferings in graphic detail.这本书详尽地描述了她所遭受的种种痛苦。

•He talked in great detail about the curtains he's chosen for his lounge.他详细介绍了他为客厅选定的窗帘。
go into detail  ADVANCED  ■to tell or include all the facts about something 详细说明，仔细介绍
•I won't go into detail over the phone, but I've been having a few health problems recently.我在电话里就不细说了，但最近我的身体一直有些不舒服。
countable ■a part of something which does not seem important 细枝末节，无足轻重的小事
•As far as Tony's concerned, he's getting that car and finding the money to pay for it is just a detail.就托尼而言，得到那种汽车及凑够买车的钱都不是甚么大事。

UK ['di:.teɪl] US [-'-] noun GROUP  组  countable [+ sing/pl verb] ■a group of people who have been given a particular task 特遣队
UK ['di:.teɪl] US [-'-] verb INFORMATION  信息  transitive ■to describe something completely, giving all the facts 详细描述
•[+ question word] Can you produce a report detailing wh at we've spent on the project so far?你能不能写一份报告，详细列出到目前为止我们在这个企划案上的花费？

UK ['di:.teɪl] US [-'-] verb ORDER  命令  transitive + to infinitive [often passive] ■to order someone, often a small group of soldiers or workers, to perform a particular task 指派，派遣
•Four soldiers were detailed to check the road for troops.派出了四名士兵为部队检查道路情况。




n. 细节，详情
 - specific, minutia
vt. 详述；选派
 - expand on, enlarge on
examples: 英 ['diːteɪl] 美 ['diːteɪl]
n.细节；琐事；枝节vt.详述；详细说明

(1) The full details of the agreement haven't been made public.(2) He told us the accident in detail.(3) Sadat seemed free of the obsession with detail.(4) Every detail of her dress is perfect.(5) Could you detail all your expenses on this form?(6) Please detail the characteristics of the machine.(7) A moment ago, you mentioned something about the design of the packing. Will you detail it a bit?
(1) 协议的细节尚未公布。(2) 他详细地把事故讲给我们听。(3) 萨达特不那么注重细微末节。(4) 她衣服上的每个小地方都很完美。(5) 请把你的各项开支列在这张表格上，好吗？(6) 请详细说明该机器的性能。(7) 刚才你提到包装设计的问题,能否详细谈谈?
[sound:youdao-3c40a3a4-6bf22daa-52981f9e-217bd6e2-84e97e79.mp3]

translation:
vt. 查明，发现; 洞察; 侦察，侦查; [电子学]检波

时态：detected, detecting, detects
分布：探测(58%)，察觉(34%)，发觉(8%)


→de-, 不，非，使相反。-tect, 覆盖，词源同deck, tile. 即揭开覆盖，查明。
发觉;看破(de打开+tect...把盖上的打开...发觉)[tect=cover,表示"盖上"]
v.察觉,发觉,侦察,探测The detective detected that the arch was under the marching Arctic architects' protection.侦察察觉拱门受到行进的北极建筑师们的保护.



verb transitive  ADVANCED  ■to notice something that is partly hidden or not clear, or to discover something, especially using a special method （尤指用特殊方法）发现，察觉，看出
•Some sounds cannot be detected by the human ear.有些声音是人的耳朵无法察觉到的。

•Financial experts have detected signs that the economy is beginning to improve.金融专家已经注意到经济开始有好转的迹象。
 ADVANCED  ■to discover something, usually using special equipment （通常指用特别设备）探测，检测，测出
•High levels of lead were detected in the atmosphere.经检测发现大气中铅的含量很高。

•Radar equipment is used to detect (= find the position of) enemy aircraft.雷达装置用于探测敌机的位置。





detect, discover, ascertain, find

这组词都有“发现”的意思，其区别是：
detect: 正式用词，强调经过周密观察或研究而有所获得和发现，尤指发现有意隐藏之物。
discover: 普通用词，指发现本来存在，但示被认识的事物、真理或情况。
ascertain: 较正式用词，指有意搜寻与发现。
find: 普通用词，可指偶然发现，也可指经过寻找后得到或重新获得已失去的东西。强调动作的结果。


vt. 察觉；发现；探测
 - explore, perceive
examples: 英 [dɪ'tekt] 美 [dɪ'tekt]
v.发觉；察觉；探测

(1) Do I detect a tinge of irony?(2) If you read between the lines, you can detect his contrived explanation.(3) I seemed to detect some anger in his voice.(4) Small quantities of poison were detected in the dead man's stomach.(5) They detected no defect in the product.
(1) 我觉得这话有点儿像反话吧?(2) 在字里行间，你可以看出他牵强的解释。(3) 我似乎在他的声音中听出一些怒气。(4) 在死者胃中找到了少量的毒药。(5) 他们没发现产品有任何问题。

translation:
n. 侦查; 察觉; 发觉; 检查

分布：探测(63%)，察觉(15%)，侦查(15%)，发觉(7%)


发觉(detect+ion)[tect=cover,表示"盖上"]
【记】de去掉，tect遮盖－去掉遮盖－发现【参】protection（n 保护）；detect（v 察觉，发现）；detective（n 侦探（调查犯罪并获取证据的人））



noun uncountable ■when someone notices or discovers something 察觉；发现
•Early detection of the cancer improves the chances of successful treatment.及早发现癌症能提高治愈的机率。

•bomb detection炸弹探测
■when the police discover information about crimes 侦破（案件）
•a low/high crime detection rate低／高破案率




n. 侦查，探测；发觉，发现；察觉
 - exploration, discovery, occurrence, find
examples: 英 [dɪ'tekʃn] 美 [dɪ'tekʃn]
n.探测；侦查；察觉；发觉

(1) Our main detection device is sonar.(2) The word radar means radio detection and ranging.(3) The detection of crime is not always easy.(4) Detection is not properly a function of the customs service.(5) Early detection helped to save his life.(6) Many problems, however, escape detection.(7) This trick escaped detection at the time.
(1) 我们主要的探测装置是声波定位仪。(2) 雷达这个词的意思是指无线电探测和测距。(3) 侦查罪行并非易事。(4) 严格地说来，侦查工作不是海关的一项职责。(5) 幸好提早察觉,他才得以幸免。(6) 然而许多问题却未被察觉。(7) 这骗局那时候没被发觉。
[sound:youdao-b4841dbf-c24dd0dc-26cd66a6-a2b64de1-d2a8c769.mp3]

translation:
n. 决心; 决定，确定; [物]测定，计算

分布：决心(54%)，测定(44%)，规定(1%)，定位(1%)


决定(determine决定)[-ation表名词"行为,过程,结果"]



US [-ˌtɝ:-] noun TRYING HARD  毅力   IMPROVER  uncountable ■the ability to continue trying to do something, although it is very difficult 决心，毅力
•a man of fierce/ruthless determination很有毅力／痛下决心的人

•[+ to infinitive] She has a great determination to succeed.她有很大的决心获得成功。
⇒ See also self-determination
UK [dɪˌtɜ:.mɪ'neɪ.ʃən] US [-ˌtɝ:-] noun DECISION  决定  uncountable formal ■the process of controlling, influencing or deciding something 决定，确定
•The determination of policy is not your business - your job is to implement it.政策的决定与你无关——你的工作就是执行。

UK [dɪˌtɜ:.mɪ'neɪ.ʃən] US [-ˌtɝ:-] noun DISCOVERING  发现  countable or uncountable specialized ■the process of finding something out 查明；测定
•the determination of his whereabouts查明他的下落





resolve, determination, resolution, decision

这组词都有“决定、决心”的意思，其区别是：
resolve: 语气较强，强调克服感情上的软弱，下决心干具体的一件事。
determination: 侧重坚定不移的顽强意志力。
resolution: 指自觉地正式表示的决心，含极强的主观能动意味。
decision: 既可指重大的或一般的决定或决心，又可指在多种情况下作出果断的抉择，毫不犹豫地采取行动。


n. 决心；果断
 - decision, resolution, push, backbone
examples: 英 [dɪˌtɜːmɪ'neɪʃn] 美 [dɪˌtɜːrmɪ'neɪʃn]
n.决心；测定；规定；(正式)决定；定位

(1) He was utterly ruthless in his determination to succeed.(2) The determination of the amount of iron in ore is very important.(3) The determination will aversely affect the outcome of the game.(4) In the event that an affirmative determination of dumping and injury is made, the undertaking shall continue consistent with its terms and the provisions of this Agreement.(5) The choice of a foster home was left to the determination of the court.(6) The determination of a name for the club took a very long time.(7) Conclusion Diagnosis is depended on qualitative determination of the pericardial effusion and level diagnosis by radionuclide lymphography.(8) The application of genechip based on bioinfomatics became a stronger tool for environmental microbial ecological study and gene determination of function enzyme.

(1) 他下定决心争取成功。(2) 矿石中铁含量的测定是很主要的。(3) 这个规定将逆转比赛结果。(4) 如做出关于倾销和损害的肯定裁定，则承诺应按其条件和本协定的规定继续有效。(5) 选择怎样的家庭抚养孤儿,将由法庭决定。(6) 决定俱乐部的名称费了很长的时间。(7) 乳糜性心包积液严重者可发生慢性心包填塞，诊断依赖穿刺积液的定性诊断和淋巴显像的定位诊断。(8) 基因芯片技术的运用，成为环境微生物生态研究和功能酶基因定位的有力工具。

translation:
vt. & vi. （使）下决心，（使）做出决定
vt. 决定，确定; 判定，判决; 使决定; 限定
vi. [主用于法律]了结，终止，结束

时态：determined, determining, determines
分布：确定(55%)，决定(37%)，测定(6%)，决心(2%)


→de-, 向下。-term, 边界，界限，词源同term, terminal. 即划下界限，明确。
限定;决定(de加强动作+termine→加强界限→下决心)[termin=limit,表示"界限"]
v.决心,决定;确定,限定I'm determined to permit the permanent term on detergent.我决心同意有关洗涤剂的永久条款.



US [-'tɝ:-] verb DECIDE  决定   IMPROVER  transitive often passive ■to control or influence something directly, or to decide what will happen 确定，决定；影响
•The number of staff we can take on will be determined by how much money we're allowed to spend.我们雇用的人数将取决于可支配资金的多少。

•Your health is determined in part by what you eat.在某种程度上你的健康状况取决于你的饮食。

•Eye colour is genetically determined.眼睛的颜色是由遗传基因决定的。

•[+ question word] formal A pitch inspection will determine wh ether or not the match will be played.场地检查结果将决定这场比赛能否进行。

•People should be allowed to determine their own future.应该允许人们决定自己的未来。
transitive formal ■to make a strong decision 下决心
•[+ that] She determined that one day she would be an actor.她决心将来当演员。

•[+ to infinitive] On leaving jail, Joe determined to reform.祖出狱后决心改过自新。

UK [dɪ'tɜ:.mɪn] US [-'tɝ:-] verb DISCOVER  决定  transitive formal ■to discover the facts or truth about something 找出，确定，测定；查明
•The police never actually determined the cause of death.警方实际上从未查明死因。

•[+ question word] It is the responsibility of the court to determine wh ether these men are innocent.确定这些人是否无辜是法庭的责任。

•[+ that] The jury determined that the men were guilty.陪审团裁决那些人有罪。





decide, resolve, determine, settle

这组词都有“决定”的意思，其区别是：
decide: 侧重指经过思考、比较、讨论或询问之后做出的决定。
resolve: 语气较强，强调以坚定不移的信念去做或不做某事，暗含有远大抱负和坚强决心。
determine: 指经过深思熟虑，决心去做某事并坚持施行。
settle: 指排除犹豫、怀疑和争论之后作出明确的最终结论。


vt. 决定；判决；使…下定决心
 - condition, conclude
vi. 确定；决定；判决，终止
 - identify, drop, finish, judge
examples: 英 [dɪ'tɜːmɪn] 美 [dɪ'tɜːrmɪn]
v.决定；决心；确定；测定

(1) Chance will determine the outcome.(2) I must now determine whether to meet him or not.(3) I am determined to find out the rights and wrongs of this matter.(4) An inquest was held to determine the cause of his death.(5) They used geology to determine likely sites for new oil wells.
(1) 机缘将决定结果(2) 我现在必须决定是否要见他。(3) 我决心查明这件事的真相。(4) 为确定他的死因进行了审问。(5) 他们运用地质学来测定新油井的可能位置。
[sound:youdao-98ad8c18-6c4af53b-a4de403e-84f317f2-5eb3c670.mp3]

translation:
vi. 发展; 生长; 形成; 发达
vt. 发展; 开发; 研制; 冲洗（胶片）

时态：developed, developing, develops
分布：发展(62%)，开发(33%)，发育(5%)


→de-, 不，非，使相反。-velop, 裹，围住，词源同envelop,wind. 即去除限制使发展。
发展[velop=cover(盖上)]
v.发展,开发,研制;显现,显影;发育,生长Several industries are developing in this area.几种工业正在这个地区发展.



verb GROW  生长   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause something to) grow or change into a more advanced, larger or stronger form （使）发展；（使）发育；（使）成长
•It became clear that he wasn't developing like all the other little boys.显然他没有像其他小男孩那样正常生长发育。

•The fear is that these minor clashes may develop into all-out confrontation.人们担心这些小小的冲突可能会演变成全面的对抗。

•Over time, their acquaintance developed into a lasting friendship.随着时间的推移，他们的泛泛之交变成了巩固的友谊。

•This exercise is designed to develop the shoulder and back muscles.这项练习旨在锻炼肩部和背部的肌肉。

•I'm looking for a job which will enable me to develop my skills/talents.我在寻找一份可以提高自己技能／才能的工作。

[dɪ'vel.əp] verb START  开创   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to invent something or bring something into existence 开发；制定
•We must develop a new policy/strategy to deal with the problem.我们必须制定一项新政策／策略来处理这个问题。

•The company is spending $650 million on developing new products/technology.该公司将斥资6.5亿美元用于新产品／技术的开发。
 IMPROVER  intransitive ■to start to happen or exist 发生；出现
•Large cracks began to develop in the wall.墙上开始出现了一些很大的裂缝。
 IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■If you develop an illness or problem, or if it develops, you start to suffer from it 患上，患（病）；逐渐形成（疾病或问题）
•The study showed that one in twelve women is likely to develop breast cancer.这项研究表明约有十二分之一的妇女可能会患乳腺癌。

•She's developed some very strange habits lately.她近来养成了一些怪习惯。
transitive ■to build houses, factories, shops, etc. on a piece of land 开发，建设
•They're planning to develop the whole site into a shopping complex.他们计划把这一整片地皮开发，建设成购物中心。

[dɪ'vel.əp] verb PROCESS FILM  显影  intransitive or transitive ■to make photographs or negatives from a film （使）显影；冲晒
•I haven't had my holiday photos developed yet.我的渡假相片还未冲晒出来。

[dɪ'vel.əp] verb   Common Learner Errors   developWarning:  Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using develop  in the past tense.The past simple and past participle have 'p'. Don't write 'developped', write developed.The -ing  form is developing.




mature, age, develop, ripen

这组词都有“成熟、长成”的意思，其区别是：
mature: 指生物自然发育成熟或丰满或使其能起正常作用，还可指人获得智慧、经验或变得世故。
age: 一般指使人过早成熟，强调已走向衰老。
develop: 侧重使某一种类或个体潜在本能进化完全，词义比mature广泛。
ripen: 侧重已到长生成熟的顶点。


vt. 开发；进步；使成长；使显影
 - exploit, open up
vi. 发育；生长；进化；显露
 - grow, flower
examples: 英 [dɪ'veləp] 美 [dɪ'veləp]
v.发展；发育；开发；冲洗(照片)

(1) Modern music was first developed in Italy.(2) China can't develop in isolation from the rest of the world.(3) Plants develop from seeds, but many animals developed from eggs.(4) We can develop your film in an hour.(5) How long will it take to develop these pictures?
(1) 现代音乐最初是在意大利发展起来的。(2) 中国的发展离不开世界。(3) 植物由种子发育而成,而许多动物由卵子发育而来。(4) 我们可以于一小时后把你的胶卷冲洗出来。(5) 冲印这些照片要花多长时间?
[sound:youdao-dcd81f75-9dba56b5-c5c3b232-cd6d8963-50137e1e.mp3]

translation:
n. 装置，设备; 方法; 策略; 手段

分布：设备(55%)，装置(39%)，设计(4%)，策略(2%)


→来自devise, 用作名词。
n.装置,设备,仪表;方法,设计The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device for getting rid of vice.代理顾问建议校订者想出一个根除恶习的计策.



noun countable OBJECT  物品   IMPROVER  ■an object or machine which has been invented for a particular purpose 装置，器械
•a contraceptive/electronic device避孕器具／电子装置

•Rescuers used a special device for finding people trapped in collapsed buildings.救援者使用特殊器械来寻找被困在倒塌建筑物下面的人。

[dɪ'vaɪs] noun countable METHOD  方法  ■a method which is used to produce a wanted effect （可达到期望效果的）方法，手段
•a literary/rhetorical device文学／修辞手法

•A trademark can be a powerful marketing device.商标可以是一种强有力的行销手段。

•[+ to infinitive] Her cool manner is just a device to avoid having to talk to people.她冷漠的表现只是避免与人交谈的一种手段。

[dɪ'vaɪs] noun countable BOMB  炸弹  ■a bomb or other explosive 炸弹；爆炸装置
•an explosive/incendiary/nuclear device爆炸装置／燃烧弹／核爆炸装置





installation, tool, device, apparatus, implement, equipment, instrument, appliance, facilities

这组词都有“仪器、设备、器械、器具”的意思，其区别是：
installation: 一般多指安装完成，可供使用或操作的整套装置或设施。
tool: 一般指进行特种工作的手工工具，也可指人造使用动力的工具，还可作引申用。
device: 多指为某一特殊用途或解决某一特定机械问题而设计或改装的精巧的仪器或装置。
apparatus: 既可指某种具体的由许多不同零件构成的复杂的仪器、装置或器械，又可指它们的总称。
implement: 原指史前人类所用的工具，现在多指农用工具，也可指为实现某个任务所需的工具或器具。
equipment: 多指成套的或重型的设备或装备。通常用作不可数名词。
instrument: 通常指能使人们完成某一精确动作或测量的一种小型仪器，尤指电工仪表、测量装置，航海或航空用的控制装置。
appliance: 侧重指家用机器或设备，尤指家用电器。
facilities: 常用复数形式，指可供使用的设备或设施。


n. [机] 装置；策略；图案
 - apparatus, installation, strategy, unit, gear
examples: 英 [dɪ'vaɪs] 美 [dɪ'vaɪs]
n.装置；设备；策略；设计

(1) The data logger device has been fitted to ship's engine room.(2) The printer is the most commonly used output device after the monitor.(3) It's just a tactical device to get over a split in their own Party.(4) The technicians whom we met yesterday had worked out a new automatic device .
(1) 数字记录仪装置已安装在船只的机舱里。(2) 打印机是除显示器外最常用的输出设备。(3) 这不过是他的想要克服党内分歧的一种策略。(4) 我们昨天碰到的那位技术员设计了一种新的自动化装置。
[sound:youdao-bcb30f95-080fff29-548843e6-08290561-f0efdb61.mp3]

translation:
n. 魔鬼; 家伙; 淘气鬼; 冒失鬼
vt. 虐待，折磨; （用扯碎机）扯碎; （替作家，律师等）做助手; 抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

时态：devilled, devilling, devils
分布：魔鬼(88%)，家伙(6%)，淘气鬼(2%)，困扰(1%)，坏人(1%)，添加辣味调料(1%)，棘手的事(1%)


→来自拉丁语diabolus, 穿过，诽谤，攻击，词源同diabolic.来自dia-，穿过，-ball, 投掷，词源同ballistic, kill. 后用于指魔鬼。devil ’s advocate 故意唱反调的人
n.魔鬼It's evident that the evil devil inevitably goes to ruin.很明显,邪恶的魔鬼必然灭亡.



noun EVIL BEING  魔鬼   ADVANCED  countable ■an evil being, often represented in human form but with a tail and horns 魔鬼，恶魔，妖魔the devil only singular (often the Devil) ■a powerful evil force and the enemy of God in Christianity and Judaism （基督教和犹太教中与上帝为敌的）魔鬼，撒旦
['dev.əl] noun PERSON  人  countable informal ■someone, especially a child, who behaves badly 坏蛋，淘气鬼，捣蛋鬼（尤指孩子）
•Those little/young devils broke my window.那些小淘气鬼打破了我的窗户。
countable informal humorous ■a person who enjoys doing things people might disapprove of 鬼东西，死鬼
•"I'm going to wear a short black skirt and thigh-length boots." "Ooh, you devil!"“我打算穿一条黑色短裙和及膝长靴。”“噢，你这个作死鬼！”

•Have another slice of cake - go on, be a devil!再吃一件蛋糕——吃吧，豁出去了！
countable informal ■used with an adjective to describe someone and express your opinion about something that has happened to them （与形容词连用表示对某人的看法）人，家伙
•I hear you've got a new car, you lucky devil!我听说你得了一辆新车，你这个走运的家伙！

•He's been ill for weeks, poor devil.他已病了好几个星期了，可怜的家伙。

['dev.əl] noun be between the devil and the deep blue sea ■to have two choices but both of them are equally unpleasant or not convenient 进退维谷，左右为难
['dev.əl] noun The devil finds work for idle hands. saying ■said to show that you believe people who have nothing to do are more likely to get into trouble or commit a crime 无事之徒易犯事
['dev.əl] noun the devil to pay old-fashioned ■a lot of trouble, difficulty, punishment, anger, etc. 严重后果、困难、惩罚、别人的愤怒等
•If he catches you going through his drawers there'll be the devil to pay!如果他发现你翻他的抽屉，你会有大麻烦的。

['dev.əl] noun the devil's own ■extremely difficult or bad 极为困难的；极坏的
•We had the devil's own job/time finding the place!我们找这个地方可费了不少功夫／时间！

['dev.əl] noun (to) give the devil his due ■said when you admit that someone you do not like or admire does have particular good qualities 平心而论，说句公道话
•I don't like the man but - give the devil his due - he works incredibly hard.我不喜欢那个人，可是平心而论，他工作起来真是特别卖力。

['dev.əl] noun go to the devil old-fashioned ■something you say to someone annoying or bad to tell them to go away forever 去死吧，见鬼去吧
['dev.əl] noun speak/talk of the devil ■something you say when the person you were talking about appears unexpectedly 说到某人，某人就到
•Did you hear what happened to Anna yesterday - oh, speak of the devil, here she is.你听说安娜昨天出的那件事了吗——噢，说曹操，曹操就到了。

['dev.əl] noun the/a devil of a sth old-fashioned ■an extremely difficult or serious type of something 极为困难的；极其严重的
•a devil of a mess/problem极为混乱的局面／极其严重的问题

•We had the devil of a job/time trying to find this place!我们找这个地方可费了不少周折／时间！

['dev.əl] noun what/where/how/why the devil old-fashioned informal ■used to give emphasis to a question （用于强调问题）到底，究竟
•What the devil are you doing?你到底在做甚么？

•Where the devil have you been?你究竟去了哪里？




n. 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍
 - apple, customer, egg, fellow, guy
vt. 折磨
 - harry, worry, trouble, tear, torture
examples: 英 ['devl] 美 ['devl]
n.魔鬼；淘气鬼；坏人；家伙；棘手的事vt.困扰；添加辣味调料；给...做助手

(1) They believed she had been possessed by devils.(2) He believes in devils and witches.(3) I bet you were a little devil when you were youger.(4) My niece is a little devil.(5) She found out her husband was a devil soon after her marriage.(6) The mercy on the devil is the cruelty to the kind.(7) I'm having a devil of a job fixing my car.(8) This job is the very devil.(9) The little boy devils papa for a toy.(10) She devils for the writer.
(1) 他们认为她是受魔鬼控制了。(2) 他相信魔鬼、巫婆这类事.(3) 我猜你年轻的时候一定是个小淘气鬼。(4) 我的侄女是个调皮鬼。(5) 结婚后不久她就发现她丈夫是一个邪恶的人。(6) 对坏人的同情就是对好人的残忍。(7) 我修我这辆汽车可费劲了。(8) 这份工作十分棘手。(9) 这个小男孩缠着爸爸买玩具。(10) 她是这位作家的助手。

translation:
v. 设计; 发明; 策划; 想出
n. 遗赠; 遗赠的财产; 遗赠的条款

时态：devised, devising, devises
分布：设计(81%)，发明(12%)，遗赠(7%)


→来自拉丁语dividere,词源同divide。即分开，展开，后词义引申为发明，设计。
设计,想出(由古义"分开"转化而来)[vid,vis=separate,表示"分开"]
vt.设计;发明;图谋;作出(计划);想出(办法)The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device for getting rid of vice.代理顾问建议校订者想出一个根除恶习的计策.



verb transitive  ADVANCED  ■to invent a plan, system, object, etc., usually cleverly or using imagination 巧妙构思；巧妙设计；发明
•He's good at devising language games that you can play with students in class.他善于设计可供师生在课堂上使用的语言游戏。

•The cartoon characters Snoopy and Charlie Brown were devised by Charles M. Schultz.卡通人物史诺比和查理‧布朗是由查尔斯设计的。





formulate, devise, conceive

这组词都有“设计、设想”的意思，其区别是：
formulate: 与conceive相反，指在devise之后的具体设计活动。
devise: 侧重设计的临时性和权宜性，并隐含有更多的设想可用。
conceive: 强调在制定计划之前的先有设想构思。


vt. 设计；想出；发明；图谋；遗赠给
 - design, engineer, style, project, frame
n. 遗赠
 - legacy, bequest
examples: [联想] 把装置（device）掰弯 c变成s 就是（devise）设计 发明了
英 [dɪ'vaɪz] 美 [dɪ'vaɪz]
vt.设计；发明；遗赠
(1) This time we'll devise a better solution.(2) The government devised a scheme for redeveloping the city center.(3) He devised a new type of transistor.
(1) 这次我们将设计一种新的解决方案。(2) 政府制定了市中心重建计划。(3) 他发明了一种新的晶体管。
[sound:youdao-b9f843ca-0b8eefc4-ea7945ca-67f14362-dcd60c4c.mp3]

translation:
vt. 把…奉献（给），把…专用（于）; 奉献

时态：devoted, devoting, devotes
分布：致力于(74%)，奉献给(23%)，把...专用于(3%)


→de-, 强调，整个的。-vot, 说，发愿，词源同vow, vote,voice. 引申义发下宏愿的，虔诚的。
投身于,献身(de加强+vote→拼命发誓→献身)[vot=vow,表示"发誓"]
v.(to)奉献,致力In the hot hotel the devoted voter did not notice the noticeable notebook.在炎热的旅馆里,热心的投票者没有注意到显而易见的笔记本.



US [-'voʊt] verb   Phrasal Verbs   devote sth to sth/sb  ADVANCED  ■to give all of something, especially your time, effort or love, or yourself, to something you believe in or to a person 将…贡献给，把…奉献给
•He left government to devote more time to his family.为了能有更多时间陪伴家人，他离开了政府部门。

•She has devoted all her energies/life to the care of homeless people.她为照料无家可归者倾注了全部心血／奉献了一生。

•[R] At the age of 25, he decided to devote him self to God.他25岁时决定献身上帝。
[passive] ■to use a space, area, time, etc. for a particular purpose 将…用于
•Over half his speech was devoted to the issue of unemployment.他那篇演讲用了一半多的篇幅讨论失业问题。

•The report recommends that more resources be devoted to teaching four year olds.该报告建议投入更多的资源用于四岁儿童的教育。





dedicate, devote

这组词都有“奉献”的意思，其区别是：
dedicate: 正式用词，指献身于某一崇高事业或目的，也可指把著作题献给他人。
devote: 普通用词，指决心把全部身心、精力、时间等献给某一目标，某一个人或致力于某一事业。


vt. 致力于；奉献
 - commit oneself to, bend oneself to
examples: 英 [dɪ'vəʊt] 美 [dɪ'voʊt]
vt.致力于；奉献给；把...专用于

(1) You must devote your attention to your work.(2) After he graduated, he continued to devote himself to the research.(3) He devoted himself entirely to music.(4) He started to study ecology and decided to devote his whole life to the science.(5) He devoted a great sum of money to books.
(1) 你必须专心于工作。(2) 毕业以后,他继续潜心于这项研究。(3) 他将一生奉献给了音乐。(4) 他开始研究生态学,并决心将他的一生献身于这门学科。(5) 他们花了一大笔钱买书。

translation:
n. 水珠，露水
vt. 弄湿

分布：露水(100%)


→来自dheu, 流动，用于指露珠。
n.露水Beads of dew still clung to the roses.玫瑰花上仍然挂着露珠.



US [du:] noun uncountable ■drops of water that form on the ground and other surfaces outside during the night 露，露水



n. 珠，滴；露水；清新
 - drop, gutta
vt. （露水等）弄湿
 - get wet, moisten
examples: 英 [djuː] 美 [duː]
n.露水
(1) Dew dripped from the trees.(2) The grass was sprinkled with dew.(3) The dew on the grass drizzled my shoes.
(1) 露水从树上滴下来。(2) 草上沾满了露珠。(3) 草上的露水打湿了我的鞋。
[sound:youdao-023f0dbc-eff866d2-02ba7323-f0293241-11844cad.mp3]

translation:
n. 图表; 图解; 示意图; [数]线图
vt. 用图表示; 图解

时态：diagrammed, diagramming, diagrams
分布：图表(73%)，图解(22%)，用图解法表示(5%)


→dia-, 穿过，整个的。-gram, 写，记录，词源同telegram.用来指图表。
图表(dia+gram→交叉对着画→图表)[dia-表示"穿过,二者之间"]
图解,图表(dia交叉+gram→交叉画图)[graph,gram=write,表示"写,图"]
n.图表;图解The telegram says that the diagrams show the grammar of the program.电报说图表表示程序的语法.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a simple plan which represents a machine, system or idea, etc., often drawn to explain how it works 图，图解，示意图
•The teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart.老师画了一张示意图来说明血液如何进出心脏。





sketch, draft, blueprint, diagram, outline, plot

这组词都有“绘制”的意思，其区别是：
sketch: 指用图、模型或语言描述来表示某一事物的整体情况。
draft: 用作动词时指按准确比例设计或打样；作名词时专指精确的草图或草案。
blueprint: 主要指绘制蓝图或制定纲领或规划。这个词引申用来指详细而具体的行动计划。
diagram: 侧重指用图形、图表等来说明。
outline: 主要给出事物要点或轮廓，强调简化了的整体。
plot: 可与draft和diagram换用，但侧重于表示具体的点、面、部分或目标，从而使相互关系以及和整体的关系得以明确。



picture, sketch, cartoon, illustration, diagram, painting, portrait, drawing

这组词都有“画，图”的意思，其区别是：
picture: 指广义的“图画”，现多用来指相片、画像。
sketch: 通常指只画出物体主要特征的图画。
cartoon: 指幽默或讽刺性漫画。
illustration: 指插入书页之间帮助说明的任何插图或图解。
diagram: 多指科技书籍或文献中具有概括解说作用的图表、图样或略图。
painting: 指着色的画。
portrait: 指肖像，只用于指人。
drawing: 指用线条或色彩绘成的图画。


n. 图表； [数] 图解
 - chart, graph
examples: 英 ['daɪəɡræm] 美 ['daɪəɡræm]
n.图解；图表vt.用图解法表示

(1) She gave me a diagram of railway network.(2) The diagram had been copied with great precision.(3) He pointed at the diagram to illustrate his point.(4) He will diagram the entire procedure so that you can understand it more clearly.
(1) 她给了我一张铁路网图解。(2) 该图表的复印件很精确。(3) 他指着图表来说明他的论点。(4) 他将把整个程序制成图表，这样你就会理解清楚了。
[sound:youdao-9e08e3fc-cf7ae06c-cf8e0ee6-fa0fbbfc-51bdf1c0.mp3]

translation:
n. 日晷; 钟（表）面，标度盘; 拨号盘; 表盘
vt. & vi. 打电话，拨电话号码
vt. 用标度盘测量; 通过表针控制

时态：dialled, dialing, dials
分布：拨号(80%)，刻度盘(6%)，打电话(6%)，拨号盘(5%)，钟面(2%)，日晷(1%)


→来自拉丁短语rota dialis, daily wheel (rotate diurnal )，一种古代测太阳运转的日晷，后用来指相关圆形物体。比较印度奥里萨邦Konark Sun Temple, 在入口处可见一巨大的日晷石雕，再往里依次是梳洗图，劳作图，性爱图，即人一天的作息规律。
日署[di=day,表示"日,日子"]
n.钟(表)面,刻度盘,拨号盘v.拨号,打电话In the college, I alleged that I recollected the dialog in dialect about the dial collection.在学院里我宣称忆起关于收集到度盘用方言进行的对话.



verb intransitive or transitive (-ll- or  US USUALLY  -l-) ADVANCED  ■to operate a telephone or make a telephone call to someone by pressing a particular series of buttons with numbers, or moving a disc with numbers, on the telephone 拨号，按号码
•Can I dial this number direct , or do I have to go through the operator?我可以直接拨这个号码还是需要透过话务员接转？

•Dial 0 for the switchboard.总机拨0。

['daɪ.əl] noun countable MEASURING DEVICE  测量仪器  ■the part of a machine or device which shows you a measurement of something such as speed or time 表盘，仪表盘
•Can you read what it says on the dial?你能读出仪表盘上的读数吗？

•The dial of/on his watch (= the part of it which has the numbers on it) had a picture of Mickey Mouse on it.他手表的表盘上有一个米奇老鼠的图案。
■a device on an instrument which you move in order to control it or make changes to it 旋钮，调节器
•You turn this dial to find a different radio station.转动这个旋钮可选择不同的广播电台。

['daɪ.əl] noun countable TELEPHONE  电话  ■the disc with numbers on old-fashioned telephones which you turn when you make a telephone call （老式电话机的）拨号盘



n. 转盘； [仪] 刻度盘；钟面
 - rotating disc, turntable
examples: 英 ['daɪəl] 美 ['daɪəl]
n.拨号盘；刻度盘；日晷；钟面v.拨号；打电话

(1) The phone number is on the dial.(2) Please clean the telephone set including the dial.(3) The dial records very slight variations in pressure.(4) Can you read the number on the dial?(5) What is the good of a sun dial in the shade?(6) The clock dial is illuminated at night.(7) There was a dial that showed when the bus left.(8) Put in the money before dialing.(9) What number shall I dial to get long - distance ?(10) Is there any discount if I dial in the evening?
(1) 号码就在拨号盘上。(2) 请将电话机清理一下,包括拨号盘。(3) 刻度盘显示出压力有微小变化。(4) 你能读出刻度盘上的读数吗？(5) 日晷在暗中，如何起作用?(6) 那只钟面是夜光的。(7) 那里有个钟面，指明开车的时间。(8) 拨电话前先把钱放进去。(9) 要打长途怎么拨号?(10) 晚上打电话优惠吗?
[sound:youdao-a6c6632d-8bccc58f-58f08053-772de027-d9c4b9af.mp3]

translation:
n. 方言，土语; 语调; [语]语支; 专业用语

分布：方言(98%)，地方话(2%)


→dia-, 穿过，相互。-lect, 说，词源同lecture, legible. 即人与人之的对话交流，后用来指区域性的语言，即方言。
方言(dia在...之间+lect→在一部分人之间说→方言)[lect,leg=speak,read,表示"讲,读"]
n.方言In the college, I alleged that I recollected the dialog in dialect about the dial collection.在学院里我宣称忆起关于收集到度盘用方言进行的对话.
【记】dia2人相对，lect说－2人对着说－方言



noun countable or uncountable ■a form of a language that people speak in a particular part of a country, containing some different words and grammar, etc. 方言，土语，地方话
•a regional dialect地区方言

•The poem is written in northern dialect.这首诗是用北方方言写成的。





tone, dialect, accent

这三个名词意思相近，容易混淆。
tone: n.语气，音调，指说话人的口气或声音的高低、轻重等。
 • He speaks to his baby in soft tones.   他用柔和的语调和他的婴儿说话。
dialect: n.方言，土语，地方话，指一个地区人们所使用的语言。
 • the Yorkshire dialect   约克郡方言the Sichuan dialect四川方言
accent: n.口音，指某一地区语言的发音特征；重音。
 • He speaks English with a Spanish accent.   他讲英语带有西班牙口音。



speech, laguage, tongue, slang, dialect, idiom

这组词都有“语言”的意思，其区别是：
speech: 特指人的口语，也指正式的讲话。
laguage: 普通用词，含义广。指人的语言或文字，或动物的语言。既可指口头或书面语言，也可指手势语等。
tongue: 书面用词，指人的语言，亦指人的母语。
slang: 指俚语。
dialect: 指一种语言中，某一地方所特有的语言形式，即方言。
idiom: 指一种语言中一般由几个词结合成短语或句子的特殊表达方式，即惯用语、成语。也指方言。


n. 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
 - patois, provincialism
examples: 英 ['daɪəlekt] 美 ['daɪəlekt]
n.方言；地方话

(1) Every now and then he would lapse into the local dialect.(2) She speaks a dialect, not the Queen's English.(3) The dialect is spoken principally in the rural areas.(4) The use of dialect lent great charm to the work .(5) Do you speak Sichuan dialect?
(1) 他讲话中时而不自觉地冒出地方方言。(2) 她说一口方言，不是标准英语。(3) 这种方言主要在农村地区使用。(4) 方言的运用给这部作品增添了巨大的魅力。(5) 你会说四川话吗？
[sound:youdao-2d4cdfcc-ef4d2396-85f1c512-5d4e2111-a7addfda.mp3]

translation:

n.(dialogue)对话,对白In the college, I alleged that I recollected the dialog in dialect about the dial collection.在学院里我宣称忆起关于收集到度盘用方言进行的对话.




n. 对话；会话
 - conversation, sesion
examples: 英 ['daɪəlɒg] 美 ['daɪəˌlɒg]
n.对话；对白=dialogue
(1) At last there can be a reasonable dialog between our two governments.(2) The writer is not very good at writing dialogs.
(1) 我们两国最后终于能理智地进行对话了。(2) 这个作家不太擅长写对白。

translation:
n. 直径，直径长; 放大率

分布：直径(100%)


→dia-, 穿过。-meter, 测量。用于数学名词直径。
直径(dia+meter测量→对着测量(圆)直径)[dia-表示"穿过,二者之间"]
直径(dia对面+meter→-量到对面的线→直径)[meter,metr,meas,mens=measure,表示"计量,测量等"]
n.直径The veteran in velvet found that the diameter of the thermometer was one metre.穿天鹅绒的老兵发现温度计的直径为一米.
【记】dia穿过，meter测量－穿过圆心可测量圆的面积的线－直径 



US [-ə.tˌɚ] noun countable or uncountable ■(the length of) a straight line that reaches from one point on the edge of a round shape or object, through its centre, to a point on the opposite edge 直径
•The diameter measures twice the radius.直径是半径的两倍。

•The pond is six feet in diameter.这个池塘的直径为六英尺。
examples: 英 [daɪ'æmɪtə(r)] 美 [daɪ'æmɪtər]
n.直径
(1) The diameter of the tree-trunk is about 2 meters.(2) We must gauge the diameter of wire first.(3) The axis of a circle is its diameter.
(1) 这树干的直径大约是2米。(2) 我们必须先测量电线的直径。(3) 圆的轴线是其直径。
[sound:youdao-abb9457a-d13f7ec2-bec384f3-0a34b8c8-aa34f466.mp3]

translation:
n. 钻石，金刚石; 菱形; 方块
vt. 镶钻石于; 用钻石装饰
adj. 金刚石的; 菱形的; 用钻石装饰的

分布：钻石(87%)，菱形(11%)，用钻石装饰(1%)，棒球内场(1%)


→来自拉丁语adamans, 不可驯服的，词源同adamant. a-, 不，非，-dam, 同tame, 驯服。用来指钻石。
n.金钢石,钻石;菱形The man beyond the bond is fond of the second wonderful diamond.那位不受约束的人喜欢第二颗奇异的钻石.



noun STONE  石   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■an extremely hard valuable stone which is used in jewellery, and in industry for cutting hard things 钻石，金刚石
•a diamond ring/necklace钻戒／钻石项炼

•The tiara was set with diamonds and rubies.头饰上镶嵌着钻石和红宝石。

•He had worked in the diamond mines of South Africa.他曾在南非的钻石矿上干活。

•diamond-tipped saw blades金刚石锯片
diamonds [plural noun] ■jewellery made from diamonds 钻石珠宝；钻饰
•Shall I wear the diamonds or the pearls with this dress?我到底是戴钻石还是珍珠来配这件礼服好呢？

['daɪə.mənd] noun SHAPE  形体   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a shape with four straight sides of equal length, forming two opposite angles which are wide and two which are narrow 菱形
•Joe's socks had diamond patterns on them.乔的袜子上有菱形图案。
countable ■a card, with a red diamond shape on it, which belongs to one of the four suits in a set of playing cards 方块（扑克牌的四种花色之一）
•the six of diamonds方块六
countable ■the square part of a field on which baseball is played, which is surrounded by the four bases , or the whole field on which the game is played 棒球场，棒球场地



n. [宝] 钻石， [矿物] 金刚石； [数] 菱形；方块牌
 - sparkler, adamas
adj. [数] 菱形的；金刚钻的
 - rhombic
examples: 英 ['daɪəmənd] 美 ['daɪəmənd]
n.钻石；菱形；棒球内场；纸牌的方块vt.用钻石装饰

(1) She wore a diamond clip on her new dress.(2) The diamond ring on her finger glittered in the light.(3) Her bedroom curtains have a diamond pattern.(4) Mr Smith laid off a baseball diamond on the vacant lot.(5) You must play a diamond if you have one.
(1) 她在新衣服上戴了一枚钻石别针。(2) 她手指上的钻石戒指在灯光下闪闪发光。(3) 她卧室的窗帘有菱形的图案。(4) 史密斯先生在空地上划出棒球内场的界线。(5) 如果你有方块就必须出。

translation:
n. 日记，日志; 日记簿

分布：日记(97%)，日记簿(3%)


→来自拉丁语dies, 白天，词源同diurnal. 即一日记录。
日记[di=day,表示"日,日子"]
n.日记,日记簿In the library, arbitrary the librarian wrote the auxiliary diary about military literature.在图书馆,武断的图书管理员写下了有关军事文学的辅助日记.



US ['daɪr.i] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a book with a separate space or page for each day, in which you write down your future arrangements, meetings, etc., or one used to record your thoughts and feelings or what has happened on that day 日程簿；日记，日志
•Don't forget to write/enter the date of the meeting in your diary.别忘了在日程簿上标出开会的日期。

(1) His father ordered that he (should) keep a diary in English.(2) I keep a draiy every day.(3) There is no further reference to him in her diary.(4) The preface of this diary recounted her life.(5) This diary is interleaved with blotting-paper.
(1) 他的父亲规定他要用英文写日记。(2) 我每天记日记。(3) 她的日记中没有进一步提到他。(4) 这本日记的前言叙述了她的生活。(5) 这个日记簿插有吸墨纸。

translation:
vt. 口述; 命令，指示; 使听写; 控制，支配
vi. 口述; 命令

时态：dictated, dictating, dictates
分布：规定(37%)，口授(24%)，听写(16%)，指挥(13%)，指令(10%)


→来自词根dict, 说，命令，词源同dictionary.
口授;命令;听写(dict+ate说话→口授,命令)[dict,dic=say,assert,表示"说话,断言"]
v.口授;(使)听写;指令,指示,命令;The teacher dictated to the whole class.老师给全班同学作了听写.
【记】dict讲话，命令；参：abdicate（v 退位；放弃）【参】dictator（n 独裁者；口授令他人笔录者）；



US [ˈ--]GIVE ORDERS  下命令   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to give orders, or state something exactly, with total authority 命令，下（令）；决定，规定
•The UN will dictate the terms of troop withdrawal from the region.联合国将决定军队从该地区撤军的条件。

•[+ question word] He disagrees with the government dictating wh at children are taught in schools.他不同意由政府来决定孩子在学校学习哪些课程。

•[+ that] The tennis club rules dictate that suitable footwear must be worn on the courts.网球俱乐部的规则规定上场必须穿适当的运动鞋。
 ADVANCED  transitive ■to influence something or make it necessary 影响；决定；要求
•The party's change of policy has been dictated by its need to win back the support of voters.该党政策上的变化是由于它需要赢回选民的支持。

•[+ that] I wanted to take a year off, but my financial situation dictated that I got a job.我想休息一年，但我的经济状况迫使我必须工作。

verb UK [dɪkˈteɪt] US [ˈ--]SPEAK  说  intransitive or transitive ■to speak something aloud for a person or machine to record the words said, so that they can be written down 口述，口授
•I dictated my order over the phone.我透过电话口述了命令。

•She spent the morning dictating letters to her secretary.她花了一上午的时间向秘书口述信件。

verb UK [dɪkˈteɪt] US [ˈ--]  Phrasal Verbs   dictate to sb ■to tell someone what to do 告诉（某人）怎么做，指挥（某人）
•The President is so powerful that he is able to dictate to the government.总统的权力很大，他能够指挥政府。

•I will not be dictated to like that!我不愿意那样受人摆布！

noun countable usually plural /ˈdɪk.teɪt/ formal ■an order which should be obeyed, often one which you give to yourself 命令；（对自身的）要求
•the dictates of conscience/common sense良心／情理的驱使
 Compare diktat



vt. 命令；口述；使听写
 - require, order, command
n. 命令；指示
 - instruction, order, bidding, telling, word
examples: 英 [dɪk'teɪt] 美 ['dɪkteɪt]
vi.听写vt.口授；规定；决定，影响n.命令，支配，主宰；指挥；指令

(1) The teacher dictated a passage to the class.(2) He was dictating a letter to his secretary.(3) He can't write but he can dictate.(4) Businessmen often dictate their letters.(5) You can't dictate to people how they should live.(6) If I had the dictatorial power in a dictatorship, I will dictate those IT be kept in detention for appearing too pretentious.(7) It belongs to me to dictate to them.
(1) 老师给全班同学听写一段文章。(2) 他在向秘书口授信稿。(3) 他不会写但会说。(4) 商人常口授信稿令人笔录。(5) 不能强行规定人们应该怎样生活。(6) 我假如拥有独裁政治的专断权，我会命令把她关起来，罪名是外表炫耀做作。(7) 我有指挥他们的权责。

translation:
n. 口授，听写; 听写测验; 命令

分布：听写(69%)，口述(23%)，命令(8%)


n.听写,口述;命令We had a dictation today.我们今天听写了.



noun uncountable ■when someone dictates something for someone else to write down 口述，口授
•I'll ask my assistant to take dictation (= write down what I say).我会请我的助手来作口述记录。
countable ■a test in which a piece of writing is dictated to students learning a foreign language, to test their ability to hear and write the language correctly 听写，默书
•Our French dictation lasted half an hour.法语听写持续了半个小时。




n. 听写；口述；命令
 - instruction, bidding, order, word, charge
examples: 英 [dɪk'teɪʃn] 美 [dɪk'teɪʃn]
n.听写；口述；命令

(1) The teacher gave the pupils dictation.(2) We have a dictation every English class.(3) I hated it if I ever had to take dictation from him.(4) The pupils wrote at their teacher's dictation.(5) She was tired of her husband's dictation.
(1) 教师让学生听写。(2) 每次上英语课我们都进行听写测验。(3) 如果我总是不得不作他的口授记录员，我会感到讨厌的。(4) 学生按照老师的口述写下来。(5) 她对丈夫的发号施令感到厌烦。

translation:
n. 词典，字典; [自]代码字典

分布：字典(51%)，词典(44%)，辞典(5%)


→来自diction, 说话，措辞。后用来指字典。
字典(diction+ary→措词的书→字典)[dict,dic=say,assert,表示"说话,断言"]
字典(diction措词+ary)[-ary 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"人,场所,物"]
n.词典,字典The dictator predicted the contradiction in the dictionary.独裁者预言了字典中的矛盾.



US [-er.i] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a book that contains a list of words in alphabetical order with their meanings explained or written in another language, or a similar product for use on a computer 字典，词典
•a French-English/English-French dictionary法英／英法词典

•a bilingual/monolingual dictionary双语／单语词典

•To check how a word is spelt, look it up in a dictionary.要确定单词的拼法就查词典。
 ESSENTIAL  ■a book which gives information about a particular subject, in which the entries (= words or phrases) are given in alphabetical order 专业词典
•a biographical/science dictionary人名／科技词典

•a dictionary of quotations引语词典




n. 字典； [语]  [计] 词典
 - lexicon, wordbook
examples: 英 ['dɪkʃənri] 美 ['dɪkʃəneri]
n.字典；辞典；词典

(1) That is not, properly speaking, a dictionary but a grammar book.(2) He is, as it were, a walking dictionary.(3) That dictionary belongs to me.(4) A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language.(5) Dictionary writers must be skilled in the art of definition.
(1) 严格地说，那不是一本字典，而是一本语法书。(2) 他可说是个活字典。(3) 那本字典是属于我的。(4) 在学习一种新语言时,辞典是非常有用的工具。(5) 词书编纂者必须精於给词语下定义的技巧。
[sound:youdao-e14c98e7-e541ec65-fb383961-b9361f65-c1ed94e5.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 死亡，熄灭; 凋零，枯萎; 渴望，盼望
n. 钢型，硬模; 骰子

时态：died, dying, dies
分布：死(92%)，消失(4%)，印模(1%)，骰子(1%)，渴望(1%)，金属模子(1%)


→来自dheu, 离开，死亡，词源同dead, death.die 骰子
vi.死,死亡;(草木)枯萎,凋谢;渴望The lying liar lied to the dying diet maker that the tie was dyed blue.躺着的说谎者对临死的食疗制作者谎称带子染成了兰色.



verb intransitive (dying, died, died) ESSENTIAL  ■to stop living or existing, either suddenly or slowly 死去，死亡，过世
•Twelve people died in the accident.12人在此次事故中丧生。

•She died of/from hunger/cancer/a heart attack/her injuries.她死于饥饿／癌症／心脏病／伤害。

•It is a brave person who will die for their beliefs.愿为信念而死的人称得上是勇敢者。

•I should like to die in my sleep (= while I am sleeping).我愿在睡梦中死去。

•Many people have a fear of dying.很多人害怕死亡。

•Our love will never die.我们的爱将永不消逝。

•She will not tell anyone - the secret will die with her.她不会告诉任何人——这个秘密会烂在她的肚子里。
die a natural/violent death ■to die naturally, violently, etc 自然死亡／死于非命等
•He died a violent death.他死于非命。

•My grandmother died a natural death (= did not die of illness or because she was killed) , as she would have wanted.我祖母寿终正寝，这是她所希望的结局。
■informal ■If a machine stops working, or if an object cannot be used or repaired any more, usually because it is very old, people sometimes say it has died 停止运转，报废
•The engine just died on us.那台引擎刚好报废在我们手里。

•humorous He wore his jeans until they died.他把那条牛仔裤一直穿到不能再穿为止。

[daɪ] verb intransitive (dying, died, died)almost/nearly die of sth (also could have died of sth) ■to feel a particular feeling extremely strongly 强烈地感受到，…得要命
•I almost/could have died of embarrassment.我窘迫得要命。

[daɪ] verb intransitive (dying, died, died)be dying for/to do sth  ADVANCED  ■to be extremely eager to have or do something 极想得到，极想做
•I'm dying to hear your news.我特别想听到你的消息。

•I'm dying for a cup of tea.我非常想喝一杯茶。
